description:
Awesome place in SF! Checking out local places to eat this came up on my search and am a huge Mac and Cheese fan and had to come try it out! 

The buffalo chicken topped with Hot Cheetos was amazing. The portions are great and the meal is super hearty. Really recommend this combo and add on. 

Tagged along with a nice bottle of coke was definitely refreshing with the spice from the buffalo sauce and hot cheetos.
author: Vikash K.

description:
Let me begin by saying my favorite food group is Mac and cheese.  Before moving to San Francisco a few weeks ago I had actually heard of this place while living in Alabama from one of those random videos on Facebook that tell you about cool places around the country. It wasn't from a mac'd sponsored ad. It mad such an impact though that even only seeing the video one time I knew I had to try this place at some point. Now I live just a few blocks from it and had to go the day I moved here. 

So the service was ehh but the menu has a good number of options and not too many options. The Mac and cheese itself was quite good. It's like a fancy Mac and cheese not the creamy style that I am used to from the south. I still enjoyed it.
author: Alex J.

description:
Ate here tonight. We were looking for some comfort food, and nothing too fancy. We got 3 Build-Your-Own items. We loved that you could get a dish with cauliflower instead of pasta - yah! So:

- Basic sauce over cauliflower, with broccoli and Korean short ribs. Yummy, cheesy, and nice large piece of rib.
- Goddess sauce (garlic) with pasta shells, bacon, peas, and topped with panko.
- Basic sauce over cauliflower, with broccoli, bacon, and mushrooms, topped with Hot Cheetos!

All were delicious. The portions are generous, so each of us had enough for a good sized leftover.

Very good to try!
author: June W.

description: DAMN!!!! That sums this place up pretty well. Where do I begin with how great the food was? You can create your own magic and change it up each time to relieve that oh my god feeling.
author: Kris F.

description:
Came here on a Sunday around 11:30AM. Originally thought they were going to be super busy and have extremely long lines but that wasn't the case. 

This is definitely a self serve place. So once you come in, you go straight to the cashier to order your food. I got the original cheese dish with bacon, hot Cheetos, parmesan, and chicken in it. Toppings are unlimited unless otherwise noted (some toppings they charge). Process was quick and easy. You grab your own water, fork, and napkin. Sit anywhere you want and then wait for your food to be called. Mine took about a 10-12 min wait, which was super quick. On the table, they have 4-5 hot sauces that you can add to your dish - even sriracha! 

The food was super super delicious. I've had hot Cheeto Mac n cheese at a place in Long Beach and this place really exceeded my expectations. It was cheesy, savory, a little Smokey, and crunchy because of the hot Cheetos! We even got the Brussels Sprouts with garlic. Oh man! I honestly hate Brussels sprouts but this one made me change my mind. Theirs was crunchy and roasted, came with a side of ranch and I was just blown away! 

Definitely recommend everyone to come try this place. It was $12 for the dish and it was enough for lunch and dinner. Bang for your buck and great food? I'll be back
author: Sherluna V.

description: It sounds like I'm not alone with this complaint... Mac'D definitely needs to figure out their system. The girl taking orders warned us it would take 20 minutes (which I would be fine with) but it ended up taking 1 hour +. The concept is good & the meals are large and reasonably priced... the restaurant just needs to figure out how to serve food to hungry customers in a reasonable amount of time.
author: Sara S.

description:
I recall first hearing about this place on food network or a tv show for must have foods. I think some people were even saying that this was the Mac and Cheese version of Chipotle.

Initially coming on a random Sunday afternoon, it was pretty empty even thought I've heard that the line can get pretty long. I got the Hellapeno sauce, with shells, chorizo, hot dogs, bacon broccoli, panko, parmesan and hot cheetos. If you don't want to make your own

They also had a small menu right by the cashier explaining each of their cheese sauces so for those who are curious what goes into their sauces. The portion size I thought was initially very average, however the whole meal was incredibly dense. I like to think of myself as a big eater and even this had me at near full capacity. It was to the point that I didn't want to finish my fries and had to save it for later which is not often. 

The place is pretty self serve, you go order at the cashier, then you grab all your own utensils and such and you wait for your name to be called to grab your order. 

Would definitely recommend for everyone to try. Reasonably priced and great portions and good food. Can't really say more about it.
author: Timothy D.

description:
I never heard about this place before
It was recommended by a friend of mine as it's a must try thing in SF and I totally agree!! 
The options of the sauces, pastas, protein"need to be a little more", veggies toppings are FUN!! 
I went with 3 friends each one tried a different sauce so I ended up trying 4 different ones and all were PRETTY GOOD!! 
The dish is pretty big so I ate dinner and lunch the next day for less than $15 .. GOOD DEAL!! 
It's absolutely a fun experience and good food but not very healthy though ;) 
But if you're a Mac and cheese lover goo for it!!
author: Maha M.

description:
This place was simple but delicious. I loved the build your own Mac and cheese option. They have different cheese sauces, fresh  ingredients to add  and topping like panko breadcrumbs or for the adventurer in your life hot Cheeto crumbs! 

I ordered the build your own Mac with The Hellapeño sauce, I added chicken, Bacon and jalapeño's. The cheese sauce was so good and creamy with a little kick and a bit of sweetness as described! The chicken was tender and juicy, the bacon was cut well and a bit thick and of course the jalapeños added that extra spice! 

My girlfriend ordered the build your own Mac with the basic sauce and she opted for some "healthier" ingredients. She added broccoli , Peas, and bacon. The cheese sauce was everything but basic it was really good! The broccoli was cooked well and added a crunch. My girlfriend loved the peas and so did I it added a nice sweetness. The bacon added a savory note to tie in all the vegetables. 

Overall, If your craving Mac and Cheese then make your way down to Mac'D. There ability to customize your craving is spot on and if you can't decide they have a prebuilt menu.
author: EJ A.

description: My 21 year old daughter loves mac n cheese so on the way home from HMB we stopped to celebrate her birthday. Located just off the 101 this place is easy to miss. Look for the smiling macaroni on the outside. I we all got the goddess sauce. I added bacon, jalapeño, and flaming Cheetos to mine. I had a good head sweat going halfway thru. Not the best mac n cheese but certainly better than most. I suggest adding Parmesan as a topping to expand in the cheesy ness. Portions are good as my wife and daughter had to get to go boxes for theirs. They had a few local brews on tap as well.
author: Vince S.

description:
Came on a weekday for lunch.  It was fairly quiet.  Menu is basic; mac and cheese, fries, wings, and drinks.  They also have beer on tap.  Start by choosing your choice of sauce, then choose your choice of pasta, then choose the items you want stired in, then choose your toppings.  The mac and cheese comes in one size which is enough for a large meal.  You could also share an order of mac and cheese and get an order of wings or fries to share.  I ordered the basic cheese sauce with chicken, bacon, peas inside, with panko bread crumbs on top.  I liked what I ordered, but I wouldn't say it was the best mac and cheese I've ever had.  On the tables is hot sauce and napkins.  The togo boxes, water, napkins, and utensils are self serve.  Interior was neatly decorated.  Service was nice, but not over the top.  They need some AC or fans for the summer days as it gets hot in there.

Order at the counter, then sit down and listen for your name to be called.  

Depending when you come, parking is pretty easy on the street within a couple blocks.
author: Alan H.

description: Overall the atmosphere was laid back and chill. Food was above average for sure but the thing I didn't like was the amount of grease/oil from the food hence the 4 stars. Pretty sure I would come back in the future.
author: Tony W.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE.
Build your own mac n cheese place!? Uh hellllll yeah!! I was so excited when I first found out about MAC'D. I couldnt wait to try.. and once I did I couldnt stop talking about it. Went in on a Saturday afternoon with my bf and luckily there was no wait! I ordered The Goddess with elbow pasta, chicken, bacon, and mushroom, topped with truffle oil and hot cheetos.. and it was the best thing ever! Everything came out to about $12ish, which isn't bad because they give a good amount of food. Yup, this place is a two thumbs up and a 5 star rating for me!
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Hits the spot!! 

I was in the mood for some comfort food and thought mac n cheese would be perfect, so yelp brought me here. You start by picking your sauce, then pasta, followed by your choice of toppings.. all for $11.

I had The Goddess, which is a white sauce, with shells (they taste better imo!), chorizo and bacon of course, topped with parmesan, panko, hot cheetos, and truffle oil. Holyyyy shiiiz it was pretty good!! I'm a little ashamed I was able to finish the entire order, but it was so good I'd do it again. FYI one bowl is good to feed 2-3 ppl!

I thoroughly enjoyed my mac n cheese and thought the trip out to SF was worth it. Totally would eat here again 0:)
author: Jenny L.

description:
MAC'D is an obvious hit with mac and cheese obsessed people everywhere. But I've found that even my friends who don't like mac and cheese crave this place, because you can customize it to make it into something you like!

I think my favorite so far is definitely the buffalo sauce with any variation of toppings I happen to be craving at the moment. The mac and cheese is every bit as gooey and delicious as you hope it'll be. I heard this place was a kickstarter come to life, and honestly, it definitely seems like a dream come true. MAC'D also has a good selection of hot sauces on each table. Another subtle thing that I like about MAC'D is that they have one of those jugs of water that you can just get water from yourself instead of having to ask. 

I'd say the only thing that would make it 5 stars is having more options for toppings. I'd like to see some spam or crunchy onion bits or any other interesting toppings in the future.
author: Claire C.

description:
I got a give credit where it's due, this place takes drunk food to a new level. Usually you just need the food to be filling or greasy, but here its actually pretty darn great. It sets a pretty high bar for late night spots. 

Like honey sriracha Brussels sprouts that are seriously better than most restaurants!? And Mac and cheese with some light fix-ins (for which I'd argue less is more) that gets the balance of cheese and pasta pretty spot on. Oh and a side of buffalo sauce to dip it in which is authentically classic. And the mac and cheese is huge, honestly one order is enough for two or three people to share easily.
author: Jason S.

description:
If you love Mac n' Cheese then Mac'D is for you! This is a little gem hidden in the Marina and is rather easy to get to. I came on a Saturday afternoon and didn't have to wait at all (although there was a street festival going on a few streets down, so perhaps that's where the crowds went). We took a ride to the place but there did seem to be street parking available!

As soon as we entered the property you see the "Stay Cheesin'"neon sign on an art wall. To your right you can walk straight to the counter where you see a large menu on the wall that depicts the price ($11) where you can choose your sauce, pasta, mix-ins and toppings. I chose to go with the garlic sauce, shell pasta, bacon, corn, peas, panko and parmesan. Do note that although most mix-ins are included in the initial price, but some options (mostly the meat/seafood options) cost a few extra dollars. At the time I went they ran out of broccoli so the cashier informed me that they were allowing brussels sprouts as a substitute. 

We waited no longer than ten minutes for our dishes to come out and when we got them they were literally perfection. The servings are also rather large -- I finished less than half before feeling fully satisfied. They have easy to grab to-go containers right next to the dish return area. If you have a general small appetite, I would say that simply eating the mac and cheese dish is sufficient. I initially wanted to order some fries on the side but I am glad I didn't because the serving size of the fries is huge (nearly as big as the bowl of mac and cheese) and I definitely wouldn't have finished it considering I couldn't even finish my main dish. 

Overall, I had a great experience at this place and the idea of building your own quality mac and cheese is just super awesome. I would definitely go back next time I am in the area!
author: Danielle S.

description:
If you're on social media in any shape or form then you might've seen this place pop up in your news feed. If you're wondering if MAC'D is worth going to, have no fear, I am here to alleviate your curiosity. Yes. 

Well, it's worth trying once if you sorta like mac and cheese. Otherwise it's a bit overrated. Think of MAC'D as a chipotle but for mac and cheese. Customize your bowl however you like with however many toppings you like. The portions are decent but with cheese being the main attraction here, it's a dense meal. There's nothing particularly mind-blowing about the mac and cheese but it's a unique dining experience nonetheless.

The line can vary depending on when you go, it was near empty when I came on an early Thursday night though the weekends may be substantially busier.
author: Derek T.

description: After watching an insider video online, my friends and I decided to give this place a try. We were not disappointed. The portions are huge, the customization is awesome, and the food is delicious. Parking is meh. We were lucky enough to find a spot nearby. We did however have to wait a little while for the food. I would definitely recommend getting the hot cheeto dust.
author: Cassandra G.

description:
This place can get packed pretty quickly but the food is really good. You get to pick everything, noodles, sauce, toppings. It's a super hearty portion so you could definitely split one between two people. 

We also ordered brussels sprouts which were really good too. Definitely one of my favorite mac n cheese spots in the City.
author: Whitney D.

description:
We finally visited MAC'D yesterday. I feared that they would be closed (Memorial Day); but, we were pleased to find them open.

CONCEPT: Simply put, Mac'd focuses on offering custom mac-n-cheese. Like a Chipotle, Pieology or Subway, you're the author of your dish. 

1.) Choose cheese sauce (from 5-6 options).
2.) Choose pasta (from four options).
3.) Choose unlimited mix-ins (including 15-16 meats, veggies, etc.).
4.) Choose unlimited toppings (from 6-8 options).

It is all about the OPTIONS. Most of these options go very well together. I suppose that failure can be an option. However, it is a certainty if you never try. 

LOCATION: Mac'd is located in the beautiful Marina District (just off of Lombard) near the corner of Chestnut and Fillmore. There is plenty of free parking along Fillmore or one of the cross streets. 

If you're a tourist biking to the Golden Gate Bridge, then this might be a perfect place to order something. You can take it to go and have a nice picnic next to the bay with scenic views of the bridge just a five blocks away. 

FOOD: I loved it. Not only was the mac-n-cheese fantastic, but the sides and appetizers were great too. We ordered some fried pickles. I noticed others ordering garlic parmesian truffle or cheese fries. Someone ordered one of their three varieties of hot wings. 

DRINKS: Standard bottles, cans and pitchers. No fountain sodas. Water is free.

AMBIANCE: The location is nice. However, it was strangely quiet. There was a big television that wasn't turned on -- odd given the fact that Game 7 of the NBA Western Conference Finals was on (complete with the Golden State Warriors).  

I would recommend that the store needs to achieve something a bit more memorable for ambiance. Either turn on the TV (with volume), play the radio or offer some sort of soft and "inspired" instrumental music (maybe jazz) that sets a mood for this particular location. Otherwise, the ambiance is the greatest weakness of the location. It is forgettable. 

OVERALL: This is worth a visit if you're in the area. It offers great food from an interesting concept near one of the most lovely areas of the city.
author: Chris M.

description:
Awesome mac with pulled pork! Great servings and serves beer. All I can ask for ohhh and open late. 
My first place to stop at while in SF couldn't be greater!
author: Nolan D.

description:
$11-12 for freshly baked Mac&Cheese, exactly how you want it? Okay sign me up! 

The quest to search for reasonably priced food near the Marina at 10:00 PM on a Saturday is no easy task. Yet, brought me to this cheesy goodness. This place closes at 2:00 AM on Fridays and Saturdays so I did see my fair share of drunk folks stumbling in for some food. I was just hungry...

I ordered the goddess sauce with shells, mushrooms, broccoli, truffle oil, and panko bread crumbs... wow. Blown away by how delicious, fast, and on point everything was. You have the choice of unlimited toppings - except for the shrimp and crab of course. But that's a pretty sweet deal for the price of $11. 

The portion was more than enough for me. In fact I only ate about 1/4 of it and saved the rest for later. I could of easily shared 1 for two people. Next time, I'm definitely trying the pesto sauce. 

They definitely mastered the craft of Mac n' Cheese...
author: Joscelynne R.

description:
OMG! Go hungry is where I start this review... options for making your own Mac were insane! So much goodness to choose from. Parmesan garlic truffle oil fries were awesome too! Staff was helpful and quick to get orders out. Although after we ordered it got busy and the wait backed up quickly. 
We will be back, but definitely won't go when dieting lol!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
I personally got super stoked when I heard that they had a restaurant that focused primarily on macaroni and cheese...People might wonder "Why would someone pay to eat macaroni and cheese at a restaurant?" You're right. I was probably too lazy. But honestly, they do it well here.

First off, I like the system: Choose a sauce, a noodle-type, Add-on's (meats, veggies), and toppings (hot Cheeto crumbs, truffle oil, parmesan, panko, etc). It's $11 to get a bowl of mac here. The portion is pretty big here (if it weren't for my eating ambition, I might have been able to save half of it...but I didn't).

I got "The Goddess" sauce (cheddar+jack+Asiago+Garlic), shell pasta noodle (didn't go for elbow cause elbow is so yesterday--just kidding), bacon, peas (to reenact a Pasta Carbonara...I think I was unconsciously craving it), Mushrooms, and Parmesan and Panko (for the toppings, as suggested by the cashier). DELICIOUS. SATISFYING. GLAD I CAME.

I personally had a blast here cause I came early and it was empty, so I got to LOL and almost choke while watching Kevin Hart and Ken Jeong learn how to "do ballet" while I was eating my Mac (you can check it out on YouTube if you have time).

Too tired to write more, but the service was good and the place was pretty and clean.
author: Christine H.

description: We saw a video of MAC'D on Facebook a few weeks ago before coming, my boyfriend and I Are big fans of Mac and cheese and we knew it was must. It was our first restaurant when we landed and wow. It was delicious!! We got "The Basic" with chicken and hot Cheetos with a side of "The Basic" fries. YUM
author: Feysi R.

description:
I usually don't like macaroni or cheesy dishes but this place was great. 

I got the shells with hellapeno and hot Cheetos with bacon and sausage.

The taste was great - not too cheesy but rich. 
The serving size was also generous. I eat a lot and this was one of the rare places where I could not finish my plate. It was somewhat spicy, as promised.

The atmosphere is casual, and serving time was relatively quick. Service was good as well. 

I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: John L.

description:
Welcome to mac and cheese heaven! Here's a custom-built mac and cheese starting at only $11. It comes with a bunch of unlimited toppings and mix-ins with a few items at extra charge, but totally worth it.

Since mac and cheese is a heavy pasta dish afterall, the boyfriend and I decided to share one along with a basket of naked fries ($4). You choose your sauce, pasta, mix-ins, and then toppings --pretty simple. We chose the Hellapeno sauce for that spicy kick, shell pasta to really hold all the cheesy sauce, and mixed in essential meats like bacon, chicken, chorizo, and a touch of mushroom for balance. As for the toppings, we added parmesan, panko, and hot cheetos.

The dish filled both of us up the rest of the day --very fulfilling and delicious. The spiciness was perfect and the cheesy sauce was so creamy. The mushrooms really helped balance all of the meat with the chorizo bringing out a strong flavor to the pasta. Although we didn't add the truffle oil, I could smell the aroma of it from other around me --mmm! One dish is perfect to share without feeling overwhelmed. Stay cheesin'!
author: Cindy Z.

description: Long lines, takes a while to make. Mac n cheese is really just ok. Then again I'm pretty picky and my gold standard is trader joes frozen mac and cheese.
author: Mendel L.

description:
I came by one mid-week evening shortly after this location made its appearance. I was waiting for my wife to get out of a late work shift and had some time for dinner.

Mac'D lets you assemble your Mac n' Cheese from a menu. Pick the kind of pasta, the sauce and all your toppings. It's pretty fun and they have great toppings.

The line was really long though and they're not super fast. I waited about 30 minutes to be able to order and 40 minutes before my food was ready. So it's really a fast food but with real restaurant wait times haha.

The food came out and honestly I can do better in my kitchen. It's pasta with sauce and toppings thrown on top and a few minutes in a toaster oven. So essentially it didn't have a lot of crunch. The crunch just came from the bread crumbs on top and the rest was just pretty runny. It tasted great though! but for $12 I thought it was a bit expensive and kind of a gimmick.

Parking around the Marina is pretty easy with all the street spots and the public garages. Also street parking is free before 9 and after... 6pm I think not totally sure on the time here.
author: Thomas L.

description:
I saw this on Facebook buzzfeed and had to try it out! I don't regret it all! 

The place is a small joint super cute seating. Parking we got lucky but it seems it would be hard to find on a busy time. 

The cashier was amazing, explained everything on how to order, or what kinda sauces they have. Seating is a cute setup, and they offer glass bottle sodas. 

We didn't have to wait for our food at all, it came within 10mins. OMGGG the Mac and cheese is amazing! I added literally everything and hot sauce on top and just so creamy and yummy! If you are in San Francisco I highly recommend coming to this place! It's near the palace of fine arts.
author: Laksh M.

description:
This place is a must if you are in SF! Best meal I had for sure!
So many options for Mac and cheese, even vegan and the portions are good. They have unlimited toppings and it's only about $12.
If you don't know what you want, they offer great recommendations and the staff is super nice! 
Definitely worth the calories, will be coming back! If I could give more stars I would.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
You're probably looking at this page because you saw MAC'D on a Facebook video. Well, I'm here to tell you that although this place looks like a Mac & cheese heaven, it is unfortunately not worth the hype. 

I came here (fortunately) on a slower day. I've heard from a few friends that this place can have an hour long wait during their peak hours.

Service was cool. The guy at the register was very friendly and easy going. Helped me out with any questions that I had.

Their options are alright. Decided to try out their "The Goddest" sauce with shell noodles, chicken, and hot Cheetos on top. My food came out Luke warm. It was mildly disappointing. The flavors were lacking, but the grease levels were a bit over the top. I had to take it home because it was just so dense and heavy. 

Will I come here again? Possibly, so that I can try out some of their other flavor options, but its definitely not worth all the hype.
author: Sondra T.

description: I love mac n cheese and this was amazing. Love that they have a cauliflower option over pasta. Food was delicious. It's a little crowded, but so worth it!! Definitely coming back.
author: Henna S.

description:
A very deceptive front and advertising. While I love the concept of this restaurant and what it could be, it simply does not live up to the hype I excepted, considering how good of a job they do marketing this place. We walked in, and it is a small place, self seating, with one person up front to take your order. 

We walked in, and waited, and waited, and waited. 10 minutes go by before the young lady taking orders came back to the register to take a few orders. Then we finally get up to the register and off she goes again for another 5 minutes to clear tables. 

We finally get a chance to order our food. The woman had no recommendations, didn't seem to know the flavor profiles of the food and was just all around in a "I hate being here" mood. I went it order a beer and asked her what IPA style beers they had on hand. She pointed to a small selection of canned beer on the counter and I picked one out. Much to my surprise it was not even close to an IPA it was essentially bud light. 

Anyway, we get a table and take a seat waiting for our food. Watching the staff in this place was like people watching a Walmart. Three people working very hard in the kitchen, a tall Hispanic kid, a short Hispanic man and a shorter woman. The woman from the register seemed to have a massive amount of food in her mouth as you could see every bit of food in her mouth from across the room as she chewed. The guy handing peoples food out seemed to have no issue dishing out not only food but orders to the young woman up front as he merely stood there and shuffled some trays around. 

The food came and it was rather disappointing. The cheese sauce initially has decent flavor, but it quickly does off and they skimp to the max on the mix ins that you select and. The place was very dingy and felt gross. For $35 for two I expected much more. I understand it is San Francisco, but you can find better Mac N Cheese at even Jacks Urban Eats. 2/5 would not go back.

-The Critical Asshole (as I was told lmao)
author: Matt H.

description:
My friends and I watched the video on Facebook and of course needed to come here. We came on a Saturday around 1 pm and the wait was around 20-30 mins with a line out the door. The inside is pretty small and you order at the counter and once it's ready they call your name out. 

For food I had the Goddess sauce with shells, hot Cheetos and truffle oil. They ended up messing up my order when it was delivered by putting hot dogs in it, but since I was so hungry I didn't want to wait for the hassle of them remaking it. The food was still super good & flavorful. A very large portion too. It was kind of an annoying hassle picking out all the meat though. -_-

I'd recommend checking this place out, but be prepared to wait. You'll also want to double check your order too and make sure it's exactly how you ordered.
author: Erika N.

description:
Heaven for Mac and Cheese lovers like me.  Really excited when I saw a video of this place on Facebook. Lucky me, MAC'D is found in my city of SF. 

Choose your type of cheese: original, jalapeño, buffalo, vegan (+$3), etc

Choose your ingredients : over 20 options to choose from ranging from chicken, hot dog, mushrooms, banana peppers, and many more goodness. 

End with your toppings: my favorite are the hot Cheetos and truffle oil. 

You can get as many toppings as you want, but sometimes it's best not to overdo it. If there are too many options for you, you can try some of their recommended recipes. Needless to say... I'll be back.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I loooooove mac n cheese. Finally was able to try this place. The line at 7pm wasn't long but it took forever to order because there was only 1 cashier. Still doesn't explain why it took so long because their menu is small... Whatever the case. Friday night, the line only started getting long around 8pm. The dining area was a bit cramped. Had to squeeze past people to get out and worry about hitting them in the face.

I ordered a regular mac $11, the goddess with elbows, bacon, chicken, ham, chorizo, parm shavings, truffle oil, panko, and hot cheetos. Here's the thing, if the toppings is unlimited, you best believe I'm going to order everything. For the price, the portion was reasonable. This was honestly a really good combo. No ingredient was overwhelming. Though it wasn't as garlicky as I would have liked but it's still good. The elbows were cooked perfectly. I wished there was a bit more hot cheetos shavings on top.

I also ordered the garlic parm truffle fries. I say pass on this. It just tasted like regular fries topped with parmesan. It lacked both garlic and truffle flavor.
author: Benita M.

description:
Customizable Mac n cheese? Does it get any better than this?! With this place, it actually does...because they have hot cheetos available as a mac topping! 

Why I was here // My bf and I came here after an event in the Marina area. We were kind of hungry and luckily for us, this place is open later than most other places in the area.

The process // order first and then grab a seat! Service is super friendly and they make excellent recommendations if you aren't sure what to get. 

Mac // For about 11 bucks you get pick a mac and then put unlimited toppings on them! 
I got the goddess (which is a garlic cheese base), I chose shell pasta, and mixed in chicken, broccoli, corn and banana peppers. Then I topped my mac with hot cheetos and parmesan cheese. 

Overall // This place was a great price for the amount of food you get! The perfect late night comfort food!
author: Emily T.

description:
I'm a sucker for Mac n cheese, so when I saw this place I just had to try it! I came on a Tuesday around 1:30 and there was absolutely no line, which is good because I was so worried about a wait. You can choose your sauce, pasta (elbow, shells, or cauliflower), unlimited add-ins (except crab is an extra $3), and unlimited toppings. 

I got the goddess sauce, which is a garlic cheese sauce, shells, chicken, mushrooms, broccoli, and Parmesan and hot Cheetos on top. It was pretty good! I didn't think it looked like that much food, but I was pretty full about halfway through the dish. It was extremely cheesy, and the sauce wasn't too thick. It was actually a little more liquify than I liked. I personally still like homeroom better, but my brother prefers this place to Mac daddy and homeroom.
author: Frannie Y.

description:
Came here right after seeing this on the Facebook videos and it did not disappoint! 

I kept expectations low because a good portion of the places I see on food videos are super hyped-up, overpriced, and have small portions. Luckily, this was not one of those occasions. 

You get to choose the type of sauce, type of pasta noodle, and as many topping as you want to add in for only $12 (w/tax!) I ordered the pesto mac and cheese with bacon, hot dogs, truffle oil, parmesan, and panko. The portions are pretty big and the food is really filling, there were quite a few people sitting next to us who had a lot of food leftover :( 

Definitely come here if you're a mac and cheese lover like me and want a delicious, delightfully carby meal!!
author: Lydia S.

description:
Anyone else brought here by the darn video going around Facebook introducing this place? Come on, don't be shy. I was one of the victims.

My friend and I had plans to meet up for dinner here around 8pm and even at 8pm the line was out the door and it took a good while just to get a foot in the door and yet still be far away from the counter to order. Their menu isn't super extensive and you are given lots of time to figure out what you want to order which is cool, but the wait was just tiring. And the place isn't relatively big so while you're in line you should also probably keep your eye out on a table opening up. 

I was able to snag a table while my boyfriend and our friends waited in line and for my Mac & cheese I ordered the goddess, elbow macaroni, mushrooms, corn, chorizo, and added crab for an extra $3. Not only that, but I also got an order of their garlic parm truffle fries for $4 or $6. I can't remember correctly, but.... 

Fries - not worth. With a name like "garlic parm truffle" you'd think those fries would be out of the world amazing but they literally tasted like nothing. Like plain ol' fries that you should just throw some salt on top because the cook forgot to do it. 

And my Mac? With crab added for an extra fee? Eh. I should've added some broccoli in first to give my meal some color and then the crab? Pass on that. For $3 extra it was like a journey trying to find the crab in my plate and flavor wise? I could not taste a dang thing. I'm not trying to be cruel, but honestly I feel like Mac and cheese from Popeyes (which I had gotten on Friday after work) was way more satisfying than the Mac and cheese I got here. And they're pricey, too, which added to the bummer.

So why 3 stars? Because it wasn't a completely bad meal. You get fresh Mac & cheese cooked to you and you're able to customize what you want inside which is nice. But the price hurts it. 

As my boyfriend said after our meal, "Babe, don't ever take me to a Mac and cheese place every again, please."
author: Venus L.

description:
Style your own Mac-n-Cheese for ~$11! 

Decorate in 4 steps: 
1) Choose a sauce (comes in basic, buffalo, pesto, hellapeno, vegan, and goddess).
2) Choice of pasta (elbows, shells, and cauliflower).
3) Order unlimited mix-ins (like bacon, crab, corn, etc.)
4) Add unlimited toppings (like parmesan, hot cheetos, and truffle oil)

Mac'd is great because I love that you can build-your-own Mac-n-Cheese for an affordable price with decently sized portions and an excellent variety of mix-ins and toppings. Food prep seemed really slow however; we waited about 20-30 min until it was ready. 

While Mac'd is a great concept, I wasn't super amazed by it. I do love macaroni and cheese, so I might stop by another time and try it again.
author: Michelle L.

description: One of the best places to fulfill your macaroni and cheese craving and to get amazing customer service. It so cheap too for the amount of food you get. I usually get the hellapeno sauce with the shell pasta, chicken, and jalapeños. If you get full very easily, you'll have left overs for the next day. The parking situation can sometimes be a little bit tricky depending on what time you go. It's usually hard for me to find street parking so sometimes we have to do some walking.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I seriously do not understand how this place has so many 5 star reviews. I live very close and was SO excited to try it. I love Homeroom in Oakland, and figured every mac and cheese place would be equally as delicious. I was wrong. After seeing this location run through a few other restaurant attempts and fail, I was sure Mac'D would follow suit. 

The first time I ate there I ordered the crab or lobster mac. It came out grey, and I tried it anyway (I know.. I am a disgusting person). "Maybe it is supposed to look like this?" I thought. I didn't get sick at least, but it was not good, and I didn't finish it. Thinking that maybe seafood wasn't their strong-suit, I tried this place again. It was so incredibly mediocre. "Ok, well, looks like they will definitely go out of business like the last three places that were here." Mac and Cheese is SO good and easy, how do you f*** this up?

Then, I noticed that they had large tour bus groups stop by and all of a sudden there were lines out the door. I feel like Mac'D invested in some serious marketing strategy to get a bunch of people to eat there like it is some SF institution. It is mind blowing because it is just simply OK. If you're looking for amazing Mac and Cheese, head to Oakland and visit Homeroom.
author: Catherine C.

description:
3.5 STARS. Great idea, not so great execution. The poor guy ringing up orders was also bartending and cleaning tables. We were third in line and it took 20 minutes to get our order taken. Mind you that we came in at 5 pm, so by the time the dinner rush hit, the line was out the door and halfway to the end of the block. It also took about 10-15 minutes for our orders to reach our table. 

Since opening, I noticed they removed a bunch of options from their menu such as bacon, cauliflower rice, lobster, etc. I felt of all the meets to remove, bacon should have been the last. I ended up only getting ham in mine because the other meats didn't sound appealing in mac n cheese. They also skimped on the toppings. I barely got any ham or mushrooms. And the panko didn't even cover the top of my dish. The truffle oil was not apparent at all. 

Overall, I was so excited about this concept because I am obsessed with mac n cheese but they just have a couple links to smooth out. Not sure if I'd be back.
author: Annie N.

description:
My friend and I "lucked out" that Mac'd altered their hours for the day opening about 2 hours later than normal which actually allowed us to be first in line. I was happy about this until I saw the available ingredients being posted sans bacon and mushrooms. I eventually came to terms with this but a few people after I ordered, bacon was put up! NOT COOL.

I went with the goddess sauce with shells, chicken, broccoli, and corn. Toppings of extra parm and truffle oil was also added. I'll probably skip the truffle oil next time cause it was put on relatively heavy handed which was kind of off-putting to look at. The extra parm was definitely a great decision though in my book.

Each table has a smorgasbord of hot sauce to choose from and I found the green chile sauce to be an excellent companion.

All in all it was a pretty good meal. Decently cheesy with fairly generous portion sizes. Would I be back? Eh, not if I have to stand in the crazy line that had formed by the time we left.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Had I known that it would've taken 2 HOURS to get my mac and cheese, I would've saved this trip for another day. It took an hour to get to the counter, and another hour to receive our food. Because I hadn't anticipated this, I was late to work but I couldn't even be mad once I tasted the food... it's pretty freaking good LOL.

I planned on getting the mini mac with brussels sprouts, but they were actually out of the mini size when we got there (whatever that means). I went with the regular size mac with hellapeno sauce, elbows, chicken, broccoli, and mushrooms, and topped with panko and parmesan. That's all. But for whatever reason, my mac came with bacon and jalapenos too. I have no idea how they messed that up but the bacon was so good, once again, I couldn't complain LOL. I was a bit upset though, that my food took so long to make since it's customizable, and it still wasn't perfect! At least they didn't leave any toppings out, but they really shouldn't have added things I didn't order. Luckily I don't have any food allergies, but if I did, it could have been really bad!

I think the concept is great, and the food is superb. However, they definitely have kinks they need to work out. An hour wait to order, I can understand. This place is obviously very popular. However, it shouldn't take an hour to make one bowl of mac and cheese, regardless of whether or not it's been customized. That's ludicrous.

TL;DR: don't come here if you're in a rush and leave your diet at the door. 10/10 A1 mac and cheese though.
author: Kathy K.

description:
Eh, I can see why it's all hyped up right now. I'm just glad I didn't have to wait hours like some people did...
Decided to stop by on a Thursday afternoon around 3pm. There was no one waiting and only two tables. Inside is very nice and spacious but the music was really loud. I could barely hear my conversation with my friend. Decor is very hip and modern. I like the neon sign outside the door!

I decided to go with The Goddess with shells and my toppings were: bacon, mushroom, corn, panko, parmesan, and truffle oil. When it came out, the outsides around the bowl were barely warm?? Only the center of the mac was hot ish... There was no long wait or anything so I don't see why it wasn't hot all around. The serving size is pretty big and considering how heavy mac n' cheese is, it definitely filled me up and I took some to go.

Overall, I don't think it would be worth the wait on the weekends. I think Homeroom tops mac n' cheese for me!
author: Kristie L.

description: This is most definitely a novelty experience. One of those places you go to say you went. I tried the pesto Mac and while it was ok (way too oily) i have one piece of advice. Stick to the classic. That's how Mac and cheese is meant to be eaten! While you have unlimited toppings keep it simple too!
author: Drew F.

description:
I LOVE the concept of this place!! Being able to customize your Mac makes it taste much better! 

Bf and I went there on a Saturday around noon and it wasn't TOO busy so we didn't get stuck waiting in line BUT after we ordered was when people started coming in and forming a line. We were able to snag one of the two last tables available as well! 

He ordered shells with "the pesto,"  bacon, crab, and panko toppings. It was extremely yummy!! I ordered shells with "the goddess" with bacon, crab, truffle oil, and hot Cheetos and it was probably my favorite of the two! They were both hot out the oven and extremely cheesy  

Parking is the only downside as this area is pretty busy but we got lucky and found one right across the st from where Mac'd was!

We will definitely be back!!!!
author: Nicole H.

description:
MAC'D is the ultimate late night food spot. Who doesn't want some cheesy pasta after a night out at the bars? I have come to MAC'D after many nights out (and even just for dinner!) and it never disappoints. 

My favorite combo is shells with the regular cheese sauce, with jalapeños and topped with hot Cheetos. You can basically customize your Mac and cheese with any of their sauces and mix in's and toppings. It's magical. The service isn't the fastest, depending on how crowded it is, which is fair. When it's empty, you'll be stuffing your face food within ten minutes of ordering. Plus, the neon "Stay Cheesin'" sign outside is a fun place for pictures. 

I'm knocking one star for the weird physical organization of the place. You have to wait outside and then go to the counter and it makes a lot of sense but is very confusing and people end up cutting each other in line constantly. Still, I understand why they want the restaurant to not be overtaken by the line. I will always return to MAC'D when I'm in the Marina!
author: Ayushi A.

description: This is a great place for amazing, customizable Mac and cheese. It's also good to microwave leftovers, as I couldn't finish the bowl it was so big. The only thing I didn't like is that one of the chefs didn't use gloves while handling the cheese, which is kind of gross. Hopefully he washed his hands before cooking. Other than that, food was great.
author: Gabrielle R.

description:
I decided to give MAC'D another try with a friend today and i'm so glad I did because it was much better than the first time! To recap: last time, my mac was literally doused in hot cheetos so I could not taste anything but that (see picture below VVV! This time, it was muuuch better!

I ordered the hellapeno cheese sauce (honey + jalapeno) with shells and a bunch of toppings while my friend got the pesto cheese sauce with shells and fried chicken. The hellapeno sauce was cheesy, creamy with just the right about of kick! I also added crab and shrimp and some veggies. I also loved my friend's pesto sauce because I love pesto in general. The fried chicken on top had a nicely seasoned, crunchy batter that was super addicting. We also ordered a side of the honey sriracha brussel sprouts and those were super good! I like sweet and spicy combos, so those were right up my alley.

I will be back whenever i'm craving some mac n cheese! I like that they are creating new sauces too.
author: Tara A.

description:
I, too, was drawn to MAC'D after seeing videos on Facebook.

A few friends and I came to MAC'D around 2, and the line wasn't too bad. The cashier was pretty efficient with taking orders. When you order, you get the option of a sauce, pasta shape, mix ins (meats and veggies), and toppings, including things like hot cheetos. You can choose as many mix ins and toppings as you like. It starts at $11, a few dollars extra for premium mix ins or pastas. The vibe of the restaurant is nice, and there is a pretty good amount of seating.

Overall, the food was mediocre. The concept is definitely cool, but the experience was still a disappointment. For one, the food was far too heavy - even for mac and cheese. There was also virtually no chicken in any of our orders. Still, the portions are great and a decent spot to visit if you're looking to indulge.

But that wasn't the real issue. Both my food and my friend's orders were messed up, with the wrong vegetables mixed in. It wasn't a huge issue for me, but my friend had his remade, which took over an hour, when the rest of my group had all finished their meals. Still, the employees were gracious, offering my friend a free side. The remade mac n cheese was still made wrong. :( During our time in the restaurant, there were quite a few people who also send their food back.

I don't think I'll be returning nor do I think it's worth the hype surrounding the Facebook video.
author: Edward C.

description:
$12 for a giant plate of customized mac n' cheese? Don't mind if I do!

I saw a video for this place somewhere on the internet and decided to pencil it in for my annual SF trip. Boy was I impressed!

Tucked in between a bunch of nondescript buildngs in Cow Hollow, this place is a treasure. The menu is limited, and the kitchen is small (so if they're busy, there will be a wait and it will be a little bit). I came during a dead hour (more like dead five minutes) so we only waited about 10 minutes for our food. 

I got the elbow macaroni, with the garlic cheese sauce, mushrooms, truffle oil, crab, parmesan and breadcrumbs. IT WAS SO GOOD. I still crave the deliciousness of this mac n cheese. I ate it so fast I wasn't able to get a picture! 

If you're in the area, PLEASE TRY THIS PLACE OUT. It will not disappoint! It's on my list for next year because of how good it was!

12/10 reccomend!
author: Brittany F.

description:
Meh... cool concept, just not for me food-wise and wait-wise (maybe because we came at 6pm on a Sunday night).

Venue / service:  cute minimalistic interior with light wood floors / tables and white walls.  Unfortunately, half of the wait time is used trying to find a seat.  Waited in line for 30 min and then waited another 10-15 min to nab a table.  I was also getting the feeling that the host was moving a bit slowly taking orders and then casually walking to the back to chat with the chefs and such before coming back out to take more orders- not sure if this was to pace the # of people coming in vs. leaving, but the overall effect was SUPER slow.  Also took a good 30 min to get our food.  

Food: as expected, they serve only mac and cheese, but you can choose the different types of sauces, condiments, and other additions to your plate.  I ordered Elbows with Goddess Sauce (garlic), peas, ham, and panko for $10, which is decent given the HUGE portion they give you.  Pasta was slightly overcooked and I almost wish there was even more cheese (if there's such a thing) - I kinda expected it to be all gooey, cheesy and such but it was more just a bechamel sauce that was light in cheese flavor.  Could have used even more garlic in my goddess sauce since it was slightly light for my taste.  My entire table wasn't able to finish their whole plates, but MAC'D is nice enough to provide to-go boxes for those with smaller stomachs (which I'd say was 80% of the crowd I saw that day).

Personally think this place is over-hyped.  Not a terrible meal, but won't be coming back here b/c the wait and ho-hum meal just wasn't worth it.
author: Audrey H.

description:
Great food! Friendly service :)

Took my friends here when they were in town visiting and it was definitely worth it. Second locatin now on Polk where I work...so happy!!
author: Sue G.

description: My first time ever going, the only reason why I didn't put 5 stars is the price and because the pasta wasn't cooked all the way. Other than that everything else was tasty, this is also a cute teen environment.
author: Cece B.

description: Definitely recommend the Hellapeno sauce! Love that they have hot Cheetos toppings. A good place to satiate a mac n cheese craving. The wings were also not bad.
author: Rene C.

description: Yummy! Saw this place on Facebook so my boyfriend and I had to go check it out. The decor was a little glamorized in the Facebook video and it was pretty low key compared to the video as well. But 5 stars for taste and experience. Will definitely make this a go to stop every city trip.
author: Brandi M.

description:
I came here during a weekday, and there was barely anyone inside! Service was excellent. The cashier was very kind and made the time to ask me how my food was after I was served.  The Mac was good, definitely better than anything I could create myself.  I went for the spicy options, and I felt it was a bit on the mild side.  I would like to see an even spicier sauce available for us who like it hot.  The meal itself is way to filling to finish in one meal, even for someone as big as me.  I took some home and heated it up later! Bomb.com

I will definitely be coming back when I'm in the area.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Ummm, what??? What did I just eat? Bc it wasn't mac n cheese. It was some overcooked pasta with barely any cheese (certainly not cheesy enough to be considered mac n cheese) and STALE hot cheetos sprinklings!! Literally stale. Yuck. 

My friend and I shared one dish. I wanted to go real simple and get the basic mac n cheese with mushroom. Love me some hot cheetos, so how could it go wrong? Went wayyy wrong. 

There was barely anyone there at 7pm on a wknight (two other tables max). It's not like the dish was rushed to be made. If I'm ever craving mac n cheese again, you'll find me at Mac Daddy where the dishes are the same price for exponentially better food and vibes. 

MACD is just here for the IGs. Not the food quality IMO. I won't be returning.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Great Mac & cheese! Choices of sauce, pasta, mix-ins and toppings provided and recommended. I had the shells pasta with mushrooms/peas/jalapeño sauce (hella good) and panko. Friend got pesto elbow Mac and was satisfied:) 

I also got the fried pickles and garlic Parmesan french fries.  Both are worth the money and delicious. The food was custom made to order and only took about 10 mins to make. 

Staff was helpful and friendly. Very clean place.
author: Lindsey J.

description:
This place needs to improve on their staff hygiene. While I was waiting for my food (took 1 hour, btw), I noticed some things...

1. One of the staff would use his hands to comb though his bangs, then continue to cut the veggies/touch the food.

2. The cook would put the fried chicken on the Mac, and then another staff would use his hands to touch the chicken again, to rearrange it.

I don't know exactly what the food hygiene rules are...but shouldn't they wear gloves if they are going to touch the food or wash their hands after they touch their hair (or just not have their hair in their face). 

PS...yes, I knew ahead of time that I would have to wait about an hour to get my food(the owner told us ahead of time, that it would take about 1 hour after you ordered, to get the food) But....after waiting in line for 1.5 hours (when he said 30 mins), and waiting another 1 hour for my food....it kind of ruined my experience for this place :(
author: Amanda L.

description: How do you describe a place that can make ALL OF YOUR MAC DREAMS COME TRUE?!?? Besides my own home cooked Mac & cheese this is the only other place my daughter LOVES. How crazy is it that flavor is on 100 while price is completely on AFFORDABLE?!?! If you are a Mac aficionado like myself you HAVE to try it. It is definitely worth me paying the $5 toll. And STILL cheaper than many of these " frou frou" places. Oh, and don't get me started on the Brussels Sprouts! Ask to get them double fried....your welcome! I just changed your life!!
author: Tanya Q.

description:
Ok how do these guys have this good of reviews?!...

I would deem their Mac and cheese as 'basic'. Like there's a reason this place was empty... I deemed this the first and last time I'll go here. 

Everything was underwhelming from the overcooked noodles to their non-existent cheese, to their small meat portions and stale toppings... BYE FELIPE!!!!!
author: Mandi W.

description:
Their toppings are good, but I think the execution and combination need some work.

I got the goddess with shells and added toppings of hot dog, bacon, chicken, peas, shrimp, crab, truffle oil and...yeah, basically a bunch of stuff. Loved the idea, but there's a reason that this didn't exist when you were 5. With so many items in the mix, none of the individual flavors stand out and it ends up as a pile of goopiness. 

Let's start with the shells themselves: These were a bit removed from al dente, though not terribly soft either. Large portion size, especially when combined with all the fixin's.

Sauce: There was a light garlic taste in goddess, which is their garlic sauce, but the cheese taste wasn't too strong. It was sort of goopy (maybe due to the truffle oil?)-- maybe I've grown accustomed to bougie mac though. 2.5/5.

Toppings: Even under the sauce, you could tell that they used quality toppings. Their ham was cut thick and had both fatty and non-fatty parts. The bacon was smoky anddd fatty. Hot dogs are hot dogs (I love hot dogs....), chicken was standard, shrimp was cooked really crunchy (this stood out-- this never happens except at fine dining or Asian establishments...), the crab actually existed and was real (and was a $3 only topping!?), etc. 4/5. The mushrooms were cut a bit too thin for mouth feel though.

The brussel sprouts were pretty standard, though a bit oily (with crisp outer leaves!), but could have benefited from more flavoring. 3.3/5.

Takeout experience: They messed up my friend's order (she got cauliflower instead of noodles but they gave her noodles). The containers they used weren't the most suitable since their product is saucy but the containers don't fully seal (see photos of spillage). I actually enjoyed the dish more upon heating up takeout, making me think the issue I had with the food was more related to heat and presentation.

It's a 3.3 for me, but I could understand why this place is better in person!
author: Nicole H.

description: If you heart mac and cheese this is your place! There are so many ways that you can have it!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I'm definitely confused why this place has 4 stars, it's very misleading.

The reason I came here is BECAUSE it has 4 stars, and also it's an amazing idea. Why wouldn't you want to build your own mac and cheese?? Pick your sauce, your pasta shape and your toppings?? SUCH a good idea.

However, I was disappointed by everything.

1) The pasta sauce was very bland. It needed to have more sharp cheese to give it more flavor. It was not flavorful at all
2). The pasta had clearly been sitting there all day
3) The broccoli and corn that I added in were clearly frozen from bags
4) The toppings- The truffle oil was not good quality, I could tell it was really cheap. The panko bread crumbs were also too big and didn't mesh well with the mac and cheese

Another extremely disappointing factor was that there was only plastic silverware and dinnerware, even though . I was eating it there. I understand it's only a $10 meal, but I really dislike eating things with plastic unless i'm at a park because it's less enjoyable. A restaurant 100% should have regular bowls and utensils for customers who eat there. I'm not sure where these pictures are coming from with real bowls.

Lastly, none of the cooks were wearing hairnets which was kind of gross in my opinion.

overall, i won't be coming here again unless something drastically changes in the quality of ingredients. It's a really really good idea so I'm hoping that is the case!
author: Jenna G.

description:
Mackin' MAC!

For $10 bucks, you get your pick of silky sauces, unlimited mix-ins, and as many toppings as your cheese-loving heart desires. FUHHHHHHHSSSSYEEEESSSS.

I slathered the goddess garlic sauce all over them noodle thangs, threw in some chicken, bacon, chorizo, and peas, and topped that bad boy off with hot Cheetos and truffle oil. Can I have a hallelujah?! H A L L E L U J A H!

'Twas amaze. Must. Come. Back.
author: Vi T.

description: After a hike, we found this place on yelp and came ready to scarf down some carbs. Parking is street only and we found a spot a couple blocks away. I think we came at peak dinner time because there was a line out the door. Didn't look like that many parties ahead of us - maybe 7-8 but it still took about 40 minutes or so to get up to the front to order. I'm sure the service isn't really slow - it's just that if everyone in the group gets a customizable mac and cheese dish, it can take a while to ramble off all the mix-ins and toppings you want. Also it's not stated on the big menu what the type of sauces are. It just has the name listed. So I'm sure people have questions or there is an 8.5 by 11" laminated menu that you can peruse while you're up there. Thus people spend even more time up there. Yeah, there's probably things they can do to speed up the ordering process. I looked on yelp and their website and didn't see a way to call in or online order in advance or anything. My bf got the drunken pig, which is one of their few pre-determined combos. It looked like it was just elbow macaroni in the basic sauce and topped with pulled pork. I made my own creation - the goddess sauce with shells; mix-ins included bacon, chicken, broccoli, mushrooms and tomatoes; topped with parmesan, panko and truffle oil. I really liked mine except for two minor things - I could barely taste the chicken and it was a little salty. I didn't notice it too badly at first but it definitely got saltier the more I ate it. The goddess sauce is super cheesy (three cheeses) and pretty garlicy too - I liked it. And there was a good amount of bacon in it. The other friend just got meat in hers because she thought if she got veggies, they'd put less meat in it but I still got some bacon with almost every bite in mine even though I got veggies in my dish. Food took about 20 minutes to come out. So yeah it was an hour before we could eat. Luckily, I wasn't starving or else I would've gotten hangry. It's about $11 for a big thing of mac n cheese, which is not too badly priced but prob a little expensive considering it's just mac n cheese.  I was definitely full about 2/3 of the wat through my plate but it was too little to bring home so I just powered through and finished it.  But they serve it to you in a foil to-go container so all you need is a paper lid, if you did want to take it to go. Seems a little wasteful to serve everything in togo containers but it's convenient. I would probably come back again if I didn't have to wait.
author: Alison W.

description: The food was good BUT the employee demanded that we leave when we had just gotten our food because they were closed he said but it was not quit 2am yet. He was one of the rudest workers I have ever encountered at a restaurant. Not planning on going back, really not a great way to talk to customers.
author: Dakota J.

description:
For a place that specializes in Mac and cheese you would think the Mac and cheese would taste better. The Mac and cheese itself is very bland without a lot of flavor. 
I got the basic sauce with shells and hot dogs, peas, and mushrooms. It was topped off with Parmesan and truffle oil. 
There wasn't a lot of hot dogs and the truffle oil flavor wasn't really there. 
The concept itself is great. I just wish it tasted better.
author: Krysten M.

description: How could I go wrong with a restaurant dedicated to my favorite food? The hardest part about this spot was deciding which cheese sauce and mix ins to include. I opted for the basic shells (needed to start off with an old faithful) with chorizo, bacon, peas, mushrooms, and tomatoes (veggies made it healthy, right) with panko and hot Cheetos on top. Overall, it was pretty solid Mac and cheese. I bet it's even better when eaten in house vs take out, but I was short on time. My only complaint would be there wasn't that much meat - either they forgot the chorizo or it was pretty stingy. The menu also had wings and fries and Brussels sprouts. Went for the Parmesan Garlic fries and they were delicious as well. Next time, I think the goddess sauce is calling my name!
author: Morgan H.

description:
3.5/5
Tried coming here about a month ago but the line was down the block and there's only one mac and cheese in the world worth waiting that long for (Screen Door in Portland). Dropped by again on Easter Sunday and the place had no line at all so I finally decided to give it a try.

My friend and I split a hellapeno mac and cheese w/ chorizo, banana peppers, tomatoes topped w/ parmesan, truffle oil, and hot cheetos. Basically you pay $11 for a base, choose a pasta, choose mix-ins, and toppings. The base mac and cheese was pretty good. Decent amount of heat (noticeable but won't burn) and a good amount of cheese (sauce itself isn't too rich but they top w/ more cheese on top). It's an all around fine mac and cheese. The problem was with the mix ins. Every item came in a chunk and there weren't 2-4 chunks. We literally thought they forgot our chorizo til we each bit into a giant cove of it. Same w/ the peppers and the tomatoes. The toppings are fine but honestly don't add much besides a pop of color.

Basically for $11 you're getting a semi-decent mac and cheese with the added bonus of feeling like you got something fancier. If there's no line and you need some greasy carb love then it's totally worth a stop. If there's more than 5 people, skip it.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I wasn't overly impressed by their basic and goddess cheese sauce. My bowl came it kind of Luke warm and cold. But my husband's and daughter's bowl were heated through. However, my stars are really for their sides. The garlic aioli Brussels sprouts and garlic Parmesan fries with truffle oil was BOMB AF. Also because they don't do the plain old fountain drinks- they've got Mexican bottled coke and sprite :) worth a try!

**Also it says it is good for kids but they have no high chairs.
author: Terinna R.

description:
A little pricey for Mac n' Cheese, but it was overall pretty good! I had The Goddess with shells, bacon, chicken, and mushrooms, topped with Panko and Hot Cheetos. The food came out really hot and the pasta was cooked al dente. It was about $11 for a bowl of Mac n' Cheese which is a bit pricey, in my opinion, but the portion is pretty large; I'd say it's good enough to share between two people. 

If I lived in the Bay Area, I'd consider coming back, but I don't think it's special enough to make a trip out. 

Instagram: @jhaseats
author: Jhasmyne D.

description: I wanted to try this place so bad!! We live almost 2 hours away so I planned a trip to SF for my birthday and included a trip to Mac'd. We arrived around 8:15 on Saturday night and it was crowded but we found a table and ordered. It took about 15 minutes to get our food. The staff was friendly and the food was delicious! I'm so glad I finally got to try it!
author: Angela P.

description:
Favorite mac n cheese restaurant in the Bay Area! The fact that you can choose your own pasta is a game-changer and is exactly what had been missing from the other mac restaurants. 

I recently discovered I'm more of a simple mac n cheese gal, because in the past, when I have gone to one of the mac restaurants in the Bay, I added many toppings, including veggies and hot dogs but later realized, simplicity is the key imho. 

That's why at Mac'd, I decided to go for simple. Shells (highly recommend), with cheddar cheese and parmesan on top. Best decision. Now that I know how amazing it is, I'll have to come back and try adding a few toppings, like the hot cheetos perhaps? The best part is that you can add all the toppings you want for $11 (some things are extra $, like meat). Seriously though, everyone needs to come here.
author: Ilana B.

description:
Love love love! The pasta was cooked to a perfect al dente. The sauce was not too runny but at the same time it was cheesey and stretchy enough. 

I got the goddess sauce with shell pasta, tomato, mushroom, brocolli, and chorizo. I topped if off with panko and truffle oil. They forgot the brocolli and I'm not even mad because the dish was still very good. They're not skimpy on their ingridents which I appreciate, espcially since all toppings (besides shrimp and crab) are free. I really like the shell pasta with the mac and cheese because some of the sauce gets cupped into the pasta to give you an extra chesey bite. 

Portion was very big, good for two meals or one very stuffed meal if you can't stop eating this deliciousness. 

I like that there are a variety of hot sauce - Franks, Tabasco, Louisiana, Cholula, and a green one that I don't remember the name of. 

I also got fried brussel sprouts with garlic aioli. That was okay. I wish it came with more sauce or that the brussel sprouts were tossed in the sauce. Instead the sauce was just drizzled on top.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Had higher expectations for this place. 

$11 for a standard portion with basic topping options. 

I thought they would have more creative options. 
And It took a little while to get my food, even though it was not even packed or busy. 

Probably wouldn't be back unless someone I knew really wanted to go here, or I was craving some Mac n cheese hard core and didn't want to make it. 

Although not all bad here's the pro's:

-plenty of seating 
-clean, modern interior
-bar/stools
-it's Mac and cheese!! (Yumm, feel like a kid again!)
-cool aesthetic sign at the door to take an insta picture of ;)
author: Janessa H.

description:
I love Mac and cheese so I was hyped to try this place. I decided to get the elbows, regular sauce with bacon, mushroom, and Panko. The overall taste is quite good and the bacon is fantastic. It's more of bacon chunks with a nice smokey flavor. I was disappointed that they didn't have the Brussels sprouts when I went there. 

Service is alright, but it's more of a self service joint. They give a decent portion of Mac but it's rather pricey for what you get and didn't feel like a complete meal. 

Try this place if you like high quality Mac n cheese, but it's more of a once in a while treat. 

Food: 4.25/5
Value: 3/5
Service: 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5
author: Brian G.

description:
I ordered the basic bowl with two types of cheddar and got the hot Cheetos topping. I was disappointed. The noodles were a bit overcooked/overly soft, the cheese blend didn't compliment the meal, and the hot Cheetos weren't anything special either. Each bite was disappointing and slowly got worse as I continued eating. I ate a little more than half of my bowl in hopes to fill my stomach, but after finding no satisfaction I asked my friend if she wanted to grab something else to eat in the neighborhood. She said her meal The Goddess was overly garlic and wasn't satisfying her either. We ended up walking around the neighborhood in search for something else. 

I think the concept is creative and appealing...but the delivery was super underwhelming. I won't be back.
author: Kristy F.

description: Overall the food here is really good and pretty reasonably priced. This past Tuesday my boyfriend and I came here to eat dinner at 6:30 we ordered and waited over an hour for a food which is ridiculous. After finally addressing the cook they finally admitted our order was completely lost and they would start to make our food over an hour after we had ordered. Keep in mind our friend who ordered right after us got his food about 10-15 minutes after ordering. The staff was super sorry about their mistake but it really should not have taken that long for them to noticed we did not have any food. This place has potential but this last experience was pretty upsetting.
author: Cierra H.

description:
I loved it!

Tried both the Hellapeño sauce and the garlic cheese and they were both amazing. Of course you can't go wrong with topping it off with flaming hot Cheetos and parmesan cheese. 
I'm most deff coming back. 
Only con: (but won't take a star out just because it was still amazing and I'm coming back) wish we could pick the kind of cheese. Like provolone, cheddar, mozzarella, etc.
author: Kryssia C.

description: I had high hopes for this place, Unfortunately, it just wasn't the jam. I guess I just hoped it would phenomenal. The concept behind it is very clever. However, the flavor wasn't there. If you just need a quick Mac n Cheese fix it'll do.
author: Kenyatta B.

description:
A restaurant that specializes in mac and cheese! Any combo with unlimited toppings! I ordered a garlic mac & cheese with hot dogs and bread crumbs. It was garlicky and delicious.

My only qualm is that they served it in a take-out container even though I dined in. Not too eco-friendly.
author: Mallory L.

description:
Goddess sauce with shells, bacon, chicken and Parmesan topping. The other bowl is basic sauce with elbows, chicken, Parmesan, hot Cheeto and truffle oil topping. Delicious!! We also got a side of the truffle garlic fries but didn't taste too garlicky. I would've settled with the naked fries. 

Great lunch spot either way and the environment is really open and friendly. Cute set-up. Loved my pic in front of the stay cheesin' sign they have when you walk in!
author: Vanessa D.

description:
One star for its aesthetically pleasing decor.

Mediocre food and mediocre service.

The man taking the orders had such a dull attitude. Please take him out of his misery and hire someone who actually wants to be there!

Had such high expectations for the Mac and Cheese... It tasted bland to say the least. Looks like they use frozen veggies. They're also stingy on the hot Cheeto add on. 


I will stick to Homeroom in Oakland!! I'd advise you do the same too!
author: Berenice S.

description:
Perfect little hole in the wall with great comfort food. Staff was friendly and fun. 

Recommend going during "off" times as it does at crowded during the lunch and dinner rush. But even if you have to wait, I doubt you'd be disappointed.
author: Anna M.

description:
Yes this place is good... not great, but good. I'm gluten free and saw that they have gf options-perfect! However the gf option for the mac is cauliflower... ok that's fine as long as it's good.. it's an extra $2.  For sauce all the sauces have flour in it, except the vegan which is another extra $$$. Um k, damn this pricey allergy (waves fist in the air).

I ordered the bacon with also jalapeños and parmesan and cheeto fairy dust. Given that I paid extra for most of my dish I expected it to be better. The cauliflower was really crunchy... given that regular Mac and cheese melts in your mouth, I expected it to be at least a little soft. However everything else was tasty!

I also ordered the brussel sprouts. It was ok. It was perfectly crunchy, but didn't have much flavor (there's supposed to be a light honey siracha flavor.... I didn't taste anything). I got some sauces to add to it, but wasn't too impressed.

I could possibly be swayed to come back, but honestly I'd rather pick up some hot cheetos at cvs.
author: Gita r.

description:
Ahhh I am so bummed because I was super duper excited to try this place out. I love love love mac and cheese. It's my ultimate weakness food. I can never ever turn it down and I am always willing to try out any joint that specializes in it. So I thought going at 2:30pm on a Saturday was an off time so it wouldn't take long to get food etc...Unfortunately I was wrong. We got there and it was pretty packed. The line to order was pretty short though. Only 3 parties in front of us. It took a good 1/2 hour to get up to order. Not sure what was taking so long in front of us. But whatever, I was willing to let that go. From the time we ordered to when we got our food, it was 1 hour!!! It was wayyy too long. We weren't warned of the wait when we got up to order and it wasn't until we had been waiting almost 45 minutes that we saw the guy at the counter warning people it was 30 min - 1 hour wait. Really wish we had gotten that disclaimer. It was also really really hot in there which didn't help the wait and with an impatient toddler, oh boy, let's just say it wasn't the best. 

So then we get our food:
Mine - Basic, shells, crab, peas, breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese. It was ok. There was something missing in the cheese sauce that I just couldn't place. It was cheesy - saw the strings of cheese as I lifted up my fork but it just didn't taste as good as it looked. I think it's that the cheese sauce didn't have as sharp cheddar as I would've liked. I also didn't taste the crunch from the breadcrumbs which made me wonder if it was even there.
Hubs - hella jalapeno sauce, elbows, chorizo, hot cheetos. This was delicious. This sauce was definitely creamier and the flavor of the chorizo and hot cheetos was very tasty.

In summary:
Price - really good. Can't beat $11 for a huge portion
Quality - meh
Service - not great at all. 1 hour wait was absolutely horrible. And the stuffiness in the joint didn't help. There's no air flowing in there. Wish some windows were open. You also have to bus your own trays and ugh we weren't pleased. There's 1 high chair in the whole place.

I could possibly come back again just to try the other combos and maybe hope that the wait won't be that long. Or order delivery. Any other place I wouldn't come back but like I said mac and cheese is my weakness.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I feel like it still has some kinks to work out as a new business, but overall, MAC'D is delicious! The portion size is very generous - I've never been able to finish a bowl in a single sitting. Also, there are so many different options in terms of add-ins, cheese, topping, and even pasta, it's been tempting to go back and try different combos (I've already been 3x since it opened....pretty sure I'm addicted to the truffle oil.) My boyfriend mentioned that I was audibly moaning while digging in to my bowl after a long day at work. 

My only complaints are: 1) 2 out of the 3 times, my order has been lukewarm, needs to be served hotter! 2) the wait is a little long. have waited up to 20 mins with 2-3 orders in front of me.
author: Catherine S.

description:
The best way to prepare for a proper afternoon nap! This place is delicious. 

They seemed a bit understaffed upon entry, but food came very quick. It's an incredible location and fun atmosphere. 

I got the basic sauce with shells, bacon, panko and truffle oil. It did not disappoint! Your mothers homemade Mac n' cheese on steroids. 

Tempted to try the hot cheeto topping next time! #StayCheesin
author: John A.

description:
Yummy! We went with our kids on a coldish summer day. This was super tasty and as others mentioned unlimited toppings? That's something!

We had the hellapeneo with mushroom, broccoli and extra jalapeños and we did a half cauliflower half Shells base. Yummmy and topped with Panko!

The kids had goddess and loved theirs too. 4 of us with fries and tip $33! That you can't beat in the city.

And the food was really yummy!
author: Swa S.

description:
Mac and cheese is my favourite food. But- I am nervous to try 'other peoples' because I really don't like when it is dry or not cheesy enough. This place really impressed me. 
It is cheesy and creamy and the toppings are all great. Huge portions. And, the cauliflower type is surprisingly delicious. I don't think I would call it healthy, but "less bad for you"- i'll take it.
author: Samantha I.

description:
Mac'd is getting off to a good start! I can see they still have a few kinks to iron out, but my first experience here was a good one and I'm keen on coming back. 

I had the goddess with elbow noodles, broccoli, mushrooms, panko, and truffle oil. It was delicious! I liked that the broccoli still had a bite to it. I didn't get much of the truffle oil until the end. The noodles are soft, so if you prefer al dente, then definitely get it with panko for that crunch. 

They have a flavor station where you pick up your order, which also includes water pitchers. I wish I saw the tiny pepper shakers, because, though I thought overall the flavor was good, I would've liked a bit of pepper. 

The goddess dressing is cheesy and garlic-y, which is a nice change from using regular cheddar. But if old school is what you prefer, don't fret because they have it. 

The space is pretty open. Most of the tables are up front by the windows. My roommate and I sat in the back where the taller tables were. 

For $10, the portion size is good. It's served in a shallow, yet wide bowl, so it looks deceiving, but it's a lot, at least for me. I could've eaten half, but I knew I'd end up eating the whole thing because that's just who I am. 

They had a small sign with ingredients they didn't have, but I think once they run a couple of inventory reports in the next few months, they'll know how much to order. 

Can't wait to go back and get it with cauliflower!
author: Vira P.

description: Delicious selections with some of the best and most interesting toppings for Mac n cheese. Went in and they answered all of my questions happily.
