Portions are definitely big enough to share if you aren't starving. All the cheese sauce choices make me want to go back and experiment more with all of the hundred if possible combinations. Inside has a nice feel to it and is pretty clean. Definitely a place to go again next time I'm in town!
author: Douglas M.

description:
I had the pleasure of trying this place during its soft opening phase with a few friends and so far... I love it! 

The concept is simple and fun: 
Design your own Mac N Cheese! 
I love the variety of options on the menu because it allows you to unleash your cravings and eat exactly what you want! 

You start by choosing a pasta or as a gluten free option, cauliflower. Next, you choose a sauce- traditional, garlic, french onion, or beer & bacon fat. 
Then, start piling it with yummy toppings and tasty meat. Get creative, fancy, daring... 
I recommend the tri tip- it was so tender and delicious. 
Lastly, add some crunch with panko or better yet, hot cheetos ;)

I also had the chance to meet the two owners, Jason and Chen Chen. They seemed very passionate, excited, and committed to producing the best mac n cheese experience in SF. 

So stop by and get MAC'D!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Saw this place advertised on Facebook and decided to give it try tonight. It's a pretty cool mashup of choosing your base cheeses, type of pasta and unlimited toppings except where they charge extra for seafood or fried chicken. I ordered the goddess with mushrooms, chicken and extra parmigiana cheese. My boyfriend ordered the goddess with ham, bacon, and chorizo. Like one of those meat lover types of orders and the garlic parm truffle fries on the side plus 2 drinks. The food came out in decent time. However, to our disappointment, the food was luke warm as if it was sitting there under a heat lamp. Cheese was not gooey; more like just a cheese flavored sauce. The fries were warm but overly salty with garlic powdered salt. Parm wasn't even melted and the truffle oil was greased to the bottom of the tray. The flavors were just ok. I felt I could have made this at home. The only thing they got right was the pasta being al dente. 
Would I recommend this place? Probably not. Not worth the $38 we paid for mediocre and lack of comfort food.
author: Martine D.

description:
They serve cauliflower as a substitute for pasta! 

Bless them.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
This was seriously the best meal of my life!!! 

Just one disclaimer, or helpful tip.. they definitely need to keep up on their bathroom cleaning... The toilet seat / floor underneath was covered in puke /:
author: Skyler M.

description:
I love the build-your-own style with unlimited options (some, like meat, cost extra). I ordered brussels sprouts for the table, which were a good call. For my mac and cheese I opted for shells in the Goddess (garlic) sauce with mushrooms, truffle oil, and parmesan shavings. Good flavor and consistency. However, this vegetarian was not a happy camper after finding many pieces of bacon in the mac and cheese. Super not cool. So after spitting out the first piece and eyeing more, I had to examine every shell and leave a decent portion of the mac and cheese behind. Had I not been with a group I would have sent it back; instead, I just prayed I wouldn't get sick.

There's no atmosphere; it's certainly not a date night place, but after all the turnover in this location the last few years, I hope it sticks. 

I'll give them another chance, and I'd like to try the cauliflower in place of pasta, and hopefully I can upgrade the review to 4 stars.
author: Cristina S.

description:
This is a solid place for mac and cheese where it doesn't seem like you can go wrong with any combination you make. My friends and I placed vastly different orders, but we were all very pleased with how they turned out. Pricing was very transparent and I liked how there was no limit to the number of toppings you can add and no extra charge for standard proteins like chicken and sausage. The restaurant is extremely accommodating to those with dietary restrictions- a vegan sauce and cauliflower "pasta" is available if classic mac and cheese isn't your thing.

Downside is that they still have issues to iron out in their supply chain. I arrived 30 minutes before closing on a Sunday night, and they were out of whole wheat pasta and chicken, amongst several other ingredients.  The line to order took about 10 minutes, and the employee left twice to help finish other tasks in the kitchen. MAC'D is presented as a fast-casual restaurant, and perhaps opening weekend was much busier than usual, but it took 20 minutes for our food to come out- waaay longer than similar restaurants in this category.
author: Amy C.

description:
Love the concept, hated the wait. 

MAC'D is a fast-casual, build-your-own mac and cheese restaurant - for $10 you get a customized bowl with unlimited mix-ins! I ordered shell pasta with the #basic, mushroom, broccoli, corn and hot cheetos and it was delicious!

The only downside was the wait. I came during their opening weekend and waited about 30-40 minutes for food. It also seemed a bit disorganized and understaffed, but I'll give them a pass since they're still so new. (Side note: I was a bit confused by the ambiance / low lighting / dark restaurant situation going on...)
author: Alice S.

description:
I came here during my trip to San Fran because I saw a video on Facebook and since I love mac & cheese so much, I thought this would be a great place to go. 

I got there for lunch time and it wasn't as busy, which was good since I didn't have to wait long. I can't say much about the service because it's not like they're physically bringing over the dishes to us. It's just more of the cashier, but she was nice so no complaints there.

I expected a lot more out of this place since it was hyped up on Facebook, but it's honestly just your average mac & cheese place with a variety of toppings. They don't use anything special so it tastes average (in my opinion). 

Wouldn't really recommend this to my friends because there's definitely other better places to visit. But if you want to go, go for it. Not worth the price though.
author: Kim P.

description:
With a mac n cheese connoisseur husband, this was a must try spot on our food tour of SF. 

We visited on a Friday afternoon on their grand opening day. It wasn't crazy busy, but everyone inside seemed to enjoy it!

We had a great, friendly experience. We sampled 2 dishes, but I was slightly bummed they were out of the vegan cheese. They ensured us a new batch would be made in the next day or two. 

We loved the "build your own" style of mac n cheese, everyone is truly able to make what they want. 

Check out our photos for the list of our ingredients!
author: Suzy G.

description:
Was super excited to try this place and we were lucky enough to come when there was no line! 

I ordered the "hellapeno" sauce in my Mac along with crab and broccoli mixed in. It was good but very runny. Had it not been so runny this Mac and cheese would've been amazing. The food came out really quick, so maybe it just didn't bake long enough. I personally think homeroom in Oakland is better.

Maybe it was just an off day, I would give this place another try as they have some interesting options on their menu.
author: Lissa M.

description:
I've always been hesitant to try Mac n cheese restaurants because I never saw mac n cheese as an entree, always as a side. Boy am I glad I tried MAC'd! We visited during their soft opening (grand opening is today, July 14) and were able to try a few dishes. The idea behind MAC'D is a Chipotle-style customization for your mac n cheese dish. You first choose your cheese sauce and then you can add different kinds of toppings like lobster or tri-tip (for extra fees), veggies, sauce, etc. Keep in mind you just order at the register and decide there. It's not like you follow a worker down the line and choose what you want like Chipotle. The workers will call your name when your order is ready.

We got the Goddess (garlic sauce) and the Basic (chedder). We added toppings like chorizo, Hot Cheetos, bacon, chicken, peas, corn, etc. You can even choose different types of pasta like shells or elbows. We loved both dishes! We also got a side order of the fried brussel sprouts. They have a nice crisp and a sweet taste to them.

They have occupied a big space and there seems to be enough suitable tables for everyone. One great thing to note is that they are open late nights until 2am on Fridays and Saturdays. Perfect for people who are partying late and need a midnight snack (just don't be that annoying and disrespecting drunk person).

I would suggest adding more lighter side orders on the menu to balance the heaviness of the creamy mac n cheese and fried food.
author: Michael T.

description:
The cauliflower mac & cheese with chicken was well below what my expectations (drenched in cheese and very very little chicken) and the brussels sprouts were also overly saturated with their sauce. 
More importantly, I bit into the head of a half-broken metal nail halfway through eating my mac & cheese (see pictures). I drove there and went in to share my experience with the manager and staff and they were also genuinely disturbed and surprised but had no explanation as to how that could've happened.  Since I ordered from Uber eats, they said they could not offer me a refund. They offered no other way other way resolving the matter.
author: Dan K.

description:
For roughly $17 that included a crab upcharge and a tip, pathetic amount of meat included. Got skimped, definitely not coming back. Not worth what you pay for.

I suggest asking for the chicken and crab on top and not mixed in to see what you end up with, maybe whoever is making it will be inclined to actually put in an acceptable amount.

Great service, clean, nice people though, so 2 stars for that.
author: Lyle Z.

description:
A mac n cheese place opening in the neighborhood?  Sounds like a dream come true!

They officially open in a week, but currently operating as a soft opening.

The staff was incredibly friendly.  One of the owners, Chen-Chen, introduced himself and asked for feedback after we ate.  I think it's a great sign when management takes a sincere interest in the customer experience.

My boyfriend and I visited for dinner on a weeknight.  We each ordered separate mac bowls.  In terms of quantity, two people who aren't too hungry could split a bowl.  If you're hungry, you can tackle a bowl on your own.  $10 for a bowl is normal/good for this area.

He got: The Tailgate cheese sauce (beer & bacon fat) with pasta shells, mixed with chorizo & bacon, topped with Hot Cheetos.  I got: The #Basic cheddar cheese sauce with elbow pasta, mixed with hot dogs, topped with panko.  I liked the consistency of the pasta and the taste.

I enjoy trying different combinations, so am looking forward to returning and trying out various mixes.

Other details:
 - They don't currently sell alcohol, but will in the near future, once paperwork/licensing is complete.
 - Water station, to-go boxes, and a variety of hot sauces are easily available.
 - Two, individual restrooms are down a hallway in the back.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
Mac'D took over Elena and so glad they did. I love mac and cheese. Welcome to the Marina! 

I did like it but I didn't love it. But I'm sure there is room for improvement since I went on the first day of their soft opening. Small menu right now but comes July 14th, they will be introducing a bigger menu with liquor. I can't wait.

The service was good. The food was tasty. Decent prices. A whole shelf of hot sauce you can choose from. And who doesn't want flaming hot cheetos in their PASTA? Yes it's a add on and I love it!

I do have a complaint or you can say a constructive criticism, the mac and cheese should be hot, temperature wise. I felt as if my dish and my friend dish was only warm.
author: Sandy B.

description:
I have to admit, I'm not a big fan of Mac and Cheese but the Mac and a cheese at MAC'D changed that. Plus I love the ideas of unlimited choices of toppings for your pasta. I came here for lunch with friends on a Tuesday and there was no wait. Note: I heard that on weekends line can be really long, but waiting in line is part of a fun experience so don't be afraid to wait in line. Just make sure you have your phone ready to snap a few Instagram worthy pictures of this place. Anyway, my friends and I decided to order 4 different types to share. Here's what we ordered:

1.)The Basic (Elbow) with bacon, mushrooms and panko. If you are a fan of cheddar cheese then this is for you. Super tasty and rich. Delicious! 

2.)The  Goddess (Shells) with mushrooms and chicken tenders. Wow! The chicken tenders was the best highlight of The Goddess. I found myself digging for more chicken. It was seasoned well, super moist and absurdly tasty. 

3.) The Hellapeno (Elbow) with chorizo, broccoli, mushrooms, and a generous sprinkles of hot Cheetos. Whaaat? Cheetos? Yes please! This one was one of my favorite out of the four different types we ordered. If you like anything spicy, then this one should make you happy. 

4.) The Pesto (shells) with shrimp, crab and a drizzle of my favorite truffle oil. Any food that has a combination of pesto and truffle oil is must try. One word for this one - scrumptious! Gotta get it next time! 

Then we ordered a side of honey sriracha Brussels sprout, which I didn't get to take picture of because my friends devoured them already. Yes, that good! The Brussels Sprouts with bacon ranch was also good, but too creamy for my liking. 

Here's a few pictures of what we ordered. If looking at these pictures won't make you drool, then I don't what is. Stay cheesin' my fellow Yelpers. Remember to stay kind.
author: josie f.

description: Surpassed our expectations! MAC'D is far better than Homeroom in Oakland. There was no line also, on a Sunday at lunch time! Crowded, but had no wait. I loved the concept of the "build-your-own" macs with TONS of add-ins, toppings, & sauce choices. It was all incredible. I got the shells (I LOVE shells) with their 'hellapeno' sauce, chicken, broccoli, mushrooms, jalapenos, panko, etc. I can't even remember it all! It was amazing. My interval eating had me fasting all morning since 8pm the night before so by 1:30 in the afternoon, I was ready to chow -- I ate the entire thing! The honey sriracha brussel sprouts were also a hit as well as the naked fries. I saw some people ordered the pulled pork on top. Mmm, I'll have to try it next time. All amazing! Was super impressed, and I think you all will be too. Apparently, they just opened up one more SF location, so go try it out!
author: Blake L.

description: Service was great and the Mac n cheese was great. Also great that you can put as many toppings in it as you would like. However, we only put chicken and mushrooms in our dish and ended up with maybe 4-5 small cubes of chicken that was kind of chewy. The chicken tasted like it had been reheated. But props to the cheesiness of the actual macaroni and cheese.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I like the quality of the food. Option to get unlimited meats is awesome. I got bacon, chicken and mushrooms.

Only downside was there is no drink refills, just bottled drinks and cans.
author: Isaias P.

description:
Macaroni and cheese? You can throw hot cheetos on top? Oh and there's a neon sign that says "Get Cheesed" on a cheese dripping wall? -- I'm there.

I tried this spot last night and I was SHOOK.  It was delicious!  Basically you walk in and pick the type of cheese sauce you want, the type of protein or veggies you want in it, and the toppings.  

The first combo I tasted had "The Goddess" cheese sauce (which is garlic flavored), shell pasta, mushrooms, and shrimp -- then we topped it off with panko and parmesan crisps.  So good!  

Our second combo used "The Tailgate" cheese sauce (which is beer/bacon flavored), elbow pasta, and bacon -- topped with hot cheetos!  I recommend adding hot cheetos onto your dish, not only because it's good but also because it looks great for those IG photos ya'll.  #GETMACD

The third combo we picked was the "The Frenchie" cheese sauce (french onion soup flavored), shell pasta, trip tip steak, and parmesan on top.  Yummy!  The steak is actually super tender and perfectly cooked -- I was impressed!

While honestly they were all good -- I think my favorite cheese sauce was "The Tailgate."  Protein wise, I loved the bacon and the tri tip.  For toppings -- panko, parmesan and hot damn -- those hot cheetos!   

I know you're probably distracted by the cheese/bacon/hot cheetos -- BUT get the brussel sprouts yall.  I know, you are like NAW, but listen - I'm not about that veggie life, but those things are deep fried and AMAZING.  You will not regret it, I promise you.  Super unique flavor of sweet and spicy!  

I really enjoyed getting to meet the co-owners Jason Brown and Chen-Chen Huo.  You can really tell that these two are passionate about their restaurant/product.  They really took the time to help me order and explain their menu.  I loved that they asked us questions and listened to our feedback, you can tell these guys really care about their customers. 

I definitely recommend this spot for so many reasons.  There's an awesome "Get Cheesed" sign in the front that is great for the gram.  The food is delicious but also beautiful -- also great for IG.  The service is quick, and the people are awesome!  

I'll definitely be back to see what else they come up with! Love!
author: Michelle S.

description:
My friend is getting married in August and she has decided to start a (loose) ketogenic diet to prepare for the big day. After a day of dress-shopping, we decided to treat ourselves to some mac n' cheese because if you put cheese on roasted cauliflower, that's healthy right?

Rating Breakdown:
2/2 Stars for Taste --
I chose Hellapeño sauce on shells with pretty much every mix-in and topped with panko and truffle oil. Delicious. The sauce was rich and not too spicy or oily. The mix-in's were pretty well distributed -- a few of my favorites included the broccoli and the chorizo. The crisp of the panko and the subtle fragrance of the truffle oil made the whole dish a slam dunk. My friend ordered the Goddess sauce on roasted cauliflower with all the toppings. I liked the garlic sauce...but I liked the kick of my jalapeno sauce even better. The roasted cauliflower was definitely interesting. You can never replace the satisfaction of gluten, but this was a nearly worthy substitute. 

1/1 Stars for Value --
$11 for a skillet of mac n' cheese. This sounds like a lot, but the variety of the mix-ins you can choose from (4-5 types of meat alone! truffle oil! broccoli!) and the portion sizes (I ate myself sick and I still have half in the fridge.) give this dish a good bang for your buck. I love truffle mac n' cheese, and I have never seen it for less than $12...and that's without meat. Certain customizations cost extra -- roasted cauliflower, lobster, crab, fried chicken. The plate of truffle fries was $6 and the serving size looked HUGE. 

0.5/1 Stars for Customer Service --
Unbeknownst to me, this place has quite the cult following after being featured in a Facebook video. The line was out the door! The owner came out to warn us that it would be 45 minutes to order then another 45 minutes until our food would be ready. This deterred quite a few people in front of us in line but the time estimate turned out to be pretty accurate. The small kitchen is definitely not equipped to handle such high volumes of customers (they need another oven or one of those long conveyer belt kinds like Quizno's or Costco pizza), but they're doing their best. I asked for no banana peppers but I also saw how busy they were and thought, "oh well, i'll just eat it." I think they have a few kinks to iron out, but I wish them the best of luck because they've got quite a thing going on here.

Half a bonus star because I would come again if only for the food, but not unless I had 2-3 hours to kill (WHO HAS THAT KIND OF TIME.)

TL;DR: $11 customized mac n' cheese. Delicious but not worth 2-3 hour wait.
author: Abby W.

description: I wanted to love this place because how can you go wrong with hot cheetos as a topping? I order the goddess, shells with lobster and mushroom, and topped it with truffle oil and hot cheetos. My mac n' cheese wasn't as cheesy, the cheese was already hard when it got to the table, it was probably sitting around in the kitchen. My hot cheetos was burnt. They also have fries, being the potato queen I had to order fries for $4 and it was a huge basket! But sadly it wasn't the best fries I had, it was probably sitting in the deep fryer for long.
author: Annie Y.

description:
[ Food ]
-- Goddess, shells, chicken, longaniza, mushroom, corn, panko, parmesan
-- Goddess, shells, chicken, longaniza, corn, kimchi, truffle oil, panko

[ Ambiance ]
-- Trendy
-- Great place to meet up with someone or hangout with a group

[ Parking ]
-- Metered Street
-- If you go closer to the Marina, there are a bunch of free 2 hour spots

[ Size ]
-- 2 adults
-- Bar seating and table seating

[ Cost ] incl. tax and tip
-- $19.18

Awesome space and addition to the Marina. Love the high quality ingredients with the wide range of options. I personally really like the medium sized shells that they used because it really grabbed hold of the sauce and other ingredients! Would absolutely come back for a different combination. Good-sized portions where I was definitely full but not overly stuffed.

Hope they continue to do well! They will also be adding local beers to their drink list so will want to try that the next time I come!
author: Markus M.

description: Really cool to make your own Mac n cheese combo! Waited in line for a little bit, but it was moving quickly. I got the hellapeno cheese sauce with shell pasta, bacon, chorizo, mushrooms, panko, hot cheetos and truffle oil. Super rich in flavor so only finished half and took the rest home!
author: Lillian B.

description:
Tried: customized mac & cheese - shells with goddess sauce + tons of toppings

I love mac & cheese, and mac'd is customizable mac & cheese, which is even better. Besides the obvious pros of mac, cheese, and good topping choices, the price is also extremely affordable - 11.99 after tax.

There are a few cons - first off, the toppings portions are irregular: I had a lot of bacon in mine but only a few pieces of corn. In addition, wait time can be long, both for ordering and for the actual mac & cheese. We came a few minutes before 7 pm on a Friday night, and there were only 2 people in front of us. However, right after we ordered, the line began snaking out the door. Even though we ordered before the crowd came, we still waited quite a while for the food. The cooks also made more than a few mistakes for other people while we were waiting; one guy had to wait five minutes for his food to be put into a to-go box, a girl was missing toppings, another girl didn't get her fries, and they also dropped one order and had to remake it. Thankfully, we didn't have much issues, but I would definitely recommend trying to come early to skip the line. 

Otherwise, I will definitely be back, and might even choose this over Homeroom (in Oakland).
author: Hannah H.

description:
After attempting to come here three times, FINALLY  I was able to try this place myself.

The hours in store say 11-9 (Sunday-Thursday) and 11am-2am (Friday-Saturday) and online it says 11-9(SMTW), 5-9 (Thursday's), 11am-2am (Friday-Saturday).

It's is 4pm on a Thursday and I am currently eating some of their Mac n cheese, sooo not too sure which hours to believe. I've also been here from 5-7 and it's been closed. So not to sure. I'd call before coming in!

Anyways, when you first come in there's a cool neon sign that says "stay cheesin'" thought that was fun and clever. Plenty of seating and all tables have a view of the unique "Get Mac'd" sign!

There were maybe 5 people in store and it's taken 30 minutes to wait for TWO orders. Although the orders can get complex, and they cook everything in the moment, I can't even imagine how long the wait for your food is when it is busy.

This is how the menu works:
First you choose your cheese sauce
Second you choose the kind of pasta you want
Third you choose what to mix in it
Fourth you choose how to top it off

This all starts with a price of $11. Some of the mix-in's and top it off toppings cost extra, but for the most part you can add whatever mix-in options for free.

I started off with the basic sauce, elbow pasta, and mixed in peas, mushroom, and crab (+$3). To top it off I did panko breadcrumbs and Hot Cheetos.

I loved the texture of the pasta, it was super cheesy, and the flavor was pretty good. Definitely needed some spice.

My boyfriend got the buffalo sauce, with shell pasta. He mixed in fried chicken, jalapeños, banana peppers, broccoli, corn, and peas. He topped it off with panko breadcrumbs.

His was a bit more flavorful, and the fried chicken was very yummy!

I honestly thought the food was very good. If I am ever in the neighborhood this would definitely be somewhere I consider. That's saying a lot because there is A LOT of amazing food in the neighborhood. My biggest issue was the slow service, and the confusion with the restaurant hours. Other than that, the lady at the register was very helpful, the food was solid, and the portions were definitely big enough! I would post my pictures of the food but they accidentally got deleted. Definitely got and check it out!
author: Kassie E.

description:
We as a party of 2 had to wait awhile to be greeted at the door that says wait. Finally a girl I'm casual clothing went up to the register and didn't greet us or anything until we asked if we could order yet. The whole time she was cold and didn't seem to want to be bothered by us. She even corrected how I said a word. -_- 
The food came out soon and was nice and hot and wonderful.
I can't wait to come back for some more great food. Hopefully the atmosphere will be happier too.

Sooo bummed they didn't have everything for the loaded fries.
author: Crystal G.

description:
Found this place the old fashioned way by being in the area and randomly on Yelp. Was blown away by the cool idea + and the fact it's Mac and cheese. Made up a bomb creation and have been raving about the place since.

Second time I've been there was post all the fb videos. Placed was packed and my to go order took an hour to get. Wasn't as tasty as the first time, but still bomb. Would go again as long as it's not at a peak lunch/dinner time to avoid all the customers brought in by those fb insider videos about the place.
author: Anna T.

description:
Personal bad experience.

What I tried:
*Basic Mac, shells, bacon, hot dog, broccoli, corn, truffle oil, panko

*Goddess, shells, bacon, chorizo, broccoli, truffle oil, hot Cheetos

Overall thoughts:
*Good concept

*Upon walking in there was a funky smell but could be the cheese

*The basic was nothing special to me

*My order was with goddess cheese which was overly heavy in flavor

*Personally think Homeroom tastes better and is more worth it 

*After eating I didn't feel too good in my chest/felt nauseous. When I got home my stomach was in pain and had to go to the bathroom a few times. However my bf who ordered the basic had no problems
author: Sarah W.

description: This place is so fun . It's simple you just chose what you want in your Mac and cheese and they make it ! It's all about what you chose, the first time I came here I got the buffalo sauce which was good but nothing compared to their goddess sauce the second time I came. I got goddess sauce, shells, mushrooms, chicken and topped it off with parmesan, panko, and truffle oil and wow it was to die for. It was rich but not too rich and so decadent. This place is fun and not expensive for how big of a plate of Mac and cheese you get and unlimited toppings ! The atmosphere is really nice but the first time I went here we waited for 2 hours but the second time just walked right in and ordered so watch out for the line !
author: Kloe K.

description:
I love Mac and cheese so was definitely excited to try this place. Definitely preferred the goddess over the tailgate sauce. Wish it was a tad more saucey and wish it was topped with cheese. Portion is very nice. However, didn't get much meat (bacon and ham) in my dish. Didn't get the wow factor I was hoping for. Looks like they raised the price from $10 to $11, still reasonable.

Brussels sprouts with honey sriracha drizzle was ! Loveeeeed!

Note: You pick up your own food and bus your own table.
author: Tina S.

description:
I thought this place would be a good start to write reviews since it's a happy medium so here I go.

My boyfriend and I are HUGE mac and cheese fanatics and we heard about a fully custom mac and cheese place and we were determined to go. The drive wasn't bad (it's SF so I mean I don't expect much) and the place was cute when we got there. There were two main issues when we went.

1. They completely messed up both of our orders. The person putting in the orders got it right, but the chef somehow forgot 3 of my add-ons and gave my boyfriend 2 that he didn't even want. We got them returned and remade, but that brings me to my next point.

2. The food wasn't worth the trouble. I actually enjoyed mine. I got the Goddess sauce with peas, corn, and shrimp. I'm a simple girl. I'll enjoy a good meal if it's decent. My boyfriend got the classic with bacon, and said his was bland and just had too much bacon in it; which I honestly though he would never say.

Overall, the place is good. Just... not good enough for an 1 hour and a half of a drive.
author: Skyler Y.

description: I like this place. I'm going to eat mac'd until my body becomes a conglomeration of macaroni and cauliflower melded together with cheese.
author: Geoffrey O.

description:
I've walked past this place a few times and finally decided to try it out last night. The location is pretty ideal since it is right next to some popular bars out in the Marina. Further it's open until 2AM.

There was a decent crowd inside, however, I felt the menu options weren't very varied. Their "pre-made" dishes were okay and nothing piqued my interest, so I made my own from the a-la-carte options available.

Now, I went with a group of people and their food came out pretty quickly.....but mine was nowhere to be found. I went up to the kitchen counter area and asked if James has been called and they shrugged me away saying that James was called a little bit ago. Confused, I went around and asked the cashier what happened and he was unsure as well.

After some standing around, they realized someone else took my order. The cashier then proceeded to punch in my order again.

I finally received my food and wasn't overall impressed with it. It was simply okay, nothing spectacular. 

Will I be returning here for a $12 mac and cheese plate? Probably not.
author: James D.

description:
6:40PM on Thursday night and it's fairly slow. Walked in with only 2 people ahead of us. I ordered within 5-10 minutes: I got the goddess, bacon and mushrooms, parmesan and truffle oil.

It's good but HEAVY as hell. I can't even eat that much of it. I wish I didn't get the truffle oil. 

4 stars because I asked for shells and got elbows. If it wasn't for the truffle oil I think I would have been in love.
author: Erica D.

description: Our order was wrong 2 times, but it could have been wrong 20 times for how good the mac and cheese was. 1st time here, lifetime fan.
author: David H.

description:
OMGoodness gracias! My family and I went to The Color Factory for the day but I heard about this place and really wanted to try it. Thank goodness I did. I didn't like the wait but I appreciate it since they are making the mac & cheese as you order it.

Anyway, I ordered the shells with goddess sauce, chicken, truffle oil and Parmesan cheese. I can't even start to describe how GOOD this combo was. 

We don't live in SF which is bittersweet when it comes to this restaurant LOL but I promise I will stop here every single time we visit.
author: Atija R.

description:
Style: following the recent hype of customizable restaurants but with a Mac and cheese twist. It was a base price of $11. I love personalizing my food and considering that toppings are unlimited it's pretty worth it. 

My order: the goddess sauce, shell pasta, corn, bacon, chorizo, truffle oil, parmesan, and hot Cheetos with also a side of fried Brussels sprouts with bacon and ranch. First off I am not a Mac and cheese person but the goddess sauce (I'm a garlic girl all the way) was amazing and hot Cheetos are my favorite chips, so win. I also just loved the way my first bite also exploded with truffle taste and lastly the brussels sprouts had a decent amount of bacon BUT I kept on stealing my friends truffle fries because it was crispy and flavorful. If you look closely you can also see that they have interesting Korean ingredients like kimchi and gochujang. I couldn't finish because they gave me a decent amount so I had an extra meal the next day. 

Location: love that it's in the Marina, which is an adorable location with a lot of stores you can window shop and explore afterwards.

Parking: this is San Francisco and this area is one of the more difficult areas to find parking and I ended up using a meter and paying for 2.5 hours worth of time because...

Wait time: I would say I waited around 1.5 hours in the line and 15 minutes for the food to come out. I heard I came on an epically crazy day and the manager came out multiple times to warn people so it's not like I was blindsided. I also think of lines as a way to give me more time to catch up with my friends. (Only reason I took off a star) 

Overall: I knew that this place recently opened and still had kinks to work out (wait time) but with an affordable customizable mac and cheese, I would go back. Definitely check it out if you have the time and found free parking!
author: Maybo H.

description: Be prepared for the wait of your life. Looooooooooooooong lines but it's the prep time that takes a while. The service is very slow and there's usually a line outside the restaurant. Limited seating and you are going to be very close to the party next to you. The menu choices appeals to a variety of taste. You choose a pasta type, sauce, fix-in's, and toppings. They also have fries, fried chicken (kinda random) that you can add to your order. You pick up your own order, and you buss you own tables, it's $11 for a medium portion. Overall, it's a good meal but if you are in a hurry don't bother.
author: David H.

description: Had to try this place out after all the hype lately with the Mac and cheese scene in America. Never been a huge pasta or Mac snob but hey why not pretend for one night. MAC'D is located in the marina right off chestnut street. The line was about 20 people deep and the wait took about 30 minutes to get our order in. They only had one cashier working. Once we did order, the food came very quickly (maybe a 5-10min wait). I ordered the basic with shells with all the veggie options for toppings. Flavor was good and I like the fact you can add an unlimited amount of toppings for no extra charge. Also ordered a side of the honey  sriracha Brussels which were . I added them into my Mac and it was pure genius. Would be interested in trying the carb free cauliflower option if I'm back anytime soon because it's a heavy meal. But if you're into Mac n cheese, stop by and get your fix!
author: Kara N.

description:
I went here with two friends at 2 pm on a Sunday. We got our food at 4 pm. We stood in line for what seemed like forever. There were only two people working (not counting the kitchen). There was one person taking orders AND serving drinks AND we also saw her clear tables. The other person was preparing the food onto dishes, and calling out ready orders.

I think it's ridiculous, having to wait 2 hours for mac & cheese. It was our first time here, and in any other situation we would not have stayed to wait that long for Mac & cheese. We just wanted to try something new, which made us want to stay.

When we finally got the food, our orders were right (sort, of), but I had my friend's food and she had our other friend's food, so we had to exchange dishes. I also ordered Hot Cheetos as a topping, but I didn't have any, hence our orders were *sort of* right. I don't know how that happened because our dishes were made at the same time. If I had to wait 2 hours for Mac & cheese, I'd like to at least receive MY order and have it made correctly. But yes, I do understand that there were a lot of people, and they have to be fast.

I think they are less busy on weekdays, so if you don't want to stand in line for and hour and a half, don't go on the weekend. It's only $11 with unlimited toppings, which I think is pretty affordable. The place looks nice, and they have stickers :)
author: Mayeann A.

description:
Gimme Gimme Gimme Dat Mac N Cheese. So good we made a song while dining there! 

It's a cool concept and you can build your own too by choosing the pasta, sauce, mixings and toppings. 

Great place for some comfort food especially on a cold summer day (SF = cold summers!) or even colder winter night! 

Also open late so hit it up after a show or club!
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Ordered off Postmates due to the specials they had so only reviewing this based off to go order. 

I love the concept first of all. Who wouldn't like customizable Mac and cheese? Sauce, pasta type, and tons of toppings. Sounded mouth wateringly great!

Overall taste was decent. It's heavy of course but what Mac and cheese isn't? The reason for the 3 stars were we asked for the hot Cheeto like topping and it seemed a little stale and not tasty. Also for $11 bucks the portions were big but I don't know if I would say it's worth it. 

Would love to visit and try out again
author: Melissa L.

description: So you've seen that viral video going around Facebook too? Okay so here is the scoop: this place is more for aesthetics and social media postings. The food is average at best. The overall concept is good. Food made just the way you want it. Personalized and quick to cook meals are always something that is enticing. Waited roughly 45 min to place an order before the peak hours of the afternoon on a Saturday (which was expected considering the hype behind this). The prices are decent, especially considering you are in the city. Parking is extremely difficult in this part of the town, so I'd recommend taking public transportation. I'd say this place is worth a try overall, but isn't worth coming back to in my opinion.
author: Franchesca B.

description: Cool concept where you can customize your own Mac but the flavors were missing a bit. The inside of the place was really clean and cool. Would come here just once to try it out for the hype!
author: Christina W.

description: I came here with some friends around midnight after a night out. I cannot wait to go back. I love the build your own idea and the options seemed endless. The food was delish, they had vegan options and the prices were very fair and they are open late. Like I said I can't wait to go and defiantly recommend going here if you are a MAC and cheese lover or if you a looking for a tasty vegan Mac and Cheese.
author: Shannen R.

description: This place is amazing! I saw it on YouTube and since I'm in the city, thought I'd try it. The way it works is first, choose the type of cheese sauce, then noodle type (elbow, shells or cauliflower), mix-ins (i.e. chicken, shrimp, veggies, etc.), and then toppings(i.e. hot Cheetos, panko, etc.). You can add as many as you want and there are vegan options. I heard it gets really busy, so I'd suggest on weekdays, coming before 5p and weekends, either when it first opens or closer to the closing time. Parking sucks! Lol
author: Deniece B.

description:
Absolutely AMAZING Vegan mac n cheese. I went with all my friends who eat dairy cheese thinking I'd just drink some water and wait till I got home to munch but was extremelyyyy happy and excited that they offered vegan cheese. I ordered mine with all the veggie toppings (except jalapeno) with panko and truffle oil on top - Wowww. Literally so delicious I demolished it within minutes. Will most certainly return to this spot again. 

Bonus perks- water was cold and delicious, restrooms were clean, food was served promptly, and the dining area was clean and nicely designed as well. Most importantly, the servers were very kind and friendly. In fact, I believe I had the good fortune of having the owner help me with my order. He was v thoughtful/kind and even followed up with me to see how I liked my mac! Overall 10/10

Also for some context: this is my first ever yelp review. I've never felt compelled to write one, but I was so happy they served a delectable vegan option for a hungry drunk me I just had to leave a rave review. 
Thanks Mac'd please keep serving the vegan option, good on ya!!
author: Sonia J.

description: We were in SF and my son had seen an add for MAC'D on Facebook, so we tried it! Let me just say it was amazing! If you are in the area you must come here!!!
author: Bobby B.

description:
Yum! I really liked how you can get an unlimited number of mix - ins for a set price of $11! The goddess had a delicious garlic flavor! My sister felt her pesto sauce was on the weaker side however.

I also got the Brussels sprouts and they were delicious! It was crunchy, sweet, and a subtle taste of spicy. It was more sweet than it was sriracha but it was still good. The loaded fries was tasty as well and made me want to get chorizo on my Mac next time.

The only disappointment was that the quantity was small. I was expecting my fork to dig in but it was a thin layer. It was still filling, but it seemed smaller than Homeroom. Overall I prefer MAC'D though because of the price and being able to customize.

There is a good amount of seating inside and each table had a variety of hot sauce! Tobasco, Crystal,  habanero sauce,and more that's escaping me. There's plastic forks but also silverware if you're eating in! Eco friendly
author: Cristy L.

description: My meal was luke warm. Maybe a one off but what a turn off for macncheese. I like the vegan options & tasty assortment of hot sauces though!
author: Amarita S.

description:
I went to MAC'D right when it opened and found the service to be okay. Found it weird that they didn't offer the mini size and that you had to get a regular by default. 

I decided to keep it simple and ordered the mac n' cheese with the goddess sauce, elbows, chicken, bacon, and hot cheetos topping. They added broccoli when I cancelled it on my order. It took awhile for me and my friends' orders to come out even though we were the only ones there. 

When we finally got our food, I found it to be okay.. Nothing really special especially at the price of $12. 

However, I really liked the atmosphere and the design of the restaurant. It's a great place to catch up with friends! I'm glad I experienced it, but I'm not sure if I would come back.
author: Arianna B.

description: This place was a little bit "cheesy". Saw it on my feed and decided to check it out. I'm glad I did because this place was so delicious. It was easy to order, affordable, and super yummy. I had the basic, elbow, ham mushroom, chorizo, hot dog, truffle oil, and extra pork on top. When I tell you it was yummy...it was yummmmmmmmmy. Ill be back to try the different combinations. Need more of this place in the bay area.
author: Joaquin A.

description: It's glorified Mac n' cheese. I got the hellapeno sauce with crab and flaming Cheetos. It had a ton of cheese that I got full after 5 bites. It wasn't spicy enough so I had to add sriracha for some kick. They definitely don't skimp on the ingredients and portions are huge but you'll feel sick if you eat it all by yourself so share it with someone or 2 other people. Me and my friends should've done that. The wait was long about 15-20 mins but we were hungry so it seemed longer.
author: Julie N.

description:
I have seen great things about this place. So, curious, I went on Sunday with a bunch of my friends. I don't regret it at all. I am a huge fan of Mac and cheese and this place just fills all of my worldly mac and cheese desires. I got the buffalo sauce, which has a slightly spicy taste. There were so many different additions one could put inside the Mac and cheese. I got broccoli, peas, bacon, and some more other delicious things. (I can't remember that all). 

The interior is fairly clean. It is extremely fashionable and cute. The menu is laid out on the wall and it is very simple. The sauces are described in a side menu but also on their website. The food came out at a fair time and was hot when it did. 

I look forward to coming back soon.
author: Naomi C.

description:
So, to start we had to wait in their hallway instead of in the building. Why is that you might ask? Because the people in front of us who went past the opening got screamed at to back up outside until they're called to order. Wow.

Finally get up to order, and that is a quick process. For two bowls, one with fried chicken, one with crab, and two sodas was $37.

We get our food and we both got "the goddess" which is supposed to have Garlic. Check it out, if a recipe calls for a clove of garlic, I use 4. I'm like 25% garlic at this point in my life, and they had WAYYYYY too much garlic. I legitimately couldn't taste the cheese.

As for those meat add ons? Two flavorless chicken strips, and my wife couldn't find any crab at all in her Mac.


So rude staff, super expensive, and doesn't taste great. I'm calling it, this place is only rated highly because people are unaware or unable to cook their own Mac, or find a better place.
author: Gabriel F.

description: This was a very different and interesting place. This was my first time going to a place where you can make your own Mac n cheese. I thought the concept was great. We got hot Cheetos, parm cheese  and chicken on our Mac n cheese and it wasn't bad at all. I would recommend this place to people who love Mac n cheese. Chill vibes.
author: Anthony M.

description:
I got pretty creative with my order of Mac n cheese, they have so many options to choose from. I wish I had enough room in my stomach because the portions are BIG! I also ordered my Mac n cheese with hot Cheetos and I really liked the flavor, it wasn't spicy at all :) 

Finding parking can be SUPER stressful but worth it!
author: Alejandra G.

description:
Ordered the Mac with the hellapeno (honey + jalapeño) with bacon, ham, corn, mushroom, hot cheetos, panko, and truffle oil. 

Couldn't really taste the cheese. I would eat the shell individually and it just tasted like it came straight from the boiled water. Nothing out of the ordinary.

Service is really slow. Cashier who was taking the order seemed new, which is understandable, but the manager/owner? had her clean the tables as she was about to take an order. I didn't understand why he couldn't have taken the orders while she cleaned the tables. Does not know how to work efficiently. After we sat, I saw him train her and they were talking in front of the cashier while the customers were waiting. What is up with that? Could this not have waited after the line cleared up?

Overall, I would not come back.
author: Alina K.

description: The line was out the door and took about 30 minutes to place my order, be seated and get my food. I got the garlic sauce and they weren't lying when they said it was strong. Overall I don't think I would come back unless they have faster service.
author: Carly S.

description: Who doesn't like mac n cheese!? It's simple and delicious. This place is just genius, choose a sauce, type of pasta, unlimited fillings and toppings and make this simple dish, as adventurous as you want it to be. Totally worth it!
author: Maria R.

description:
My first MAC'D experience was at my friend's birthday party last night, and I can say with confidence that it's going to be added to my weekly Marina dinner rotation. 

MAC'D has all the toppings and all the hot sauces you could ever want on your mac and cheese including meats, veggies, and crazy toppings like crunchy hot cheetos! I'm all about the classics, myself, and went with elbow mac + bacon + jalapeños. 

Can we take a second to pause and talk about the bacon? They completely surprised me with cut up pieces of thick-cut juicy Millionaires bacon, not the cheap baco-in-a-can stuff! I would highly suggest going with that, but if for some reason bacon isn't your style they have a lot of other great options, crab, lobster, tri-tip--you name it! 

For those trying to keep their meal somewhat healthy they serve brussels sprouts (but like the tasty trendy ones, not the steamed ones your grandma makes on Thanksgiving) and also offer the option of cauliflower mac for $2 more.

The best part about Mac'd other than the food, service, and overall vibe, is that they're open until 2 AM! You best believe I will be stumbling out of Sabrosa and over to MAC'd to get my drunchies fix!
author: Liz S.

description:
DO NOT GET THE VEGAN. I couldn't even eat it. Sad, oil puddles, weirdly sweet, half the portion of the regular, couldn't find the toppings I ordered. 

At least they had a vegan version for me to try, but it was soooo bad. 

My fiancee liked hers though. Basic, elbow pasta, crab, chicken.
author: Mitch C.

description:
Delicious mac and cheese, and how could it not be when one of the toppings you can choose is TRUFFLE OIL? 

Love the clearly laid out menu - you just go down the list and choose your MAC sauce - #basic (cheese), goddess (garlic), or hellapeno (self-explanatory), and then pick AS MANY toppings as you want from the list afterwards. *heart eyes* 

Major points also to:
+ the beer. Harmonic Brewing! Adultify that traditionally kid's meal.
+ the decor. okay okay, it's all straight off of Instagram, but I'm falling for it anyways.
+ the brussels sprouts. the cool, new(ish) hip vegetable. deliciously crispy!

Will definitely be back. So glad I was finally able to stop in.
author: Patricia K.

description: Fun lunch stop for a group of friends! The Mac n cheese has a flat rate, with only a few premium toppings adding extra charge. The portion sizes are fairly generous, which was a nice surprise for the bigger eaters in our group. There's a good amount of seating inside, although I'd imagine it would be more crowded during dinner. I saw a lot of people ordering to go during lunch. There's some fun neon signs for pictures! Parking is street parking.
author: Rachel A.

description:
One of the cafes I finally had time to go to closed their kitchen which I didn't know about so I had to find somewhere else to eat lunch. When I was looking through Yelp, I came across Mac'd and saw their mac n cheese dishes and strangely got an instant craving for mac n cheese so I decided to head there. When I arrived, I noticed their "Stay Cheesin'" neon sign which I love. 
You order by choosing your sauce, pasta, mix ins and toppings you want. I believe the toppings are unlimited. A total of $10 for everything you choose, but if you add crab, shrimp or tri tip, it's an extra $3 and lobster is an extra $6. Their drinks are $3 too. They only have one side on their menu and it's fried brussel sprouts, which I'm not really a fan of and I didn't think that went well with mac n cheese. Their drink selection is minimal. I wish they served iced teas like a lychee green tea. 
I find the place to be really spacious and there were lots of empty seating so I didn't feel rushed to find a seat right after I ordered. 
Our order took longer than I thought it would. It took around 20 minutes for our order to come out. I understand that there were other orders that needed to be made but it seemed like some of the employees were standing around and talking in the beginning. 
I was really hungry so when my order came I ate up most my mac n cheese. It was good and fresh but it wasn't that special. I don't think it was worth the time and money but it was good if you want to give it a try!
author: Kristin H.

description:
The food was good. Not amazing. And I'm someone who LOVES Mac n cheese. The staff was also very very rude. We came in with a group of 6 of us. After half of us ordered, the next one of us went up to the cashier to place her order and she looked at her and said "we didn't call u up yet" and sent her back and proceeded to make us wait another 15 minutes without explanation while the rest of our party had sat down and received their food. 

The goddess sauce and the cheese fries were really good.
author: Ary B.

description: I love the whole idea of make your own Mac&Cheese and so many options. But omg like it's a once a month cheat day kind of meal. So much
author: Christian M.

description:
The spot on the street in the Marina area is beautiful. The space is spacious and the decor looks fun and very instagrammable though the furniture is just okay. The food however, bleh! Some of the worst mac & cheese I've had. I ordered the hellapeno, with mushroom, tomato, hotdogs and jalapeno, toppings: panko/parmesan. The cheese, tomatoes, hot dogs everything is cheap quality ingredients. Their website says they have whole wheat pasta which they do not. The serving dish isn't iron or ceramic and doesn't hold heat so even if they cook the mac & cheese fresh it loses its heat very fast. I asked for spiked lemonade and they were out of the alcohol. Their menu is on butcher paper, I think they could've made a note. I do appreciate that they have ketchup and hot sauce widely available on all the tables. Won't be returning, big disappointment. I walked in feeling so optimistic but left feeling irritated. 

To fellow Mac & Cheese lovers, I much prefer Mac Daddy in Portrero Hill though I understand their location isn't the same. Homeroom out in Oakland is also a great alternative!
author: Natasha B.

description:
Love the concept, BYO mac n cheese! the goddess cheese sauce was garlicky and complimented the seafood I had added to it. They put it in the oven so the panko and permasan created a nice crust. Def recommend and will come again when I'm in town. Wishing u guys all the best and hope to see you in sac one day!

I had the goddess sauce with the shell pasta with shrimp crab peas corn peppers tomatoes jalapenos with panko truffle oil and permasan topping :)
author: Nada B.

description: I didn't even think mac & cheese like this existed. Some of the most delicious flavors like ever had. Root beer pulled pork omg  don't forget to try the fries with the goddess sauce
author: Tim B.

description:
Jordan's 20th Birthday.
We asked where is the line we read about on yelp, it's during the weekend.
You will have open service with smaller if not any line.
The staff is friendly. 
The food delicious!  One bowl feeds two people plenty.
We had Goodness- shell elbow- crab- shrimp- broccoli- mushrooms- parm- truffle oil.
Yum!!
author: Darlene K.

description: Went for my first mac and cheese dinner,  it was fun to order what you wanted them to make for you! My mac and cheese was delicious.  I had several toppings to make it my own.  Very friendly and patience for a first timer!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
We went after The Insider released the short clip on Facebook about the restaurant so the lines were SUPER long!


The restaurant is small with pretty limited seating considering how many people came out to try it after the video posted. There is a hallway before you enter the place and the owner came out several times to explain how much longer the wait time would be and to apologize and thank the customers for being patient. We waited about an hour to order and another hour to receive food. I know, I know. Crazy, right?

The food was delicious though! You could tell the young owner was not prepared for the outpouring of support but he handled the chaos like a champ and was extremely professional throughout. It seemed like the restaurant is family-friend run which was cool because there were great vibes between employees which is refreshing. 

My boyfriend and I each ordered our own customized Mac and both were AMAZING! I can't remember exactly what we got on them but you can't go wrong with the garlic sauce and hot Cheetos on top. Trust. 

Overall we would wait in line again at Mac'd and would definitely recommend it to others!
author: Jenny A.

description: Mac n Cheese taken to the next level. Came here with my husband and kids. My kids ate up everything and I must say if they like it then it must be good. Kids approved mommy is happy.
author: Tina L.

description:
The idea seems great, and the pictures make the food look better than it actually tastes. Nothing was that special about the mac & cheese here, except for that you get a lot of choices and combinations that you can try.

There were so many random toppings that I didn't quite think would be fitting together from the start. And the mac & cheese was definitely not special. The portion was very generous, however, and the service was fast. 

The store also has no air conditioning/windows, so it was a rather unpleasant to eat inside, and there's no outdoor seating. It felt very stuffy inside. 

Lastly, there is a tasting station in the back if you're curious about any of the sauces they have.
author: Karen K.

description:
don't talk to me right now i've had a long week i ffffing need this

literally ALL TOPPINGS bz ffff anything less. ya it ends up nearly $30 per bowl but ain't my fault my appetite's bigger than yours lol don't hate the eater hate the game.

tbt i asked for everything except jalapeños they threw em in anyway; i was -glad- they did. gtk they give you not what you want but what you NEED sucka.

outtapocket muhfuh walked up asking for "beastmode" i doubt he got what i got but kudos to him nonetheless. str8 COMFORT food y'all.

** longanisa still not on menu, tri-tip out of stock atm **
author: Dan B.

description:
Omg who doesn't love getting mac n cheese and being able to customize and add anything on their menu for $10!

My boyfriend and I checked this place out on a Sunday afternoon it wasn't busy when we came and there is plenty of seating in this place. When you come in and order you first choose your cheese sauce with regular basic cheese sauce, the tailgate which is bacon flavor, the goddess which is garlic flavor, or vegan. You then can choose your pasta if you want elbow, shell, or cauliflower. Then you can choose your mix ins like bacon, chicken, ham, hot dog, chorizo, mushroom, broccoli, corn, peas, peppers, kimchi, jalapenos, they will charge additional for seafood mix-ins: shrimp $3, lobster $6, or crab $3. Then you can top it off with panko, truffle oil, hot cheetos, or parmesan cheese.

I decided to get the basic sauce with elbow pasta, bacon,chorizo and top it off with parmesan cheese. My boyfriend got the tailgate sauce with shell pasta, bacon, chorizo, mushrooms, truffle oil, and parmesan cheese. My mac and cheese was good and I was able to eat everything off the plate, but my boyfriend's mac and cheese was even better cause of the tailgate sauce which is bacon flavor that made it better and flavorful. Next time I am coming back and choosing the tailgate sauce!
author: Daryl-Blythe A.

description: We tried the Marina District location of Mac'd.  Amazing!!!  The noodles were perfectly cooked.  Not soft or soggy.  Perfectly al dente texture.  The taste was cheesy rich but not too sweet.  Just right.  And the portion was really generous.  Great taste and value.  Perfection.
author: Anthony K.

description: The price was great and the choices were great. It lacked something major though and I'm not sure what. The cheese sauce drowned out the taste of the hot Cheetos which is too bad. The meats are great and the vegetables too. It looks really hip too with the inside designs and halogen lights.
author: Kalani R.

description:
Great creative place - make your own Mac 
Pick pasta or cauliflower
Pick cheese 
Pick add in
Pick topping 
Delicious !!!!!
author: kira e.

description: What a joke. 1 hour wait . The staff is young and dumb. Great Metallica rock music. This is not even funny
author: Jeff O.

description:
The Mac n Cheese was good. The place had a cool presentation due to the fact they only serve Mac n Cheese and have all these cool little add On's. 

The inside of the place was nice and chill, but ilthe lights were a little too dim. 

I liked it personally, what I didn't like was the customer service of the guy in the front register. We had never been there and were asking him a couple of questions about his recommendations and he literally answered "idk" to everything! Ummm.... 

They had different kinds of beer, not the usual we have, and we asked him what was the one people likednthe most and he kind of laughed in a demeaning way and said "all of them are the same." We felt uncomfortable. 

Other than that, food was good.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Pretty good build-your-own mac and cheese bowls. We ordered the Goddess (white cheese with garlic) which was bomb and threw in mushrooms, chorizo, bacon, and a sprinkle of hot Cheetos. The mushrooms were a really good addition (I really frigging love mushrooms). 

There's no decent Mac and cheese-focused eatery here in the city so definitely give it a try. They've just opened so word about this place is still spreading. 

(The Mac and cheese is super creamy so eat with a spoon cause the cheese will fall right through your fork. It tastes so much better.)

Also plenty of seating and super spacious and modern!
author: Kim L.

description:
amazing pasta, sauce,options ,variety, toppings! 
For 11$, I was full, satisfied and had so many flavors going on in my mouth.

It was after Khalid that I thought that I had to try this place. It didn't disappoint. The Godfather sauce with elbows and chicken, jalapeños, mushrooms corn broccoli, Panko, truffle oil is bomb!!!
author: Brandon P.

description: Food is great. Wait time is ridiculously long. I literally felt like I was at the DMV.
author: Dave R.

description:
If you're feeling naughty and can't quite shake your cheesy dreams feel good about smothering your Mac n Cheese in truffle oil and bread crumbs here. Price and quality sync up well, and I was more than content with my custom mac. The goddess cheese sauce (aka garlic flavored) is superb and they didn't skimp on the bacon. 

I'm sure this place is still working itself into the neighborhood but I would definitely recommend revamping the atmosphere.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Meh! I saw this place on buzzfeed so I decided to try it on my visit to San Fran... Is it as amazing as it sounds??!?! Not really. 

I tried and scored in a 1 to 10 scale....
1- Hellapeno with chicken and jalapeños topped with parmesan cheese. Score 7 cheesy and jalapeñoish. This was the best out of 3.

2- Classic topped off with Parmesan, Panko, hot Cheetos and fried chicken. SCORE 5. Meh you would think the hot Cheetos would give it a kick... But Cheetos can't do ALL the work.

3- The vegan with mushrooms and brocoli. No toppings.SCORE 6. Vegan cheese needed more flavor. 

We also tried the garlic parmesan, naked, and cheese fries... All were delicious.

I bought 1 fries, 1 Mac and cheese with fried chicken strips, and a coke and the total came out to $25. Was it with it? NOPE.

Skip it..... It's more the hype than the food.
author: Ana B.

description:
TL;DR - Get your cheesy fix here and get it your way.

Fast-casual mac and cheese concept that truly allows you complete freedom over what you want to eat. 

Step 1 
Choose a cheese base (I recommend the goddess) 

Step 2 
Choose your pasta (I usually go for the cauliflower)

Step 3 
Choose mix ins that are cooked INTO your sauce (kimchi, bacon, hot dogs for me)

Step 4 
Choose your toppings (panko and truffle oil)

Go and #getmacd
author: Crystal Z.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying this new macaroni and cheese place in the Marina. I came here with Zane who lives in the district I thought it had a cool concept. However, I was a bit disappointed. I had the Frenchie and ordered bacon chicken ham broccoli mushrooms kimchi panko parmesan crisps truffle oil and gochujang..umm that's a lot, but I firmly believe they left out broccoli, panko, and gochujang..I was looking forward to my mac and cheese but when it when it came I was like "ohh..hmm" and yes I do believe they left out more than one ingredient that is on my receipt..I know because the receipt is still in my gmail. Just look at my mac pic--do you see broccoli or panko? I also ordered the fried brussels sprouts and those were pretty good and not overpriced at $5. I also got a Parrot coconut water and that was $3. All drinks are $3. So I paid just a little under $20 for all this. Well, the mac and cheese didn't totally satisfy me, but I ate all of it. I thought the ingredients were lacking something..maybe flavor. The Frenchie is French onion soup base, but I couldn't taste it. 

I have heard about Homeroom in Oakland that serves up mac and cheese..I believe that is quite different in experience and quality. Well, I met one of the owners of Mac'd tonight-Chen Chen. I knew it was him because I saw their pic on the company website. He is nice and I really hope the best for this new venture. Who doesn't love macaroni and cheese? But what else could you get for $10? Hm..burrito, pho, some sushi, pizza, rice dish, fried chicken...Who knows? Maybe you will try out Mac'd in the Marina and like it more than I did. I hope so. I wouldn't mind going here again and trying a different combination of elements..maybe hot dogs, cheetos, lobster, etc. Oh, and one topping that would be good to put on the list is tomatoes.
author: Denise C.

description: Delicious... hearty and totally ideal for hang over days or even day after hangover days . The vegan wasn't available (which was a bummer because that's what I had originally wanted.) But the food was delicious and it seemed reasonable for the cost since you have unlimited choice of toppings. I would definitely recommend this to any Mac and cheese lovers!
author: Alana M.

description:
As a mac and cheese fiend, when I heard that there was a new build-your-own mac restaurant opening, I had to try it. This place is definitely off to a great start! You have a pretty standard menu to choose sauce/cheese type, noodle type, and extras like meats or veggies and toppings. I went for the classic cheese on shells, with bacon and peas mixed in and no topping. My friend went for the classic noodles with the goddess sauce and it looked pretty good too! My boyfriend also did the classic cheese with shells, but added in jalapeños, and a bunch of crust toppings. The great thing about this place is that everyone can create something that they like. The time it takes to order your dish and get it to your table isn't too long.

I would say two biggest issues were that the portions felt a bit small. I left still feeling hungry, and for $11 as your base for mac and cheese? You kinda want to leave feeling like it was worth your money. The second thing is while I demolished my dish, I left wishing the cheese was a bit creamier. All three of our dishes had the cheese melted, but it would bunch up once the dish was cooled. If they add a bit more cream to the sauces, it would be perfect.
author: Kristen T.

description:
You can never go wrong with mac and cheese. Pair that with unlimited toppings and your choice of everything, it's a dream come true. 

We were greeted by a cute light up sign at the entrance which was a total photo-op (+1)
The base price is $11 with add ons such as lobster, shrimp, crab, and tri tip for additional $3-6 each. There are different cheese sauces you can choose from and I chose the "Goddess" which was supposed to be a garlic cheese sauce. Meats such as chicken, hot dog, ham, and bacon are unlimited at no extra cost. I chose bacon, lobster, mushrooms, and corn. For toppings they have hot cheetos (!!!!!), truffle oil, and even the Korean gochujang. There a flavor station where you can pick up your choice of hot sauce. I was honestly BLOWN AWAY at how good Tabasco sauce complimented my mac and cheese. It's literally a match made in heaven!! My boyfriend preferred Frank's red hot but both were delicious. I was only able to finish half because it's so filling and heavy, but I heated up my leftovers a day later and it was still just as yummy.

We also ordered the fried brussel sprouts ($5) which were also pretty good but has a sweet taste to it. Another plus is they are open until 2am on weekends! You know where I'll be after a few hours of drinking! Just kidding, but I'll be back for more custom mac and cheese and to try out their cauliflower option.
author: Cecille W.

description:
I'm giving the 2 stars because the concept is fabulous, the prices are reasonable for the location, and the sriracha-honey Brussels sprouts were fine. 

I ordered the cauliflower with vegan sauce, crab, corn, and tomato. Like a previous reviewer mentioned, the cauliflower is ... crunchy. Not completely raw, but definitely not soft or warm, which would make it more pasta-like. That was a big disappointment. The vegan sauce was good, but a little low on flavor. I'd recommend getting something spicy to mix in if you're gluten intolerant and need to eat the vegan sauce (all of the other sauces supposedly contain gluten). Crab was $3 extra, but I didn't taste one single bit of crab in mine. I think they completely forgot to put it in. The corn was unremarkable (not fresh or particularly sweet or anything), and there were maybe 8 bits of tomato. 

I'm not sure I'll try this place again unless I hear that they upped their cauliflower game (I wonder if just a simple par-boil it before whatever else they do would help?), but if I did, I'd stay with the vegan sauce and add something spicy to the mix. 

The concept is so great, but the execution is lacking. Maybe the actual macaroni and real cheese are harder to mess up and folks without dietary restrictions would have a better experience than I did.
author: Diana C.

description:
Mac and cheese is one of my fave foods, so I was super excited to try this place! Loved the concept- "Chipotle style" mac and cheese where you choose your own toppings. 

The location is great, and the interior is really cute- I saw people walking by just taking photos of the neon sign. You have your choice of pasta (including gluten free, low carb cauliflower) and sauce. Then you pick as many veggie/meat/misc toppings as you'd like. Some are quite creative, like hot cheetos! I got pasta shells with basic sauce and veggies and crab in mine. 

Service was friendly and fast. The food itself was absolutely delicious! My mac and cheese was very flavorful and creamy - it had what I like in mac and cheese but more.  The crab was a good choice. I would also recommend truffle oil. I tried my friend's cauliflower one, and it was really good too. I will probably get it next time.

Overall I had an amazing experience and would highly recommend this place. I will be back!
author: Aimee Z.

description:
I was so excited when I found out this place had just opened up and I have to say, it did not disappoint! They let you customize your mac however you'd like it: choose your cheese sauce, pasta, fillers, and toppings. The great thing is that they have a lot of protein options you can add without additional cost, with no limit to how much you can add. They recommend adding no more than 7 toppings, but that's still a good amount.

I played it safe this time and only added bacon, panko, hot cheetos, and parmesan shavings to my elbows with the goddess cheese sauce. It was amazing! The hot cheetos were actually very subtle but complemented the cheese really well. I like that the elbows were larger than normal because it held extra cheese on the inside. Can't wait to come back and try different combinations!
author: Alexis N.

description:
The line was pretty average on a Saturday at 1pm, but It felt unbearably slow. There aren't a ton of seats in the store which kind of sucks. The waitress was really nice and the atmosphere was cool though. Wish they had dedicated parking but that's SF. 
I tried to go simple with my order (shrimp, bacon, the goddess sauce and Parmesan) and the flavors were super overpowering. In the beginning, the food was delicious, but after a few bites I could not even finish half because of the sauce. I also got the cheese fries and the basic sauce and seasoning they used was too much. 
I had really high hopes for this place but it did not live up to expectations.
author: Sean P.

description:
Good food. Good staff. Good time. 

I'm excited to add another food category to my fast, casual options in the city. Mac and cheese has been missing from the SF lineup of build-your-own burgers, burritos, sandwiches, salads... Top it off with a delicious set of healthy options (roasted cauliflower in lieu of pasta, or whole wheat noodles), and you can have a guilt-free meal any night of the week. I added tri-tip to my garlic mac and was not disappointed (picture to follow). 

Besides the food, the co-founders clearly care about their customers and I left feeling like I had 2 new friends. I love when owners invest as much in forming relationships as they do in their food. 

At the end of the day, what I liked most about MAC'D is that I look forward to meeting up with pals here to start and end nights (owners conveyed they're getting a liquor license soon). The atmosphere is great, they're right next door to nightlife, and they're going to be able to warm you up with a brew and help you wind down with some delicious mac & cheese. 

5 stars for good vibes all around.
author: Saleh E.

description:
Oooooooh boi o boi! It's been awhile I did a review so buckle up ladies and gents. 

First of all it's National mac n cheese week so we had to come here for it's grand opening. First the pricing...for just $11 you can get a really great meal that INCLUDES proteins already (there is tri tip and fancy meats for extra) this was a great surprise. The cheese to Mac ratio was on fcking point. Like omfg I would fan girl about this place forsure. 

The settings was typical of SF...hip modern and fun! Great for anytime honestly...


Oh and did I tell you I'm lactose intolerant? Spent the majority of the night on the toilet but 10/10 would go again. The toppings were cool too! Hot Cheetos! 


Overall this place is a breath of fresh air for me because the whole place isn't trying to be like someone which is rly common now a days in SFz
author: Michael C.

description:
Mac and cheese is literally one of my favorite comfort foods when I'm feeling down or happy. When Eater SF came out with an article around March 2017, I was in disbelief-a build-your-own mac and cheese restaurant?! Finally, the stars were aligning and things were going my way?

-My close friend and I made the trip to the Marina district for their grand opening weekend. Wow, I was en route to a restaurant that had A1 lighting for the gram as well as savory mac and cheese. When we entered the restaurant, we were greeted with an aesthetically pleasing neon sign that said, "Stay Cheesin'" The menu felt very personal and catered to customers, like we were the boss of what was going to be fed into our mouths. 

-When ordering, I debated between The #Basic, or The Goddess. After much time and thought was placed into my one order, I decided what extras to order with my Goddess. Next to the register, was a white board sign that had items not available to be ordered for customers. Since they were out of The Goddess, I I settled with The Frenchie (french onion soup flavored). I've never drunk french onion soup before, but of course I was expecting a very onion-y flavor to be left in my mouth.

-The wait for my mac and cheese took approximately 15-20 minutes, which was pleasant. Not too long, not too short of a time. My friend and I were seated next to where the mac and cheese was prepped, so we were able to see the process. Right when I sat down to wait, I heard one of the co-founders of Mac'd say, "2 Goddesses." What!? I thought they ran out of The Goddess? Were my ears fooling me? Just hearing that made me sad, but it's not like I was going to change my order right then and there. 

-After spending time taking photos of our creations, my friend and I dove into our macs. The peas were a pale green, not a cheery or healthy looking shade. The French Onion had a very faint onion taste. 

-My total was $10.80 because I checked in on Yelp and received $1 off the total. When I handed over a $20 bill, the cashier told me that she didn't have enough change. I was surprised since it wasn't like I handed her $100, but I obliged and instead used Apple Pay. 

The whole concept of a do-it-yourself mac and cheese restaurant is pure genius. I will come back just to try The Goddess, but hopefully they'll have it "in stock" as well as enough change for a $20.
author: Erica K.

description:
Issa bit expensive.

It's just Mac and Cheese. I don't really find anything that fantastic or unique about it and I've had it twice. Unlimited toppings is a pro but some of them are additional money so if you like lobster or something, this can easily become a 17 dollar meal...for a bowl of mac and cheese.

Don't get me wrong, it's good but it's something I could make at home. I'm a pretty big fan of Homeroom in Oakland because i feel like they have some pretty special pre-set mac and cheese. This place doesn't really do it for me.
author: Adrianna L.

description:
So yummy! I got a garlic mac with pasta shells + broccoli, corn, mushrooms and chicken. The hot cheeto crust I got with it won my heart!! My friends opted for the more decadent 'tailgate' sauce made with beer and bacon fat and you can definitely taste the beer in it and was super flavorful. There are a few places in this neighborhood where I can get an affordable meal that leaves me feeling satisfied and full! For a little over $10 this is a steal :)

Chen-Chen and Jason are the owners and they care very much about making their customers happy and are always open to any feedback and suggestions for new ideas!

Parking can be tricky since this is a busy area but is free after 6pm. We didn't have to look too long before finding a spot.

Can't wait until their liquor license comes in for Happy Hour. Will definitely come back again!
author: Shirley N.

description:
Overall AMAZING!!! Amazing quality, selection, despite being out of a few things (lobster, tri tip and shrimp). Menu has expanded to have French fries (3 kinds).  

Only bummer, line was suuuuper long today, but nothing that deterred us from eating here, very limited seating, so just keep your peepers open, but don't be that group that hasn't even ordered yet and straight up steal a table from a group who did order...that's a douche move.  

We were a group of three; I ordered the basic w/Shell pasta mixings were bacon, chicken, mushroom and corn (unlimited with reg order) toppings panko and parm. And it was incredible. The sauce was spot on for just a"basic" sauce. Super creamy and savory. My boyfriend ordered the cauliflower instead of pasta and now will only order that :). Just expect when it's busy to wait.
