We got in line at 1.15ish and finally ordered/sat down by 2.45ish. Sooo just make sure to have some patience with the busy times, it's worth it. The kitchen works their BUTTS off so, give them some slack, they're turning out delicious noms :). Can't wait to go back and explore more of the sauce bases. You will not be disappointed!
author: Emily A.

description:
Came here about a week ago, and I've been craving this Mac and cheese since! Love how you can build your own Mac and Cheese to fit your own personal style. I had the tailgate Mac and cheese with macaroni elbows, loganzina (which is a Filipino Sausage), peas, Parmesan shavings, and panko bread crumbs. It was so delicious! The price is also worth the amount of food you are receiving; that's always a plus in my book! 

My friends even had the vegan Mac and cheese, and I actually thought it tasted even better than the one I had! The fried Brussel sprouts were also a sweet and spicy compliment to the creamy and hearty Mac and cheese. 

Definitely will be here again, especially when they start selling alcoholic beverages ... I mean, beer with Mac and cheese... What more can you ask for? :P
author: Colleen L.

description:
I love the location and interior, it's very open and airy and friendly. Definitely a fun place to go and take friends or family. Also did not have to wait very long for the order which is always good. 

The Mac n cheese was yummy. Going in, I was hoping they did not slack on the cheese, and they did not! Lots of options for customization. 

My complaint is with the Brussel sprouts side. Literally just 10 overly crispy nubs, for $5. Not ok. Either charge $2-3 for the side or double the portion. Seriously, you can buy a whole bag of Brussel sprouts at the store for $5. 

Other than that I know I will be back very soon and looking forward to their continued success!
author: Christopher J.

description:
MAC'd was Meh.

I'm a BIG fan of Mac and Cheese so I was super excited to try out this place! With all the options they give you, I may have overloaded my options! After putting in broccoli, different types of cheese, chicken - it tasted more like me cooking up everything left in the fridge. 

Maybe I'll try again with less toppings :P
author: Suzie L.

description:
MAC'D brings the build-your-own concept to a staple comfort food: mac & cheese! Ordering is straightforward: for $10, choose a cheese sauce, pasta, and as many mix-ins and toppings as your heart desires!

I ordered the Tailgate (beer & bacon fat) with elbow macaroni, bacon, chicken, chorizo, mushrooms, & corn, and topped it off with panko, parmesan crisps, & truffle oil. On paper the list looks overwhelming, but all of the ingredients combined to create a delicious and hearty dish. Portions are very generous and you can certainly take home leftovers if you wish, but I finished my entire bowl and willingly accepted the accompanying food coma.

Service was quick and friendly! During our meal, Chen-Chen, one of the owners, came over to thank us for visiting and ask about our experience. The MAC'D staff clearly cares a lot about their customers and are very receptive to feedback. Overall, I had a great time and look forward to trying out some new combinations when I come back!
author: Anna F.

description: I was invited to come try out this new spot and I normally wouldn't drive all the way from San Jose, but I looove mac n cheese! I went simple and went with elbow noodles, the goddess sauce (garlic bechamel), lobster and hot cheetos on top. The dish was so good! It didn't leave an oily taste in my mouth like some mac n cheese dishes. The hot cheetos weren't as spicy since the cheese sauce countered the spiciness, but still so good! I just wish they'd cut up the lobster a bit more as I got 3 big chunks throughout. I will be coming back!
author: Stephanie L.

description: The honey sriracha Brussels sprouts are to die for and the MAC and cheese was bomb! I can't wait to go back and try something new and get more of the Brussels sprouts!!
author: Tahvooche S.

description:
I did not know what to expect when I walked into this place. I came in a monday evening and it was completely empty. The lady taking orders was very nice and helpful when she found out we had never been.

I ordered the elbows pasta with jalapeno cheese sauce, broccoli, mushroom and garlic topped with parmesan and hot cheetos. 

The order took about 7-10 mins-very fast. It was delicious!!! The only downside was that The hot cheetos were not spicy at all so that was a bummer. 

It is a good concept in that you can pick you pasta, sauce, ingredients and toppings. I thought it was a little expensive ($11.50) for a bowl of mac n cheese but definitely worth a try if ur in the area.
author: Minati D.

description: This is already instagram and social media famous and I don't need to say much. My friend and I went here on Sunday for late lunch (around 3pm). There wasn't much of a line and we got to order as soon as we got in. I got the elbow pasta with hellapeno sauce, bacon and topped it with hot Cheetos and truffle oil. I'd definitely recommend the hellapeno sauce and it's a Bay Area favorite according to them. And I HAD to get the hot Cheetos and it was the perfect mix. I had trouble eating the whole thing in one sitting because of the load of cheese (even though I LOVE cheese). I'd recommend sharing when your going
author: Julia M.

description:
This is a review for the vegan option. The sauce with panko topping was great, but the cauliflower was not cooked soft so it tasted hard and raw-- totally not what I expected. If you like raw vegan it is still bad because they could have made it cauliflower rice. What I got was chucks of hard, almost raw combo broccoli and cauliflower drizzled with vegan sauce.... and they served it luke warm, not hot at all! can't believe I pad $17 ($3 extra for vegan, $3 extra for cauliflower) for this little disappointing, un-satisfying meal....
Thank you but with all the right ingredients they could have made it such a wonderful dish. A waste.
author: Arya C.

description: Let me start with I don't like Mac and cheese that much, but my son loves it. With that being said we went here for a mommy son day, and my expectations were exceeded with how delicious the food was! The portions were huge as well, I ate twice from the amount they gave me! It was on the expensive end for Mac n cheese and the prices were not displayed very well which sucked because if I knew how much every addition was then the total wouldn't have been such a surprise. That's the only thing I would change about this place!
author: Jayme G.

description:
Food was delicious. Came in on 3/19 around 12-2 drove all the way from Pittsburg just to try this for my first time because of all the hype. 

Lady at the register wasn't so lovely it was my first time and obvious I needed help and she didn't assist me. Still did a 20% tip with no thank you at all. RUDE! I had to ask her to speak up like 5 times mumbling. 

I got the basic, with elbows and hot Cheetos on top because I'm extra basic. Food was delicious just wish it was hot it wasn't even room temp. Also got fries also not room temp either... I'll definitely come back and ask them to make the whole order next time extra steaming hot :)
author: Katarina B.

description: Mac and cheese a variety of ways. Parking can be difficult but well worth the walk if you like Mac and cheese.  Half cauliflower half elbow good.
author: Jovonia G.

description:
Build your own mac&cheese??? Unlimited toppings??? Hot Cheetos topping???? YES PLEASE.

OVERALL
Tasty food! Line is a bit slow (looks like there's only 1 cashier) but food came out pretty quick. Food was hot, cheesy, and delicious! I definitely recommend The Goddess cheese sauce (much tastier than the regular cheese sauce, has hints of garlic). Fries and brussel sprouts were tasty as well. It's definitely a trek to get there (Marina) but it's worth it! 

LINE
-Short, but took a while
-Only 2 groups in front of us but took about 15-20 mins until we got to the front
-Tip: make sure you know what you want when you're at the cashier! 

FOOD
We ordered 4 things total and it came out pretty fast 
-Cauliflower w/Goddess cheese sauce (highly recommend), chicken, broccoli, & truffle oil
-Elbows w/Basic cheese sauce, chicken, mushrooms, hot cheetos topping
-Regular fries
-Honey Sriracha Brussel Sprouts 

SERVICE
Attentive and patient staff. No table service, so you order, claim a table, pick up your order when called, then carry your dishes to bin when finished.
author: Danny C.

description: Such an easy concept I can't believe hasn't been done before since it seems like everyone loves mac and cheese.  My wife and I took our two sons here and they devoured their meal.  I liked that you could mix and match different toppings/flavorings and it was a relatively inexpensive meal as well.  Our family will definitely be back for some more cheesy goodness.
author: Blake B.

description:
The mac was good but way overpriced. $12 for a bowl of Mac n Cheese that had 4 small chunks of chicken. I get it, it's The City and everything is over priced but it's just mac n cheese for Pete's sake. 
The place was cool and hip and they have free water so that was a plus. Daughter really LOVED the hot cheetos topping so we'll probably be back some time. 
Food and service were good, the place was clean and it's in a decent neighborhood, just too pricey for me.
author: Joseph J.

description:
Food is ok. Very loud.  Came in at 8:30 on a Sunday, counter person/busser was very rude.  At 8:30 he didn't want to take my order.  We waited at the counter to order for over 5 min while he busses tables.  No line behind us. 

At 8:50 (they close at 9pm on Sunday) the same employee started putting chairs on top of tables.  I understand that you close at 9, but if you are still taking orders, you should not put chairs up, to me this is unwelcoming to sit and stay and eat.  Also as someone who is trying to enjoy their meal, it makes me feel rushed on top of already not feeling welcome. 

Food is meh.  Not worth the hype. Not worth a trip from anywhere. 

Homeroom in Oakland is leaps and strides better in every way.
author: Ben J.

description:
Started off promising. Quickly went down hill when our order wasn't recorded which required us to put our order in again. Not typically an issue but when gap between placing the order and knowing it wasn't successful is so great, serious questions come of management. 

Food was good, unfortunately. These guys have something here. Our order was wrong but whatever we got was pretty good. Too bad because they're on to something.

In these days, order entry is easy. Any place that hasn't mastered that is out of business. Simply put, come while you can because it won't be here for long.
author: Taylor R.

description:
Can I get an AMEN for this new slice of heaven? The options are pretty much endless; I was almost glad for the long opening weekend line, since it gave me time to decide what to eat. I ended up getting basic sauce on shells with jalapeños, longaniza, and bread crumbs, but I couldn't really have gone wrong with anything else. My friend got garlicky goddess sauce on elbows with jalapeños, mushrooms, bacon, and hot Cheetos, and it was also fannnntastic. I'm not a hot Cheetos fan in general - I've eaten them one time and pretty much wrote them off after that - but man, you put em on a mac and cheese and I am very much there.

The cheese sauces I had were both so, so satisfying. I find that mac and cheese as a side dish at a lot of places tends to be more focused on creamy texture than on a punch of flavor, but such is not the case at Mac'd. My tastebuds were all lit up the whole time. If you're worried that there won't quite be enough fireworks for you, though, never fear: Mac'd has a flavor station that is well-stocked with sriracha, Tabasco, Crystal, Frank's, and a few that are specially made for Mac'd. When we got there on opening day, these specially made ones were almost out, which is fair enough. Hopefully, that means there's enough demand that there will be more and more as time goes on!

A side of honey sriracha brussels sprouts made even my brussels sprouts-hating friend eat a couple of them, and the prices were really, really low. For most combos, it's $11 a bowl, and you can easily get two meals out of that. I did, and I don't even have self-control. Some premium toppings are extra, but you can't exactly fault them for charging you extra for tri-tip. TRI-TIP. IN YOUR MAC AND CHEESE.

The space itself is nice and clean, very casual, which is fine. I got my mac to go because the place was too busy to sit and eat. Even on opening weekend, the wait time still wasn't bad, and the food was more than worth it. I don't usually go out of my way to visit the Marina, but for Mac'd, I'm gonna make an exception, and I'm gonna make it several times.
author: AJ P.

description:
I wasn't super amazed, but I'm pretty happy with what I got for the price. The bowl was bigger than I thought it would be. Because of the different combinations that can happen, I'm sure you could get a really winning combo, but it honestly kind of reminded me of a college dining hall.

I got The Goddess w/ elbows, bacon, chicken, broccoli, peas, and topped it off with truffle oil and panko. If I tried it again, I would add more meat since it is complimentary to a point.

Overall experienced better food on my visit to SF - at the same time, this was my friend's favorite spot we went to. I think it is worth a try if you're passionate about mac n cheese.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Their Mac n cheese is perfect for a cheese lovers. It will fix any kind of cheese craving and the hot Cheeto on top is literally the perfect combination with Mac n cheese (I'm a huge hot Cheeto fan)

4 stars because it fixes your cheese craving to such an extent that you wouldn't wanna eat Mac n cheese for a while after having this delicious Mac n cheese.

I ordered: shells in goddess sauce with mushrooms and hot Cheetos, truffle oil and Parmesan cravings on top!
author: Radhika T.

description: This place is my dream come true. Who doesn't want a big bowl of Mac and cheese with ALL of your favorite toppings?! I had the #basic with elbow noodles (my friends had the buffalo and the goddess - which were also delicious). I had peas, mushrooms, hot dogs, bacon, ham, and panko crumbs on top. I mean, seriously, where else can you choose so many toppings for no extra fee? $11 total! My friend did get fried chicken on top, which was an extra $3, but worth it. Also, a pitcher of delicious craft beer for $15 - yes! I was a big fan.
author: Katrina L.

description:
It wasn't just the food but the experience of coming here was pretty fun. When I first arrived, there was a line that looped outside and an employee came out to announce it would be over an hour to get food from where I was standing. This caused at least a dozen people to leave and I was able to advance to at least the inside of the door.

Once standing near the Stay Cheesing sign I had a great time chatting it up with the people around me. Watching in anticipation together as we got closer and closer to the front of the line. Having our entire order memorized by the time we got there due to how much time we had to repeat it in our head and make changes. Then when we finally got to order, having to wait 30 more minutes for it to come out so we got to watch the chefs grate Parmesan cheese in the most entertaining way.

I ordered the Goddess with elbow pasta, bacon, chicken, hot dogs, mushrooms and corn with panko and truffle oil. The macaroni itself was fine, could have used more of each topping though but overall was good for its price. Would come again just not when the line is over an hour.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
The concept of their business is different and was very appealing to me. A place where you can customize your own Mac and cheese? Yaas.

However getting in line and waiting 40 minutes or more was not as appealing.. And then eating Mac and cheese that was not really piping hot in my opinion. Meh. The Mac and cheese seemed to cool down very fast and was just warm to me. Also the truffle garlic fries sounded good when I ordered it off the menu, but they were pretty mediocre.

They also only have one cashier taking orders AND making all the alcoholic beverages. Customers in line had to wait for the cashier/bartender to finish making other peoples drinks before attending to them. This could have been a day where they were short a person? I'm not sure if they usually have someone separate making drinks but probably not. So the wait could be a while but it could be easily fixed by having more workers to take orders.
author: Shaina D.

description: I was so excited to eat here and left disappointed. This was one of the most underwhelming meals I've ever had. I ordered the Green Machine, asked for no Panko and it was served covered in it. Ok not a huge deal..the real disappoinment was the lack of flavor in my food. The pesto and cheese blend did not even come close to satisfying my taste buds. Our order of garlic truffle fries was not even worth eating. The French fries had no flavor, no salt, and all of the truffle oil, garlic and cheese was just thrown on top (in what looked like a rush). I wanted to love this place because I LOVE Mac and Cheese, but I don't think I'll ever be back.
author: Caroline S.

description:
FINALLY- delicious and affordable comfort food 

Came across this gem during their soft opening and I am sooooo happy I did! 

1. The amount of food you get for $10 is awesome, I was stuffed halfway through my plate. (Note: reheated Mac'd is delish)
2. There is a wide variety of add ins, cheeses, pastas, toppings. I got the classic cheese with shells, kimchi, hot dogs, chicken, all topped with some crunchy panko. All of this was included in the $10!
3. Service was quick, interior is clean, vibes are strong
author: Alex K.

description: Cashier wasn't helpful and greeting; the food was lacking flavor. Won't come back. The prices are fair tho.
author: Zeynep D.

description:
I love mac and cheese so I was super excited to hear that a make-your-own-mac restaurant was opening up in the city.

I ordered the classic with shells and hot cheetos to top it off and it tasted like creamy nostalgic goodness. About halfway through my bowl I started mixing in different hot sauces with each bite (they have like 4+ different sauces) and my favorite with this combo was sriracha. They also had a goddess cheese sauce that is supposed to be garlicky and I LOVE garlic so I'll have to come back and try it!

Definitely coming back to MAC'D next time I have a mac and cheese craving - or hopefully I'll be able to order delivery soon and get to savor this delicious meal from home.
author: Youri P.

description: This is the chipotle of mac and cheese! I was excited to try this place because mac and cheese is definitely one of my go to comfort foods. I came here with my best friend on a Monday night around 6:30 pm, and surprisingly, parking wasn't an issue at all (especially because it's located in the marina district). I got the shells with tons of veggies, slathered with garlic sauce and all the toppings: hot cheetos, panko breadcrumbs, and truffle oil, nom...I thoroughly enjoyed my mac and cheese, but it didn't blow my mind enough to come back. =/ It's a good concept, and I love the idea of being able to customize my food. It's definitely a place that mac and cheese lovers must try for sure!
author: Shannon L.

description: This place is order at the counter and sit down. The line can get pretty long. We went at 9:30p, so it wasn't so bad. I noticed they only have one register so that makes things take a bit longer. If they have two people taking orders it would help. Once you order the food come out really quick. Each table has a basket of fixins', like all the hot sauces you could want. It's really cool that you can add toppings and veggies, as many as you want for free. We tried the goddess, that was my fav cheesy base. We also got the hellapeano which was also yummy cuz it had kick but wasn't as cheesy. I added peas, mushrooms, broccoli, tomato and spicy Cheetos on the top. We also had the sriracha Brussel sprouts and they were bomb, I'm really glad I added them. Def add those on as $5 side. I would like to try their vegan 'cheese', there is a $3 up charge if you get that. If I was in the area I'd def go back, but I wouldn't wait in a hella long line for it.
author: Terese O.

description:
I came because I had to see what all the hype was about. The food was good but it was not worth the 1 hour+ wait that I had to endure.

When ordering I noticed that they are not very accommodating. I ordered cauliflower with cheese and pesto. I wanted to try the Cheeto crumbs but I didn't want it on my entire dish so I asked for it to be on half of it...the woman taking my order said they couldn't do that. I asked for it on the side and she said the same thing. 

My friend wanted the loaded fries and since it came with bacon she asked to take it off since she's a vegetarian. Again, the woman taking our order said no so we settled for the sriracha and honey brussel sprouts that were gross. Definitely a waste of money for that side dish. 

I definitely won't come here again unless I so happen to walk by and there's no line and that lady that took my order the first time is not there lol
author: Debvora W.

description: This place is super small inside, but a fun concept that they execute very well. I think it is relatively new. My only complaint is that for a custom mac and cheese place I think they should have some more customization options. It seemed a little limited for a place that basically only serves one thing. I also agree with other reviewers that it can get very loud in there as well. What they do serve though is pretty good mac n cheese. I enjoyed what I got and would consider coming back.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Super solid Mac and cheese place with fully customizable offerings. Most of the mix-ins and toppings are unlimited with a few seafood exceptions. I got the Goddess (garlic base) with shells which were the perfect vehicles for the gooey sauce. They forgot 2 of my mix-ins (banana peppers and Jalapenos) but it turned out fine. There is a variety of hot sauces available in the "flavor station" near where you pick up your food. Don't forget to bus your own tables!
author: Dani T.

description:
My bf and I have been here 2x but only actually ate here once. The first time was in January when their video was all over Facebook, it was so packed, the line was out the door & the wait was 3 hours (1 hour waiting outside, 2 hours from the door to be able to order food). My bf and I ended up going somewhere else because we were hungry and didnt want to wait another 2 hours. The 2nd time was yesterday. We came around 10pm for a late dinner, the worker there did not seem that interested in taking our order because he was talking to some employees prior to us walking in. After taking our order, he went to go chat with his friends again.. lol

The food was.. salty and tasted spoiled. My bf got the goddess with crab and mushrooms but there was barely any crab. I got the goddess with ham, chicken and bacon. When we tasted a few bites of it, it did not taste good at all. It tasted like the whole mac n' cheese was spoiled. We couldnt even eat it based on how bad and spoiled it was. Ended up throwing it away. Few hours later, my boyfriend and I got food poisoning.. 

It was my first time ever getting food poisoning. Dont plan on going here again with this bad experience.
author: Julie Anne P.

description: I came in on Sunday at 12:40PM, and the line was totally fine - in about 10-15 minutes, the line exploded and went out the door! I was pretty worried it would take a long time to get the food, but we waited about 20 minutes, reasonable for the amount of traffic there was. It seemed like it's pretty understaffed - only one waitress at the bar taking orders and making drinks. The food was worth the wait though! The cauliflower mac and cheese was surprisingly good - good texture. I wasn't super into the garlic goddess sauce, and I felt the chorizo mixin was sparse and far between. I was super surprised by the collard greens - it's SO delicious. It's very tart, but pleasantly so. It's a great contrast with the cheesy and rich mac n' cheese. Eat your greens!
author: Ke C.

description: Chris AKA heartofzeus has treated me great every time I have visited MAC'D. He has great customer service. The food is amazing!!! 10/10 would recommend.
author: Andrea N.

description: I am really sad to give this place 1 star because I was so excited about this place but the experience I had was unforgivable. I ordered two bowls of mac. One of them had a entire clump of hair. It almost looked like nose hair. They got the orders completely wrong, and the owner was not that forgiving after I showed him the hairs. When they made the order again for us, it came out completely gross with a disgusting amount of sauce (picture attached). I wish I took a picture of the clump of hair but I needed it taken away from me as soon as I saw it. On top of all this, they are extremely understaffed so the service was very slow. Would not come back.
author: Sonal J.

description: I was craving some Mac n' Cheese and found this place on yelp. I arrived here on a Saturday night at 9:54, mind you their hours say they close at 2 am on Saturday's. All the blinds were down and their chairs were up. We knocked on the window because we saw someone in there and wanted to know why they closed so early. A person opened the blind and rudely yelled that they were closed. I understand if it was an hour early or if a reason was provided but 4 hours early and rude response?! To me that is unacceptable. They could've at least told us a reason for closing and not be so rude.
author: Gloria H.

description: I should be concerned that my toddlers favorite "restaurant" is the "smiley face Mac n cheese store" where he sits at the bar with his dad and consumes massive quantities of white carbs with fat sauce but.... I have a picky eater and he gets lots of veggies (peas, broccoli, corn, tomatoes) here and he prefers to go without his annoying mother so it's kind of a win all around.
author: Poppy C.

description:
After seeing the video on Facebook, I'd thought I'd try it out with my boyfriend after visiting Museum of Ice Cream. 

I ordered:
sauce - the basic (which has everything)
Pasta - shells
Mix-ins: chicken, bacon, tomato, corn, mushroom, and crab (extra $3) 
Toppings: Parmesan & truffle oil.

I was really excited to try this and first bite was decent. But as I tried to look for my protein (especially the crab since I paid $3 extra) I couldn't find much protein. That was disappointing. Barely had any chicken in it too. I didn't even eat half of it and I was dissatisfied that I gave it to my boyfriend to finish. Also felt like it wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be. 

All I gotta say is that this place is overhyped. Not that special here folks.
author: Tabitha Gail M.

description: WOW. This place is amazing by far my favorite meal I had when I was out San Fran. The fact that they had an option to put hot Cheetos on top of you Mac&cheese did it for me. I highly recommend trying this place. Not only was the food incredible but the service was just as good, everyone was so helpful and informative. Thinking about my meal is making my mouth water... as you can see in the picture below, it was heavily doused in a creamy sauce (specifically the garlic sauce w hot Cheetos on top) I literally finished the whole thing.
author: Adelina O.

description: On the website says they open till 2 am on Saturday. I drove almost an hour just to see they were already closed at 1:10am.....
author: Candy T.

description:
What's sad about Mac'd is that if it weren't for the wait, I may return. 

The food was satisfying, to be sure, but not good enough for the wait. The organization is the true issue at Mac'd. 

This is a quick-service restaurant that halts the line if the kitchen is overwhelmed. It's a bit of a confusing concept (coming from the food industry) as their menu isn't very broad and that means pumping out mac and cheese after mac and cheese shouldn't be so overwhelming for the kitchen, pending having good organization back there (and they seemed to have a great flow). The line kept halting every two or so parties, which was only totaling to getting in no more than 6-8 orders of mac and cheese at a time; once we reached the front of the line and we realized what exactly was going on, we became frustrated more than anything else. 

The cashier wasn't very understanding when we ordered, but we watched a manager (?) ask the FOH to get cups of water prepared for everyone braving the line, which is such thoughtful customer service. 

The goddess garlic sauce was really tasty; the pesto and original were so-so. If I passed by and there was no line, I may stop by....but maybe not.
author: Sarah M.

description: Custom mac n cheese spot and came here to see the hype. I personally came away all together satisfied with it. Got the jalapeno cheese sauce with mushrooms, chicken, bacon, broccoli, and truffle oil and bread crumbs. Also tried the loaded fries. True stick to your ribs and food coma alert on those. Get ready to wait a while in line to order but the food comes out rather quickly once you do so. Pleased with the food and would come back soon again
author: Aaron T.

description:
I backed this place on IndieGoGo, so I was glad to hear they opened. Short version:  killer comfort food.   Longer version:  friendly staff, warm atmosphere, quick service. No parking, so a delivery option would be nice.  They've had service in the past through door dash, then cavier, but they seem to have a hard time.  

That's probably a good thing for my health, though.   If I could order Mac'd at will, I'm sure I would become a shut-in pretty quickly.
author: Rik C.

description: Very tasty mac n cheese! Love that you can completely customize it with unlimited add-ons. Service was nice, and the portions are pretty big. We went during the week during an afternoon and were the only ones there. I've tried a place like this in NYC and when I saw that they had one here in SF, I had to try it, and it did not disappoint!
author: Rachel G.

description: I love mac and cheese! So when I heard about a place in SF that serves customized mac and cheese, I had to come here with my best friend to try it out. It is a nice small place in Cow Hollow and the staff there is nicely welcoming. It was about $12 for my plate and I finished it pretty quickly despite the size. It is a nice place to hang out, especially if you are a mac and cheese fan. I might return here in the future for a quick meal.
author: Merrilyn W.

description: I love Mac & Cheese, so we had to take the drive to try out customizing our own meal. Got in just before the afternoon rush, which was awesome. By the time we left there was a line out the door. This place is okay but definitely not worth an extended wait.
author: Kiera L.

description: My husband and his best friend found this place online so we had a special trip from Sonoma County to check it out. The young lady at the front counter was sooooo sweet and helpful. We really enjoyed our visit. The portions were large, I felt like I couldn't really make a dent in my dish. Loved all the options.
author: Kristeen D.

description: I heard about MAC'D from a featured Facebook video, and when I decided to travel to San Francisco, this fast-casual restaurant was one of my first stops. The restaurant offers a choice of sauce, noodle type, add-ins and toppings. I ordered shell pasta, the garlicky 'Goddess Sauce", tomatoes, broccoli, crab, truffle oil, panko, and shredded parmesan to top it off. I also ordered the bacon-ranch brussels sprouts. The food was good and looked & smelled amazing, however the Goddess Sauce was very liquidy and my mac barely had any crab--which costed extra to add in. I LOVED the brussels sprouts. The location was very clean and the staff was friendly. I am glad I tried MAC'D but I am not sure if I would spend this much on mediocre mac any time soon.
author: Leah G.

description:
So I love the food here, but my last three visits  have compelled me to write a review and ding Mac'D for their customer service. In each situation, they've demonstrated that not only are they not friendly (I'm okay with neutral service), but they're down right patronizing and antagonistic (to the point that I think they want to lose business). 

Situation 1 (from a couple of months ago): tried to order one of their specials and asked if I could substitute the pasta with the cauliflower; got a 3 min ranting lecture explaining why they couldn't. I'm fine that they can't, but it's not written anywhere on their menu board, and a polite and curt "sorry we can't" would've sufficed. 

Situation 2 (from a few weeks ago): accidently asked for a "side" of the chicken (instead of a "topping" of the chicken) and was rudely greeted with "can't you read?"... Ugh. Would it have killed you to have just said, "did you mean the topping?" 

Situation 3 (today): walked in the door at 11:05 am (their advertised opening time is 11 am) and was promptly scolded out of the store with a "we aren't open", and then proceeded to hear the manager(?) scold a poor worker for "accidently leaving the door open". If you advertise a certain opening time but can't meet that expectation, please don't take that out on me. 

Seriously, not impressed by the customer service (the little things count), and yes, will think hard about coming back.
author: Richard L.

description: The food was amazing! Simple! If you love cheese this is the spot. Only complaint is not that big on the drink selection and it's really hot inside the place. Set those 2 things aside and I probably would of given this place a 5 Star...
author: Sebastian S.

description:
I think this place is great! Mac and cheese was always my favorite growing up so I was really excited to discover this place while walking around San Fran. I like the idea of choosing what pasta, cheese, and toppings to put in your dish. I wasn't feeling that adventurous when I went, so I just opted for the Basic cheese sauce, ham, bacon, and panko. There's lots of options for you to mix in like vegetables and seafood (although idk about the idea of corn being in mac and cheese..)

My friends and I all got different sauces so we could try it all. The Goddess had a really distinct garlicky taste that was apparent, but not overpowering. The bacon/beer sauce tasted good too, but it wasn't as cheesy as I'd thought it'd be.

The toppings are unlimited and they all cost $11, which is a little bit on the pricey side but I thought it was a good experience. Also forgot the portion size is pretty big - irl it looked kind of disappointing bc I thought it was a lot smaller, but I could barely finish it.
author: Phoebe L.

description: Pretty good but not amazing. I ordered the elbow noodles with the hellapeno sauce (sweet and spicy jalapeño cheese sauce) with jalepenos, Parmesan, and hot Cheetos. It was spicy and tasted good but I got tired of it about halfway through. My friend got the cauliflower instead of noodles which I tried and thought was really good. I would recommend that if you don't want the super carb heavy meal. Also I tried a bite of her pulled pork which was also good. Definitely worth the try.
author: Emma H.

description:
The best Mac and cheese I've ever had. I got elbow with the goddess and crab/bacon. Holy moly it was good. I found out about this place because of Facebook. This is a must eat at (especially if you leave mac n cheese) 
The order came out really quick and there's a lot of seating inside. This place is so cute!
author: Lambert T.

description: The wait was worth it! Delicious macaroni with different combinations. I liked the customer service while we waited in line when they brought us water.
author: Hicham J.

description: Great Mac and cheese made to order. Not a long wait time but wish there were more tables.
author: Olga Z.

description:
Came here on a Friday night and there was no wait and plenty of seating available. The concept Mac'D has is fun; you have four basic mac and cheese entrees (The Basic, The Goddess, The Tailgate and The Frenchie) that you get to personalize to your liking with a variety of different toppings. 

Service - 4/5. Cashier was really friendly. Gave us a few suggestions on his favorite ways to personalize the mac and cheese. 

Food - 3. I ordered The Goddess with ham, truffle oil and panko, and the bf ordered The Basic with tri tip and panko. We both enjoyed our food, but I have to say I prefer the mac and cheese at Homeroom in Oakland more.

Value - 3/5. About $10/entree, a pretty good deal for a restaurant located in the Marina.

Environment - 2/5. Tables and floors looked like they needed some cleaning. We had to wipe down the tables before we sat down because there were crumbs everywhere.
author: Jennifer X.

description:
Lol this place is really good but I could only eat it once in my life.  2 out of 3 times I've been here they've been out of the vegan cheese.

If your gonna offer it order it, or don't offer it asshole
author: Bradford B.

description:
Mac'd is such a cool concept. Customized mac & cheese is something that I've always wanted to eat - I'm so glad it's finally here.

I tried the garlic sauce with elbows, chicken, bacon and mushrooms. The  sauce was rich and very flavorful. 

Can't wait to come again to try more combinations!
author: Wonjun J.

description: MAC'D is a hole in the wall mac n cheese lil cafe in the city & is honestly way better than homeroom & it's cheaper too! ($11 for customizable Mac n cheese!!!) I got the garlic cheese sauce(I hella forgot the name lmao) w chorizo & mushroom and hot Cheetos & Panko bread crumbs on top. Also tried the loaded fries and they were pretty good!! They also have a variety of hot sauces so you'll never be left bland  If you're in the sunset district DEFINITELY give this place a try!!!!!!
author: Marrion M.

description: This was one of my favorite spots in San Francisco. My fiancé and I love trying different types of Mac n cheese. The options can seem overwhelming but you really can't go wrong with any of their toppings. Our favorite combo was elbow, hellapeno, and hot cheetos. The garlic aioli Brussel sprouts were amazing. If you're looking for a variety of dishes, this isn't for you. If you're a Mac n cheese lover like us, you will surely enjoy.
author: Dipesh P.

description:
I felt this was great for its price and amount of food.  I went on a Sunday night and there was no wait whatsoever. I got the traditional with elbows, chicken, truffle, broccoli, and Panko. 

Broccoli was super finely chopped. 
Chicken was nice white meat. 
Truffle was noticeable. 
Panko added a nice crunch. 
Perfect amount of cheesy and great hot sauce provided for a little kick!
author: Carly A.

description: Delicious! We were worried we'd be paying a lot for nothing and it turned out to be reasonable and it filled us up! Make your own Mac and cheese!
author: Natalie E.

description: Great comfort food and tasted great!  I thought the portions would be larger though by the way the meal was described to us by the employee taking orders... I'm glad we ordered 2 different dishes and French fries or we would have still been hungry.  All ingredients were really fresh (didn't have any seafood, though) and loved that it's made to order.  We will definitely return!
author: Dee F.

description:
Over rated. We got 5 bowls and they messed up 4 of them. They also gave me part of the lady's order before me and her mine. It took us over an hr and half to get food. It tasted good. But it's Mac and cheese, can't really mess that up.... 

It was worth it for the novelty......but not the wait. Plus, they were CLOSED during LUNCH TIME!?  WTH?
author: Ashley G.

description: We went to the city from Stockton because my wife is a huge mac and cheese fan. The line was crazy long, swear it was like waiting for tickets to see Black Panther, but we'll worth the wait. My wife enjoyed her mac, it had buffalo sauce and chicken, and I was pleasantly appeased by their bacon ranch brussel sprouts.... This place is worth the effort of traveling to the city and waiting. Don't believe me, go try it for yourself.
author: Edward K.

description:
Oh lawwwdy lawwd!  

The mac was great. I asked for jalapenos and asked if they were raw or grilled. They said raw. They were pickled.  OK fine.  The mushrooms were a nice touch and the cheetos shavings was novel. 

Be careful with the hot sauces. My goodness. These will cause a time release explosion.  Be careful.
author: Steve S.

description: I really wanted to give this place a 5 star. Build your own Mac is such a great scheme. However, a 2 star is even a stretch. They were out of bacon. The fries were plain, cold, and had no flavor. I ordered the BBC, but since they were out of bacon, I opted for double chicken, which I didn't get. I'm really disappointed. For $30 (2 Mac orders and a fry order) I would've much rather made this at home.
author: Tony S.

description:
So incredibly overpriced for pasta and cheese sauce, extremely skimpy on the items mixed in (literally a single piece of broccoli).  They also got my order wrong.  They had 3 items (sauce, pasta, broccoli), and couldn't get it right.  The aluminum container wasn't even half full.  I was there with my friend, and both of us had the same really small portion for $12.  It's such a cheap set of ingredients, and yet we both left saying we were going to go home and eat something else.

Last thought: they automatically set the lowest tip option at 15%.  You pick up your own food and bus your own table.  It's tacky to default to 15% tip for that, especially when the portions are so small.

Never going back.  It's for millennials who don't know how to cook, or out of towners ok with being ripped off.
author: Lauren C.

description: The food was very great. The place was clean, a friendly greeting . Only bad thing was the chicken tasted old and it looked gray
author: Ana P.

description: I love Mac and cheese but this blew my mind! They catered for a work event. 10/10 would recommend
author: Alexandra B.

description: Paid $17+ for a small pile of cauliflower and cheese that costs less than $4 at Trader Joe's. Huge rip off.
author: Amit R.

description: This restaurant is amazing and very affordable. So cute. And delicious! I got the basic Mac and cheese with bacon and Panko crumbs. Nothing better than a beer and some Mac and cheese! Will be back when we come to San Francisco again.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Let me start off by saying this review is for the vegan cheese sauce only. Verdict? Not great. 

Mac'd has a lot going for it. I love the concept of build-it-yourself mac and cheese and the huge selections of toppings you can add (for no extra cost, woo!) is great. And I can truly appreciate that they offer non-dairy and gluten free options because creamy pasta options for the lactose intolerant is hard to find. 

I got the elbow pasta with vegan cheese sauce and broccoli, mushrooms, crab, panko, and truffle oil. We watched them make our pasta and it took a good 10 minutes, which isn't a long time but seemed excessive given that the pasta they threw into the pan was already cooked. When I got my dish and the pasta was mushy - it was hard to separate the pasta from the sauce, which was super thick. On top that, the entire dish was really fishy. I understand I ordered crab, but it tasted like it was on the edge of being rancid. Not the most pleasant experience. 

But what really turned me off to this place was the fact that they continuously use the same three pans to cook all the pasta orders. The work stations are out in the open so that patrons can watch their orders be assembled and cooked; After I got my order, I watched the cooks use the same pan (without being cleaned) for another order. There were still remnants of my vegan sauce. The new order was not vegan and had cheese, cream, and bacon. I can only assume that the pan used for my order was not cleaned as well. I'm dairy-free and pescatarian by choice, but there are people out there that are hardcore vegans and have actual intolerances. Knowing that they use the same pans and cross contaminate the vegan dishes with the non vegan ones is really disappointing. The establishment itself is new and the staff seems slightly inexperienced. I won't be back, but I hope that this is one of those early lessons they learn quickly and correct this as soon as possible.
author: Michelle Q.

description: The Mac and cheese itself was really good but the hot cheetos topping it were sadly very stale
author: Krysta F.

description:
The Goddess  (cheese) with shells, bacon, chicken and topped with hot cheetos. Nice place, was not busy at 6 pm on a Saturday. Place your order, relax while they prepare it. Easy walk from our hotel.

Went back a second time, which is saying A LOT! We don't double up when on vacation. This place may be new, but they have a winner. Hope they make it. I'd love to see them elsewhere in the U.S. Had more people tonight (Wednesday), but still got in, ordered and got our good is an appropriate amount of time.
author: Scott M.

description: Food was so great. Abby was super friendly. It was our first time being there and couldnt make up our mind on what to order and yet she was patient enough waiting until we get ready. She asked us what we like and made some suggestions that we may love. Thanks for the excellent customer service Abby. Because of this experience, for sure we will be back.
author: Abigail A.

description:
Build your own mac and cheese is definitely a great idea, it's the ideal canvas for almost any flavor combination. This place definitely comes through in terms of serving up a hot bowl of savory, gooey, cheesy goodness, although it has a couple of minor glitches. The mac itself is solid, choose your shape and sauce and add-ins, I kept it simple with bacon and peas but you can go absolutely crazy with stuff like Cheetos.

Although the food is good, the restaurant itself leaves a bit to be desired. On an early weeknight they didn't have a big staff, so the food took a little while since only one woman was doing the cooking. The layout and presentation of things like silverware and condiments seemed scattershot, like they just dumped them wherever there was room. There were also quite a few flies buzzing around, not confidence inspiring, and the place is incredibly spartan, with almost no decoration, like a college dorm room the day you move in before you've hung anything on the walls or bought a comfy chair.

For a place that only serves one thing, it has potential since everyone loves mac and cheese and theirs is definitely tasty and comes in big portions. They just need to work on making it a more inviting space in which to eat.
author: Joe L.

description: Came on a Friday right about 5 no line no crowd. Will def come back before it's 2 trendy
author: nancy w.

description: Foods great, prices are decent, portions are huge! And the employees are great. The chefs seem to enjoy their jobs. I over heard one of the chefs say that his creation (my bowl of mac and cheese) was beautiful. Lol. Over all great experience. I definitely recommend if you're an mac and cheese lover.
author: Kitresa Q.

description: This place is the bomb. Been looking at it for months with people at work wanting to go. They said let's do take out, I said no let's do it fresh, by the time we get back to work it won't be the same. They we happy I was right. Check them out. Goddess with truffle oil.....you won't go wrong.
author: Mike F.

description:
To begin with extremely hot inside, super uncomfortable in the summer

They sent my husband's mac&cheese 20' before mine
When mine arrived it looked like vomit... and there was no crab, as ordered

The idea is great, bad execution though
author: Paula Z.

description: Unfriendly and unprofessional environment. Had to wait for 30 min just to order Mac and cheese. Watched them mix up my order, and giving it to another customer. Then watched that customer eat it and take it back to the kitchen then the kitchen gave me that already eaten food with a hair in it. I would not go back.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Mac & Cheese = creamy, rich, gooey cheese w/ some noodles.  
This place = noodles with a coating of "sauce".

For those who love all the options. Not gonna lie.  The selection is pretty awesome & unique.

But for those who want what imo mac & cheese should be.... rich, creamy & gooey etc etc.... this is not the place for you.  

Apart from that...  whilst waiting in line and upon seeing other people's dishes.  I asked for extra, extra sauce.  Even if the sauce was on par... Either the noodles somehow manage to suck it all up or the (frying) pan just doesn't have enough to begin with.  The basic base sauces sound great but are a bit watery & bland.  It's possible that by adding all the "toppings" it becomes more flavorful... guess i'm behind on the times.
author: CatwomanRoar M.

description: Excellent food concept. Large portions. Takes about 15 min to wait for food. Love add-ins like bacon and hot Cheeto crumbs. They use a variety of cheeses for each sauce choice. Goddess sauce was garlicy and tasty.
author: Corinne N.

description: The Mac and cheese at this place was super awesome. They could expand their toppings selection a bit but I loved their sauce choices. I got a "goddess" which is cheese and garlic flavored sauce with mushrooms, tomatoes, Parmesan, panko crumbs, and truffle oil. I also appreciated the vegan and gluten free options where you could do use cauliflower instead of pasta and they had vegan sauce. They mixed up our orders but the cashier was very great and fixing it.
author: Pri J.

description:
Delicioussssss. Got the goddess, shells, lobster, with hot cheetos as a topping. I also tried the basic, elbow, bacon, with truffle oil (this was so much more flavorful with the truffle oil!) 
You get your order in, wait and a chef comes out cook it for you. Take a minute to take pictures of the cute neon sign (Stay Cheesing) in the walkway entrance. 

The portion was just right and I was pretty full (full enough to tour around MOMA after for   2 in a half hours)
author: Dre D.

description:
Where the hell is my crab??
Stopped in after a day of hiking at the Presidio at about 3:30. In order to counter the actual progress I am making towards a healthy lifestyle, I decided to stop by here and try it out. Easy 2 hour street parking on Chestnut, most of the time. After a scenic 15 minute walk past quirky markets, gourmet restaurants, and houses I will never be able to afford, I arrived at the restaurant, entering through a whimsical white hallway with the ever-classy quote 'Stay Cheesin.' I stepped up and the guy working the cash register gave me a rundown on the sauces and told me I could add on anything for free unless stated differently. I went with their Goddess sauce (garlicky,) chicken, hot dog, peppers, hot cheetos, and splurged for crab (+$3.) I got my food and dipped out without checking the contents of the bowl. I got back to my car and got going. I opted to eat in the car, allowing me to get a head start on the crippling city traffic. I whipped the little tinfoil dish out and  dug up like an animal. So crispy, yet so creamy and rich. Could have done without the soggy, chewy hot cheetos.  But damnnnnnnn. Then I remembered about the crab I added on. I could clearly see the hot dog and chicken that I ordered, so where the hell was my heavily anticipated crab? I frantically started stabbing at everything that even resembled meat and ramming it in my mouth. No luck. I have a particularly eventful history regarding screwing up orders, for better or for worse. I tried to be angry but the mac was so creamy and mesmerizing and all the flavors blended so perfectly that it was impossible. After inhaling the whole portion, I decided to call MAC'D and tell them about the issue. It wasn't for the measly $3 (although you'd never walk by it if you saw it on the sidewalk,) it was now a matter of principle. Stuck in the stupid city traffic, I talked to the manager, Barbie, who apologized about the mishap. She offered me a free mac next time I swing by. I was gonna take it but then I realized I probably wouldn't back for a few months and I didn't know how reliable "tell them Barbie said it's free" was. Like what if I'm there in 6 months stacking my mac with lobster and such running up the tab, telling the cashier that "Barbie said it's free." What if they're like "who's Barbie lol that'll be $22.47." I told her to kindly refund whatever to the card they charged. Whether she did the whole meal or just the crab is unclear, but I'll take it. Overall, MAC'D is another awesome, trendy San Francisco restaurant.
author: Nicholas S.

description: I had MAC'D today for lunch with my family, and it was absolutely amazing. It was everything I expected and even more! The cook even brought the food to our table, and was so amazing! I definitely recommend eating here! It was sooo good
author: Emily N.

description:
I've never had a cook or server take my food, stick their nose in it, and eat it front of me. But that's just what happened today.

The cheese sauce and mac is mediocre at best. The toppings (outside of seafood) are "free and unlimited" but only because they literally give you minuscule amounts of each. For example, I ordered broccoli and literally had two ridiculously small pieces. Each piece was the size of approximately half a Cheerio. 

BUT, the biggest reason why this is one star is because of the service, specifically because of one particular worker. I ordered crab on mine and like the broccoli it was extremely small. It was so small that after 5 minutes of digging around the plate for the crab, I couldn't find it. So I asked the workers where it was. This particular worker took my plate, stuck a fork in it, stuck her nose in it, and was able to find a single piece of small crab. Seriously, the single piece of crab was the size of a pinky nail. Then, she proceeded to eat the piece of crab in front of me and joked about it. When I confronted her, she didn't replace the crab or say sorry. She just walked away. WHAT KIND OF SERVICE IS THIS? It completely ruined the mood and experience. 

The workers all seem like they're no older than college freshman. The lack of maturity and professionalism towards me as a paying customer is unacceptable. Fix the service, hire new and better workers, and you'll have a much better restaurant. But until that happens, do yourselves a favor and go to Mac Daddy on Potrero Hill or Homeroom across the bay in Oakland. You'll have tastier food, bigger portions, and a much more enjoyable experience than this place.
author: Danny L.

description:
this plac was f*cking awedsome 
Excuse my language I'm not from around here
Mac and cheese was cheesy and f*cking awesome
I like a lot of food and this food I like it a lot 
when I left this place I felt like that one Spongebob caveman picture, rejoiced.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I think this place is great! I'm kinda sad the kimchi was taken out tho :'( 
A huge pro is that the portion size is really big(for me at least), honestly I can hardly finish like half. you guys should come out with like kid sizes haha. 
I really like the goddess with panko and bacon, but next time I come I'll definitely be trying it with some seafood!
author: Erin K.

description: Waited 2 hours for my food. My friend ordered before me and I got my food 30 minutes before her. She had to ask how long her food would take and they told her she was behind 12-14 people. Did they forget her order? Over all: terrible service and waste of time. Could get a good meal somewhere else and save time.
author: Rila C.

description: I don't like to give bad reviews but hopefully this will help someone out.... went in on a Saturday at 3pm. It took 5 minutes to order. The order taker had no idea what had dairy in it and what didn't. It took ONE HOUR to cook 3 bowls of macaroni. Thankfully we walked down to the water as we saw nearly everyone in the restaurant was waiting for their food... it should not take an hour to make a bowl of macaroni and cheese....
author: Isabelle K.

description: I saw this place on Facebook and got super excited about a build your own mac n cheese place. This was completely mediocre mac n cheese. The basic sauce was too strong of a cheese and the goddess was better, but got too garlicky the more you eat. It also seemed like it was more cheese itself than a cheese sauce.The portions are HUGE so you could probably share with someone. The service was a little slow and it seems overpriced at $12+ per bowl, but again the portions were huge.
author: Allie O.

description:
Don't go here expecting to have the best Mac and cheese of your life. For what the place is (a fast foods and cheese restaurant) it's decent.

Friendly staff and fast service.

I ordered the shell pasta with broccoli and the goddess sauce with Pablo topping to go. The dish came out pipping hot and was exactly what I was expecting. 

Great place for kids.
author: Maura M.

description: My family and I tried this place based on the good reviews we saw. I love the variety they give you in regards to choice of sauce, type of noodle, and a ton of toppings! My wife had a pulled pork, ham and bacon Mac n cheese plate that she said was fantastic!! I had the Vegan sauce, shell noodles topped with crab and it was delicious! The only reason I didn't give 5 Stars was because it was a little bit of a wait for the food but almost feel like the food was well worth the wait.
author: Carlos H.

description: The food is amazing. The place is great my 4 year old loved it! .... The cleanliness is not great the bathroom reeked of pee, the tables were sticky. You are supposed to just sit anywhere and that's fine but it would be nice if they cleared old drinks off the tables
author: Seferina R.

description: The mac and cheese is definitely good here, but not worth a ONE HOUR wait! Can someone please explain how it could possibly take ONE HOUR to make mac and cheese!! This is an inefficiently run restaurant that needs to get it together
author: Alison Y.

description: Delicious Mac n' Cheese with crazy delicious toppings? Can't go wrong. My favorite combo at mac'd is the pesto sauce, with corn, mushrooms and jalapenos, topped with panko or hot cheeto crumbs. Also LOVE the truffle oil. This place is unique for SF but I give it a 4 stars because I still love Homeroom in Oakland a tad better. One portion is definitely more than most can finish in one setting...it's very heavy so definitely keep that in mind when ordering!
author: Nidhi M.

description: I came on a Saturday afternoon and the line was about 30-35 minute wait. The wait and price was worth it especially since you get to customize your order. Both my boyfriend and I really enjoyed our meal there and it was really filling! The macaroni was cooked perfectly. We also got the truffle fries which were yummy! Service was alright, the girl who took our order seemed like she didn't want to be there at all and came off a bit rude. Other than that I had a good expierence and would come again!
author: Cheresa T.

description: This place is always empty, which is weird for a hip spot in the marina. Try it, but I'd be shocked if it stays open for much longs.
author: Johnny D.

description: YUM. Okay so the Mac n cheese was delicious.. but I'm rating 4/5 stars because they messed up our orders and my friend found a zip tie in hers. But the staff was super apologetic and remade hers quickly and gave her a refund. So our experience was a bit sloppy but despite that, the Mac n cheese was so good.
author: Iris G.

description: Wow. This whole hype is not even worth it. Takes about 40+ mins to order a simple Mac and cheese dish. Seriously? Not happy. Will NOT recommend.
author: Jenn L.

description: The late night macaroni and cheese was great. And the customer service was also great. The people working were so patient and accommodating. I will be back!
author: Kyra D.

description: Great food and great customer service. I came in confused about how to order and the person behind the counter didn't rush me or say I can help the next person in line while you decide. She talked me through the process and helped me choose what toppings might be best with the type of cheese I've chosen and it was great. The atmosphere is definitely one that is family friend and very hip so be ready to take some instagrammable photos while you're here too.
author: Eileen K.

description: The mac and cheese here is NOT good. Is it just me? Honestly, was not worth trying and I was pretty disappointed.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
This place was a HUGE letdown! 

First of all, the menu (which is handwritten and can easily be updated) boasts 'Bottled drinks galore' yet when we ordered, they had NOTHING. NO drinks. Why would you ever open a new restaurant with no drinks? It just makes no sense. And when I asked about water, I was told the water carafes would be "refilled soon" as they were all empty. After ordering, we were told to expect our food in 20 minutes - 20 MINUTES! For 2 bowls of macaroni and cheese at a place with 2 types of noodles and 4 sauces on the menu? There is absolutely no excuse for a 20 minute-wait time. I was also extremely turned off by the plastic forks. So I just spent $36 on 2 bowls of mac and cheese and you don't offer me a real fork? Cmon, you can do better. 

The actual mac and cheese was meh - at best. There was no difference in taste from the basic and the tailgate cheeses and the tri tip was really poorly cooked. And while they did not skimp on the lobster, it was nothing special. 

We left hungry. Spicy cheeto toppings will not keep this place open.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Custom everything, perfect for my late night druchies 

I got the goodness with peas, mushrooms, crab, topped with panko, Parmesan, and truffle oil  the crab was scant (and $3 extra!), but it was overall just stellar
author: Audrey P.

description:
This review is only because this spot is brand new. I am sure they are working out kinks, but if they take customer feedback they might literally be the only spot that has survived that location. We will go again to see how it goes because this has the potential to be the "lazy cold rainy SF dinner spot".

The interior needs a more "permanent" look. The interior design screams temporary. Which may be intentional until they see how it does, but still.

They ought to make the menu board a bit more...something. There were no descriptions of the sauces visible. I mean I THINK I know what "Tailgate" includes, but I have no clue what "Goddess" is. It would look better (and be cheap) on chalkboard vs the magnet-looking letters.

Love that you can choose cauliflower instead of pasta.

The mix ins are great. Wouldn't add anything, wouldn't remove anything. Which leads me to:

There was almost no broccoli in mine. Yet, mine had some of my husband's jalapeños in it. Pretty sure they used the same spoon while
cooking/serving. Very bad for anyone with allergies. Particularly since they serve shellfish. It just needs
to be standardized. I'd pay a bit extra per mix-in if I actually got a good pasta:mix in ratio.

This could be because it's new, but very limited beverage options. If you want a sparkling water, a coke or ice in your 4 oz dixie cup, you are out of luck. But if you like coconut water or Snapple you're good.

Brilliant idea. There is nothing else like it on Chestnut or Union and it shares a wall with a Marina bar. BRILLIANT.

Make some tweaks and I think it'll be around awhile.
author: Brie P.

description: Really great and fun place. The food was good but not over the top amazing and they were out of some items on their menu.
author: Alex C.

description:
Don't understand the hype...mediocre food, definitely overpriced. Save yourself a few bucks and make your own.

On the plus, staff was very nice, and toppings are unlimited. If you decide to go, make sure you get breadcrumbs; otherwise the texture is too weird.
author: Mary D.

description: Honestly I was so excited to try this, but I was disappointed. Upon walking in, I can tell this place is very wide and open spaces bc of how high the ceilings were. There are many tables available when I walked in around lunch time & it was slow. They sort of have this build/choose the style you want your mac n cheese. The thing they could really improve on is having the price listed on the wall next to the options. I had no idea what the price would be the whole time I was ordering. I got a classic sauce, elbows, mixed in with chicken/mushroom/broccoli, & topped with panko bread crumbs. They also have hot cheeto dust as one of the options! I decided to sprinkle some of that on mine before digging in. The first anticipated bite was alright. The food literally came right off the pan but it isn't hot??? It was warm which was weird to me. The flavors are okay, they could've been more flavorful. I was expecting more, but they can definitely improve on a few things.
author: Lisa W.

description:
The hype is overrated. I had a feeling that my mac'n'cheese lacked... cheese :( though I didn't order the meat toppings, there were 3 pieces of bacon in my portion. They ask you to notify them about food allergies / preferences in advance. Is it because cross contamination is so bad? 
The cashier is great, but the BoH need a proper training. They forgot the Brussels sprouts that we ordered. I had to come up to the station and ask them about the sprouts (since we already finished the mac). It took another 5 min to make it. What a disappointment. 
Also, you know that you can't expect that much from the food establishment when you enter the store and the first thing you see is an employee eating with their hands behind the counter. Just saying.
author: Katie K.

description: Best mac'n cheese ever!!! The goodness cheese sauce is amazing! And topping it with hot Cheetos is a must!
author: Brittany M.

description: I have eaten here twice and was underwhelmed both times. The second time I found a hair in my Mac n cheese. It may be a good place to get a basic classic mac n cheese, but there are also better places nearby solely dedicated to the comfort food for about the same price. They appeared to be cooking on hot plates here. Surprised they got a second location in SF.
author: Christine C.

description:
I went to their soft opening for dinner and was sold on the idea. Mac and cheese is one of those foods that I don't eat very often but when I crave it, I NEED to have it. At MAC'D, what I loved is that I could take something I consider basic comfort food and customize it to whatever I felt like eating that day! 

They let you pick from 4 different cheese sauces--I picked the Frenchie (French onion soup flavored). Then, they even let you pick what type of pasta you want! For those that want mac and cheese but not the carbs, MAC'D even has a roasted cauliflower option. I picked the shell pasta. 

You then choose your toppings, which is where it gets really fun. I had a hard time picking (there were so many good things to choose from!) and the guy at the counter was really helpful with his suggestions. I ended up with chicken, mushroom, banana peppers, and crab. 

Finally, you can choose from some other finishings such as Panko and Hot Cheetos. I didn't get any of them as I felt they wouldn't go well with the toppings I had chosen, but I'm looking forward to coming back again and trying Hot Cheetos with my mac and cheese. Everything I picked went well together and I actually finished the entire thing because it was so good. Usually, eating food like this makes me full after a few bites and I'm ready to take a nap afterwards. However, MAC'D manages to balance all the different ingredients super well and I ended up feeling extremely satisfied instead of extremely uncomfortable in a food coma. 

Beyond the food and great service, I love the way they have their restaurant set up! I especially like the "Flavor Station", where they have a section stocked full of a variety of different hot sauces. Again, really like the theme of letting you pick what you want and deciding what you want to eat in the moment. 

Overall, great experience and will definitely come back again soon!
author: Jessica C.

description: Best macs I ever had in my entire life!!! I couldn't stop eating and the concept and idea is great!
author: Maria Y.

description: I really really wanted to like this place after seeing it hyped up all over Instagram. I came with one other person and we both ordered Mac n cheese with hot cheeto topping. Our Macs were drowning in so much hot cheeto i couldn't even see the actual Mac. I also am quite used to really creamy cheesy Macs and was quite disappointed at the cheesiness level. I honestly wouldn't come back
author: Amanda S.

description:
So I ordered cauliflower noodles with a vegan sauce, added broccoli hotdogs kimchi and gujuchang topping. My daughter ordered basic sauce with chicken and peppers with truffle oil. For the cost a whopping $32.00 it was both expensive and not as tasty as your box .99 cent version. 

My vegan one had lots of little hotdogs and very little over cooked broccoli and kimchi all tossed in. The cauliflower was in bite sized chunks - I thought it'd be more like cauliflower rice but it wasn't. 

The other basic order had very few chicken pieces and a cheese sauce that wasn't cheesy enough. 

The cashier was friendly and explained how to build your mac n cheese.
author: holly z.

description:
Delicious and savory! I could not stop taking the next bite. The mac was perfectly chewy giving texture to the creamy cheese, all the while the mushrooms, garlic, and bacon circulated their flavors in my mouth. If that combination doesn't sound appealing to you, the best part of Mac'D is that it's build your own, so you can choose to go gluten free with the cauliflower mac, or go all out meat lover with extra tri-tip. You can put as many toppings as you want (note that some are premium options that you pay slightly more for).

The portions were large enough that I had to take the left overs home for later. The mac was still good reheated and kept the taste really well!

The service is fantastic, the two founders will go out of their way to make sure you have the perfect experience. It's easy to tell that they love what they are doing and that makes all the difference.

A must try place in SF. Personally excited to try the cauliflower next time!
author: Jae R.

description: Tasted delicious!! I had the gluten free cauliflower Mac and cheese. So easy to customize and so good!!
author: Bekah Y.

description:
God, it's just delicious. Don't forget to add hot cheetos!

Great food, great atmosphere, great drinks. Fun all around!
author: Hector V.

description: If you're craving some cheesy comfort this is the place for you. The sauce was thick and tasted like real cheddar, and the hot Cheeto crumbles complemented it perfectly. I got the basic sauce and added peas and bacon with the crumbles. Can't wait to go back and try something else!
author: Alicia E.

description: Girlfriend is obsessed with anything Mac n Cheese. Definitely impressed with this place. Quick service, great food, good prices for SF. Get "the Goddess" with Hot Cheetos topping.
author: Dmitriy T.

description:
Got food poisoning from the disgusting under cooked hot dogs in my mac n cheese.  Was right after getting my tonsils removed so ended up being quite literally the worst night of my life. 

Will never return to this place and hope wish you the best if you dare eat here.
author: Matthew H.

description: Holy cow! I love Mac n cheese as much as the next guy, but this place is crazy good. The choices are pretty broad. The sauces are amazing. They have a selection of hot sauces to spice things up a bit. Service was fantastic. We are definitely coming back.
author: Scott H.

description: Cauliflower mac'n'cheese was bomb! They roast the cauliflower perfectly, chicken was awesome and the cheese was perfect. Love that I could customize it and it was actually healthy! Portions were huge but none made it home.
author: Zo A.

description:
I wanted to like this place... but no. I had a friend in town and we normally go to homeroom for Mac n cheese but she heard of this place and wanted to try it.... biggest mistake ever.

The line was out the door, which was fine with us. After about 20 minutes the owner came out to let us know the wait would be an hour from where we were. We didn't like that but said whatever, this is what she wanted to try. Then when we finally get to the counter to order, we are told they have to wait to take orders so the kitchen can catch up.... our wait time to order was almost 2 hours. I finally ordered, the girl repeated the order so I know it's right. The order comes out wrong (and 30 minutes after I ordered).... I asked for bacon, chorizo, broccoli, and corn. No chorizo at all... a total of 3 pieces of corn. My friend has the goddess sauce with bacon, chicken, broccoli, and peas. No bacon, and a total of 5 pieces of the tiniest piece of chicken we've both ever seen. She said she liked the flavor of hers enough. Mine- didn't even eat half. 
We also watched people behind us in line get their food, and a side of chicken which they were all confused by. Someone in the kitchen came out, said it was his then went back to the kitchen, put some more chicken on it, and give it to a table 2 away from us. I'm in the industry and this was a HUGE no no. 
Needless to say I'll never go back and will make sure others know this is a place to avoid. Such a let down
author: Kristen G.

description:
One word: YUM
This is the ultimate macaroni and cheese lover's paradise. I've seen several pop up restaurants move into this space and I literally jumped for joy when I saw the sign for MAC'D when they put it up. 

There are so many options for mac and cheese - even for those crazy people who don't eat carbs (like my husband) because they offer a cauliflower alternative. 

They have a #basic cheese sauce, garlic sauce and others to choose from. And then the mix-ins! They have all sorts of things from hot dogs to chicken to peas or corn. Oh and don't forget the toppings! They have Parmesan cheese, Panko crumbs and even hot cheetos! 

We also ordered a side of Brussel sprouts which were absolutely delicious. This place is great and I'm so excited that we live nearby because we will definitely be regulars!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
I've been craving vegan mac and cheese and it was great here. The toppings variety was also huge. I am lactose intolerant and was able to fulfill my cravings here. 5 stars! 

P.S. There were plenty of napkins.
author: Alvin L.

description: I've been meaning to try out this place forever and finally went yesterday! I got the #basic with broccoli, mac, and hot cheetohs. SO GOOD!! I wasn't sure how I'd feel about the hot cheetohs but it made for a nice spicy and crunchy addition. Will def get it again. The portion size is also pretty big so I actually took half of my Mac home for later. I highly recommend this place! It's brand new, but things are definitely coming together!!
author: Saumya R.

description: Quality has definitely improved since their pop-up days! I recommend their Goddess cheese sauce if you love garlic. And I appreciate that they have a selection of hot sauces to try at their flavor station. While Homeroom is good, I usually find their mac and cheeses too heavy to finish, whereas Mac'd doesn't really have that issue for me since their mac and cheeses are customizable. Their crisp honey sriracha brussel sprouts were lacking the sriracha for me, but that was easily fixed with the sriracha from the flavor station.
author: Lydia H.

description: THIS PLACE IS SO BOMB! The chef is ANAZING and the customer service is beyond great. Highly recommended and definitely will come back!
author: Sofia A.

description: I just tried this place for the first time, and the atmosphere was inviting and trendy. I came at 1PM on a Sunday, which was the perfect time to go because there was no line. I only gave a 3 star rating because the mac and cheese that I ordered was too salty and overly spiced. I think this is because I ordered the Goddess sauce, and I would try the Basic sauce next time I go. The blonde cashier was very down to earth and friendly. I would definitely come back here again!
author: Nicole S.

description: Saw a Facebook video post of this place and I wanted to give the food a try. It wasn't too bad. The place was easy to find with the noticeable sign up front. The location is 8 minutes away from Crissy Fields Beach and Presidio. It's not busy during the weekday which had no people in line. We came here on a Monday at around 6:30 PM. Parking can be a hassle. Make sure you read the street signs before parking your car and always check your surroundings before leaving (TIP: It's considered free parking after 6 PM). This was a quick place to eat and sit down. I love the elbow pasta and sauces combined from this dish. The menu gives you plenty of options to add on and really customize it as your own.
author: Yvette L.

description:
I went for the grand opening of MAC'D and knew it'd be awesome when we saw the line out the door! People have referring to MAC'D as the "Chipotle of max & cheese" - fully customizable which I love.

I got the vegan/non-dairy sauce with elbow pasta, chicken, broccoli, peas, panko, and a side of brussel sprouts. Yum!

Portions were larger than expected, service was fast despite the long line, and the employees were all super friendly. I probably won't go all the time since I don't often crave mac & cheese, but it was definitely a cool spot to catch up with friends over!

I would love if they added more veggie side options, but the brussel sprouts were great! I'm going to have to go back to get Hot Cheetos in my mac next time!
author: Sunnah W.

description: Great food. Great food options. Hope they can open more locations throughout the Bay Area.
author: Marcy K.

description:
Tasty! Just tried my first mac'd during their soft opening.

It had good flavor overall and very satisfying taste but my one complain is the toppings. Some are so sparse you barely notice. I would at my overall noodle to topping ratio is like 95 to 5... I'd expect it to be at least 80 to 20, otherwise I'd just go somewhere else and get a regular Mac n cheese.

I got corn broccoli mushrooms banana peppers bacon and chorizo. Barely see any corn, a few mushroom pieces and don't notice chorizo. Hopefully this can be fixed moving forward.
author: Magda M.

description:
I dropped by during the soft opening with a friend. I already loved how open the space felt and the warm vibe of every person working here.

The menu is set up so that you choose the pasta, sauce, toppings, etc for your mac n cheese and a few side options. The mac was fantastic (I had a wheat pasta garlic bacon combo going on), and my side of brussels sprouts exceeded expectations.

I'll definitely have to return with more folks to try more combinations!
author: Jechri D.

description:
