MAC'D is any carb and cheese lovers' creamy dream (for the folks who are more health conscious, they do have whole wheat pasta and cauliflower base as well). MAC'D is definitely worth checking out, and here's why: 

1) You really can't go wrong with any topping combination, and the best part is the toppings are unlimited!! Hot cheetos, truffle oil, and gojuchang are some of their creative topping options. 

2) I'm a vegetarian and can confirm that there are a number of veg-friendly options for us herbivores, including the delicious glazed brussel sprouts, which you cannot miss :) 

3) For just $10, you get a healthy dose of classic comfort served with a smile by the friendly staff. 

The co-founders Jason and Chen Chen just really know how to do it right. I was lucky and caught them when I came to their soft opening. They introduced themselves, asked where they could improve, and made sure my group and I had an amazing experience. Keep up the good work guys!
author: Celine H.

description:
Pretty much my new go-to spot. The possible combinations are endless, and believe me, there are some crazy ones in addition to all the classics! I'm a big fan of the interior as well -something about it just feels clean and welcoming. Plus, the beers are pretty cheap.

What's not to love? (The answer is nothing, there is nothing to not love. Go here.)
author: Michael S.

description: I don't even like Mac N Cheese and this place was very good to me. Hot Cheetos sounds like a very weird topping so I had my doubts, but it actually gave the Mac n Cheese some good flavor. But I don't recommend getting cheese fries with your Mac because too much cheese was a little overwhelming. Other than that I definitely plan on coming back it was very good and the workers are all very nice
author: Jonathan R.

description:
I was so excited to try this place! Gluten and dairy free options at a Mac and cheese place?! Yes please! 
I am sad to give this place such few stars but they really need to work out some kinks. 
First of all, I read the other yelp reviews that talked about the super long wait. Trying to not wait so long, we ordered online through their website and went to pick up our order. We placed our order at 11:15a to be picked up at 1:30p. We ended up not getting there till almost 2 because of traffic. Anyway, we go in and they tell us that there's no way we ordered because they have online ordering turned off. Thankfully I had the confirmation page on my phone (which showed we had already paid) and the manager put in our order and rushed it. We did end up getting our order in about 10 mins. 
While we were waiting to talk to the manager though, we had a front row seat to why the waiting is so incredibly long... 
the manager is the one taking the orders (at least on this particular day). Super nice guy but he seemed too interested in talking to people and solving problems all over the restaurant than taking orders. He would take someone's order, then run down the line handing out menus, telling people how long the line is, running to get things from the kitchen, asking the bartender how to make a drink, etc. If they hired someone to take orders, the line would be cut at least in half, if not more. I also was concerned about some of the health things I saw in there. The woman working the bar had her long hair down and it kept going in the cups.  All I could picture was her hair falling into the drinks... ew. Next, none of the people in the kitchen were wearing gloves and one of them was texting and had his phone back there. The manager was also running back and forth between the kitchen, cash register and menus without washing hands... talk about germs. 

Pros: The food was so good!! I love the cauliflower option and the truffle oil! Price is about expected for this type of place. The manager was very nice and did fix our order when he realized what happened. 

Overall, not sure if it is worth coming back until/unless changes are made.
author: Kim V.

description:
I'm not going to give another cheesy review but I will say this, Mac'd is like no other run of the mill build your own macaroni and cheese bar, nay, it is too Gouda for that.

Whatever you do throw in the lobsta and bring your vegan friend too cuz they got them covered, like a smothering sack of cheese on a bed of unsuspecting noodles.
author: Sean O.

description: Good stuff! Wouldn't necessarily consider myself a big mac n cheese person, but the amount of add-ons and toppings available really does amp up the meal. I went with "the basic" option and found it to be the right amount of cheese for me. Will say though, the shrimp are tiny and I almost forgot that I even ordered them so I would maybe re-think the $3..These are pretty big portions though--not enough to share with two, but definitely enough to get full off of. Atmosphere is good; it's casual and lively so a good option for hanging out with friends (:
author: Andrea C.

description:
Placed an order for pick-up through Caviar. I've ordered through them for delivery before. The order status said "received" for about 30 minutes. I tried to get a hold of the restaurant over the phone multiple times, but no one answered. When I showed up, I went inside to see where I might go to pick up my order (or at least check on the status). Asked the man at the pick-up counter, and he told me that they do not take online orders. I had placed an order online, and tried to explain that, but all the guy would say is "We don't take orders online." I would have waited in line and ordered that way if that man had not been so rude. 

Also, it was a Saturday afternoon, the line was about 30 people deep out the door, yet half the tables were empty. There should be more than one person on register and more people helping to cook. I guess they care more about looking busy l. I've always enjoyed the food from here, but will not be back.
author: Jordan K.

description: Service is booty. The workers are rude as hell. Seriously. And this place smells like a porta-potty. Try Mac Daddy or Homeroom instead!
author: Jennylynn R.

description: Super tasty mac n cheese!!  we got the macaroni with the goddess sauce, bacon, chicken, and chorizo added in, and panko, cheese, and truffle oil on top.  It was really tasty and good quick service.  Pretty reasonably priced and a large portion that we easily shared between 2.  I would definitely come back if we were in the area.
author: Geena G.

description: This place is pretty good for the price! $11 for the main dish and your able to add several different mix-ins for free. The chicken is bland and could use some seasoning. Also the dish size is a bit small. However, overall not a bad place.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I was sold right away when I saw that they had a "roasted cauliflower" option among noodle choices. This is perfect for someone like me who is trying to eliminate carbs from my diet, but still likes to go out for dinner. The cheese is so good that I forgot I wasn't eating noodles. I did the "Goddess" garlic cheese, with bacon, chicken, and broccoli mixins, and a truffle oil topping. 

Their "flavor station" is a great idea. They have an unlimited supply of every type of hot sauce you can think of. I chose Frank's buffalo sauce. 

The tried and true business model of customization works perfectly here. Makes me want to come back and try a different combo of flavors.
author: Stephen K.

description: The food is delicious and the service is outstanding and they are super friendly.  The atmosphere is awesome great bay area music slapping and beers on tap Yeeeee!!!
author: Xiomara B.

description: I LOVE mac and cheese so I knew I had to try this place. When I first got there, there was no line which was great. I got the buffalo cheese sauce but that was my mistake. It wasn't good as much as I love buffalo sauce. The mac and cheese was too much cheese for me personally and it was very sickening. I would get less cheese next time I go back. The service was kind and patient considering how long I took to pick my order and the seating was nice. I enjoyed this place but would not go so crazy with the toppings next time.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I promise you, Mac'd will change your life.

I've been a fan of Chen Chen and Jason's (say hi when you come in, they are the NICEST guys) since their pop up days, and I will never forget my first bowl of mac. It was like... coming home. I got (and will ALWAYS get) the goddess base with bacon, mushrooms, and Hot Cheetos crumbs, and it took approximately 3.5 seconds for me to wolf the whole thing down. After that, dear reader, nothing was the same. I dream about their mac n' cheese practically daily and their brick and mortar location means I never have to be without my favorite fix. I highly recommend the premium ingredients - the tri tip and lobster are a decadent compliment to any combo - and the truffle oil if you REALLY want to treat yourself, but more than that, I highly recommend Mac'd. Haul ass. Thank me later.
author: Bianca S.

description: I think it's okay food, maybe needed more sauce. The chicken was good, even though there was some gristle.  However, for the price and the wait Time, it wasn't worth it. Maybe I would have enjoyed it more if I had popped by in the afternoon when there were little to no people, but the line went outside of the building and it took an hour to get to the register. So overall, it was an okay experience but it could have been better.
author: Nikki L.

description: I've come here a few times. It's good but a little disappointed that they didn't have the Vegan sauce even though it's on the menu. Brought my friend all the way from Morgan Hill to try it, but they didn't have it :/ should take off the menu
author: Tiffany L.

description:
$12 for a small plate of mac & cheese served in an aluminum tray with MAYBE 4 pieces of chicken? Psh.

The staff was friendly to the customers, but openly yelling at each other in front of us which was just awkward and provided for a poor dining experience.

The Mac & Cheese itself wasn't bad, but I pretty sure I could've easily made the same thing at home. The menu is all "create your own" but still feels limited. They have a "toppings bar" on the side, but I didn't know about it until I was already done eating- nobody told me.

Overall, it was a mediocre experience and I wouldn't go here again. If you really want Mac & Cheese, I'd just recommend making it at home.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I got Mac'd on today!  No, no- not how you think... I got some 'slap ya mama' guuud Mac 'n' cheese made for the carb loving people of SF. Mac'd offers a build your own Mac n cheese menu with a variety of cheese sauces to please everyone from kiddos to the more sophisticated pallettes. Top your mac n cheese with high quality toppings like lobster, shrimp, tri tip, bacon, truffle oil and hot cheetos! If youre one of the many gluten free peeps of SF, no problem! There's an option for you too: Cauliflower instead of pasta shells, which is also very yummy, rich, satisfying and will not dissapoint. Mac'd offers Mac and cheese and non-alcoholic beverages at the moment- but I hear adult bevs, desserts and pop up collaborations are in the works! Can't wait to see what's next for Mac'd!
author: Sophia M.

description: Hot Cheetos topping is what brought me in , the menu Is simple and easy , create your own , they have various options , staff will guide you if you have questions . Friday nights are super busy , but hey its a Friday night what can you expect . Overall great food and staff is amazing , they have a huge line and they don't crack under pressure , you don't mind the wait because you can see them giving there best to take out food . Great for groups and for dates !
author: Erika G.

description: Love the concept (super yummy and reasonably priced) but the execution needs improvement! I waited 35 mins for a to-go order at 3pm on a Saturday. Other places in the Marina (blue barn, Asian box) are much faster
author: Stacey W.

description:
Macaroni + cheese + toppings + beer? What more could you ask for? Seriously such good comfort food. 

I tried the elbow mac, goddess garlic sauce, chicken, broccoli, panko, and truffle oil. The hot Cheetos are on my list for next time!
author: MP B.

description:
Love this place. The vegetarian options are delicious as well as the original cheese sauces. Flaming hot Cheetos as a topping? Amazing! Highly recommend this place to any and all cheese lovers out there!

Oh and they serve beer now too!
author: Michael M.

description:
I came here late night. all the chairs were up, which I found strange. I got to my food to go because of that. 
They have options for everyone. My family of four were happy with their decisions ( they even wanted to go back) 
Price is fair for San Francisco.
Portion size is very nice. 
They are friendly with cheese. 
Overall good experience
author: Chloe R.

description:
Went to dinner with my friend, she new how much I do love my mac&cheese. This is one of those places where you build your meal. You get to choose what kind of pasta shells you want, meat option, and a veggie option. I chose large shells, with hot dog and broccoli in it. It was amazing, I honestly loved it. Only big complaint I had, was that I felt like my hotdog could have been cooked longer it felt very undercooked. I would go back and try different options. You can't go wrong with Mac&cheese, it's just so cheesy and delicious. As my boyfriend would say it melts in your mouth. It was great seeing how they were making the Mac&cheese and mixing in your items. I found that it was a clean place. I do wish they had more drink options. 
The price, is a little high but being located in the marina I understand the pricing. I do plan on going back. Can't wait to try something else.
author: Veronica V.

description: I saw this place from a Tasty video on Facebook, and was so excited to try it as I love mac n cheese. But was it everything I was hoping for? Not even close. I had the goddess sauce as I love garlic, then I combined that with chicken, broccoli, and parmesan. The service wasn't great as the young woman who took our order wasn't friendly or helpful, but I was there for the food so I didn't care. Although my order was so simple and not out of the box whatsoever, it was still a disappointment. While eating it, I bit into something hard in the chicken. That freaked me out, but I kept eating the rest because I was hungry. After leaving, my stomach started hurting and that feeling stuck with me for the remainder of my day. Maybe it was just a coincidence, but my mom wasn't feeling well either so I'll just leave it at that.
author: Chelan H.

description: You need to try Mac Daddy. This place gives you half the amount and isn't as tasty. I have Mac n' cheese about 3 times a week and order it off a menu at least 75% of the time if it appears on the menu. This place should do better if it wants to last.
author: Ida C.

description:
I came here with a couple friends for lunch on a Sunday. Parking wasn't too bad - there are a lot of free 2 hour spots north of Chestnut St. For $10, I got the tailgate sauce (beer and bacon fat) with shells and ham, longaniza, mushrooms, broccoli, peas, and kimchi with panko on top. The food was delicious and flavorful, especially the kimchi and longaniza. I'd love to come back to try other combinations. 

Overall, great location, great service, great food, great price, and most importantly, great lighting for the gram. 5 stars.
author: Alvin H.

description:
Welcome to the newest most instagrammed sign in SF - Stay Cheesin. Smart and well done in the entry way in neon lights. 
I tried MAC'D during the soft opening and was super excited about two things: sub cauliflower for noodles option (YASSS) and you can add as many toppings as you want. Double yas.
I went for the cauliflower with a bunch of toppings (went a little overboard and kinda ruined it, choose wisely) and topped it off with spicy Cheetos, genius.
While it's impressive that they make the Macs to order, it does make it very slow and a long wait I wish I had known. The staff was very friendly and patient and prideful.
The food was good, not outstanding, I'll be back but not in a huge rush. 
Congrats!
author: Marie M.

description: The Goddess sauce is delicious. The Pesto is equally delicious. Pasta cooked just right. We weren't too adventurous. Got chicken and bacon as add ins.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Obsessed with mac and cheese and this place delivers deliciousness. Goddess is my favorite, with elbows and panko crumbs, truffle oil, and parmesan cheese. So cheesy and flavorful, just the right amount of garlic. Elbow noodles are big and perfectly cooked. Shells good, but I prefer elbows. Hot cheetos crumbs on the basic was delicious. Juicy bacon and chicken. Fried chicken is two nice sized pieces tender and crispy, amazing seasoning. They cater too, I'll have to try that next time. Custom creations, limitless options for cheesy heavenly decadence!
author: Athena K.

description: Definitely the best mac n cheese I've had... ever. Not just great for me, but also for my unbelievably picky sister. Finally, a place we can go together and both love.
author: Carissa A.

description: Both of our orders were missing multiple items - including chicken in both... how does one forget the main topping in each? Would have asked for it to be remade, but service took so long that we didn't have time. Complete disappointment.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Pretty good mac n cheese, along with the extras we added into and on the side. We started with the tailgate cheesy sauce, shells, bacon, hot dogs (yep!), and Parmesan on top. Then we asked for jalapeños and broccoli on the side. 

This is where it got fucking weird for a second. Recv'd our order and looked into the box of sides in which the broccoli and jalapeños were mixed. No biggie and since my girl doesn't eat jalapeños, figure it was a score for me and I will get another side of broccoli. Asked the girl tossing up the mac n cheese for a new side of broccoli and she was cool about getting me a new side. Waiting at the spot I'm standing at and just watching how they do things, noticed one of the cooks raising up his arms  behind the counter, in the kitchen. Catches my attention and asks, "everything okay?" I said, all is good, just need a new side of broccoli, but all is good. So not sure if i misinterpreted the whole interaction, but seemed like I was getting a fucking attitude for asking for a non-mixed side of broccoli?Weird shit, but I'm here for the food, not to deal with stupid bullshit. 

So after getting the broccoli and sitting down, I was able to enjoy the plate at hand. The amount given was enough to feed two people. The taste was great and everything was mixed well. Each bite guaranteed a mushroom, hot dog, or piece of bacon. Sometimes the trifecta. The plate was solid and the amount was plenty. Broccoli was def a must and prob better if added to the mac, rather it being on the side, but to each is their own. 

I enjoyed the combo that we had ordered, but next time I know what to do different and with the extras they offer, we already have a combo brewing. 

Like I said, we really enjoyed our mac n cheese. Not sure what the hell the issue was about reordering broccoli, but whatever dude. We will be back and ready to enjoy a whole new combo! Hope this helps anyone who has yet to eat at Mac'd.
author: Dennis M.

description: Really wish this small locally owned place was better. Homeroom is definitely my go too. Was hoping for something better in SF, but it really missed the mark. Too bad!
author: Nick O.

description:
I have been looking forward to this place FOREVER. I would give it a 4/10. 

They forgot our order, then when we checked on it they gave us so much attitude, saying it would come when it comes. It had already been a 30 minute wait. 

After literally every single person in the place had been served, I went back and was like come on it can't take this long to pour melted cheese on precooked pasta. Then they reprinted out the order that never made it to the kitchen. 

Then we got our pasta and asked for our fries, they waiter had forgot to add them to our order, so we were almost done with our meal when that arrived.

For was alright, I would go there if it was convenient but not make a night out of it.
author: Kate F.

description:
Was super excited to try this place, love me some Mac and Cheese, but unfortunately it was not great.  I went with Elbow noodles, Basic Sauce, added Parmesan and Bread Crumbs.
Elbow noodles were not all the way cooked, would have been fine if I had enough cheese sauce but the skimped on that.  I ended up with gobs shredded cheddar cheese that I had to pick around, Parmesan on top didn't help, and the breadcrumbs weren't toasted.   
Worst it was barely warm, almost cold!
If they would have just threw the dish in the oven long enough to melt the cheese on top and toast the breadcrumbs it might have been okay. Poor Execution 

Not sure I will go back, there are too many good places to eat to waste your belly on half fast overpriced Mac and Cheese.
author: Kara S.

description:
Got the wrong order. I am vegetarian and was given bacon in my mac n cheese. Also, I asked for pesto, and I am pretty certain there wasn't any.

I would recommend you save those $11.
author: Prakhar A.

description:
If you're going to be a one note specialty shop you've got two things to get right: offer something special and make it delightful to get it.  This place fails on both fronts.

I make better mac and cheese at home.  I've had it better at several restaurants that don't specialize in it.  So you are coming here to pay $11 for mac and cheese that is average.  Why?  Find a place that serves good mac and cheese and has a broader menu (and maybe even cares about service).  Got a little kid?  Yeah, they love mac and cheese and don't even want it fancy.  $11 for a portion they won't finish, suckers.

We happened to have strolled in on St. Paddy's Day.  People were out in droves.  There was a line but that's a good thing for a business.  I've never seen a manager or employees spend so much time on their phones when there is a line out the door.  I've never seen so many unused tables when there is a line out the door.  The manager definitely wasn't going to push things through.  When a table did get up and didn't self bus, he'd make the girl behind the register bus it while the line waited.  He wasn't going to ring anyone up or clean anything up.  He clearly was only going to watch.  Order a beer?  Yeah, that got forgotten and I had to ask for it ten minute later (and then wait for more customers to be rung up first).

I do love the fact that at the register they ask you what tip you want to include.  This is for a place that makes you stand in line when there is actually room, get your own flatware, walk up get your own food, ask for your drinks more than once, and asks you to bus your own table.  So what is the tip for exactly?  The privilege of being cooked mediocre mac and cheese?  Maybe it is just to throw more money towards the cause of overpaying for a specialty shop where nothing is special.  Its the price of irony.
author: Brandon H.

description: I placed a pickup order from Caviar and when I brought my food home, I realized the Mac and Cheese had different toppings than what I had ordered. When I called the restaurant, the owner came on the line and in addition to comping the order and re-making my correct order, he offered us any additional menu items for free. Everyone makes mistakes, but not every restaurant handles those mistakes with 5-star service. After a 5-star service experience like this I'll definitely be back.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Yum!  This place was GREAT!  Tons of great choices, and the vegan mac was incredible!  You can loaf up with veggies, and even truffle oil and panko.  Highly recommend,  and will be back!
author: Julie K.

description: Way too over hyped!!! The video on Facebook makes it sound very good and worth the drive! It doesn't have any flavor, there's so many cheeses in the sauce but can't taste any of them. The Mac and cheese from el pollo loco is way better. The hot Cheetos were good though. I won't be coming back ever again. VERY EXPENSIVE HOT CHEETOS I HAVE EVER PAID FOR : (
author: Yare W.

description: Friendly staff great food and experience filled me up for sure !! I totally recommend!!! Perfect for a date night!
author: Marta R.

description: GET MUSHROOMS! The mushrooms pair so well with the pasta. Went during peek hour, line was long but it was very good, there's a reason why it's long.
author: Louise M.

description:
If you love mac-n-cheese, this is the place. 
Even if it's not your thing,  I would check it out. 
I want to try more combinations. 
Delicious.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I was very hungry, some might even say hangry, & I'd just seen this place open yesterday when I already had other dinner plans so I'd been hankering after this all day. 

I ordered the basic with lobster & sprouts. When I got home & opened it, I couldn't see any lobster. I had 2 bites & didn't taste any lobster. So I called & let them know & the staff were very apologetic & offered to give me a free meal next time I'm in. Very generous as they'd only appeared to have missed one component of my meal. 

So then I sat down to eat the rest of the meal & what do you know? it was full of lobster & very delicious too! The sprouts were a bit sweet to my taste, but hubs loved them. 

I will definitely go back for a repeat, but I will gladly pay for it all myself again!
author: Joanna G.

description:
Solid Mac N' Cheese spot! Friendly staff and open late night (perfect drunchy food). Will definitely bring more of my friends here.

Cheers!
author: Willis C.

description:
Cons- The staff didn't seem very knowledgeable about their product.  I had to drag information out of them.  They seemed disinterested and unorganized.  The seating arrangement is awkward and ridiculous.  You have to fight for a table.  Be prepared to get up close and personal with complete strangers, as you're pretty much on top of each other.  
Pros- The food was excellent.  I had the basic sauce, shells, bacon, peas with fried chicken.  It was exactly what I'd hoped for.  Great restaurant concept overall, just not very well executed.  It's worth a try.  Not worth traveling a long distance for though.
author: Richard K.

description:
I'm typically not a fan of mac n cheese but I gotta say this place has won me over.

The vibe is casual and I love the neon 'Stay Cheesin' sign at the entrance.

The food was good as expected. I got the goddess sauce with rotisserie chicken, broccoli, mushrooms, breadcrumbs, etc. etc. etc. I don't remember the rest. It was definitely tasty though I wished the chicken came in larger pieces. Portions were perfect as I walked out full but not overstuffed.

Overall I can see myself returning when I'm in the area. Maybe next time I'll walk off the calories to the Salt and Straw up the street for dessert.
author: Kenneth G.

description:
I really wanted to like this place and I had such high hopes! However, it fell short on so many levels. Good idea, poorly executed.
1) it's not really build your own Mac'ncheese at all.
the same cheese sauce is on all the mac options, and it's a VERY thick sauce that was not smooth at all. It was coagulating on my plate within the first few minutes of being served.  The sauce is peppery and NOT a basic sauce. It had brown, black and red bits in the sauce-- have no idea what's in it, but they should have a cheese option that is just super basic! 
2) the place was DIRTY. I was surprised it was so dirty for such a new place. The floors, chairs, and tables were sticky and gross. The woman behind the counter just sat there and didn't even clean up. We were the only people in the place at 5pm so it wasn't so busy that she couldn't wipe the tables down. 
3) It would have been nice to have some vegetable sides as options. Nope. Just got some brussel sprout "special" that were drowned in hot sauce and honey. They could really be successful with a side salad or a side of broccoli since they offer that as a mix in. 
4) the food took a long time to make and we were the only ones there. 
5) I agree with the previous reviewer who said please have silverware instead of plastic for dine-in. This is 2017, people. Think about the environment. 
6) the flavor station was just hot sauces, no herbs or salt spices. And the bottles were messy, gross and sticky to touch too. 
BUT the capper was----WE ALL GOT SICK AFTER EATING THERE!!!! 
If you made it through my review this far, you will realize not to eat here! You're much better off with the pizza joint around the corner if you want some cheap cheesy goodness.
author: K S.

description: I came here after seeing a snippet of this place on Facebook and while the concept seemed cool, I wasn't impressed. First of all the wait was over an hour in line because there is one guy taking the orders who also doubles as the bartender and the bus boy, really inefficient and it's no wonder it takes to long to get to the counter. I got the Goddess with chicken and bacon, parmesan and truffle oil. The quality of the chicken was disappointing and the bacon was left in huge chunks that didn't crisp up enough when it was baked. Probably wouldn't go here again unless there was no line and there was no other options around.
author: Lety G.

description: $15 for a small plate of basic mac n cheese & and a rude cashier. No hello or anything. It might say unlimited, but i only got three broccoli crowns. They also charge $3 extra to make it vegan. They only serve IPA beer by the way. This place was made for the pathetic SF hipster.
author: David M.

description: This Mac and cheese is def hyped. It has potential if you're starving and high. Will I wait an hour again def not! The fries are good though!
author: Yanex E.

description: The Mac cheese here is so great! I mean you can pick out what cheese, noodles, & add-in's you want. What else could you ask for?! The only down side would be the girl who was at the counter taking orders. She was eating fries & on her phone the whole time we were ordering & eating our meal. Overall, though I would recommend to any one thinking about going here!
author: Taylor H.

description: This is probably the grossest Mac I've ever had. I'd appreciate not a plastic cup when I'm dining in but just proves how cheap they really are, next to the parmesan rides as toppings. I mean it's San Francisco, food Capitol of the world, you could make better macaroni and cheese out of a box.. well it very well might be.
author: Riya F.

description: The idea is cool and you have the ability to pick the ingredients you want but at the end of the day the Mac and cheese and the sauces which are the main part are average.
author: Pablo R.

description:
I'm a huge sucker for comfort food, especially during brisk San Francisco weather. 

Enter MAC'D. Warm bowls of gooey ... comfort. Totally indulgent but oh so worth it :). I've been a fan ever since I tried MAC'D at a pop-up event a couple months ago ... so even though they just opened recently they have a lengthy track record of making amazing mac and cheese dishes :D.

Excited to come back and will definitely be dragging my friends here ... a lot.
author: Alex C.

description: Good comfort food. My friends and I got our mac and cheese and Brussel sprouts to go and enjoyed them on Crissy Field Beach. We liked mix and matching the pasta, cheese sauce, veggies, and toppings. It's true the veggies are frozen rather than fresh which is a shame, but I got the broccoli which tasted great.
author: Fayette F.

description: This place was so worth the wait! About 30 minutes in line. Build your own Mac which is awesome. Although the lady at the front taking orders was very rude and short. Otherwise great place!
author: Dawnmarie H.

description: I've been a few times and each visit, the cashier has been friendly and funny! I love that you can make your mac and cheese however you want and I have never had a bad combination. I'm definitely a customer for life!
author: Japs C.

description: Mac and Cheese, with a twist. I built my own Mac and cheese and ordered a side of fried chicken. The Mac and cheese was tasty, and full of flavor. Fried chicken was tender, and crispy on the outside. I recommend this to anyone passing through this area looking for something different to eat.
author: Mo S.

description: The cauliflower And cheese is so great! I wish the cauliflower pieces are bigger though. A great replacement for the southern craving.
author: Grace E.

description:
Disappointed that they decided NOT to do there mini because they said it's a busy day they rather charge everyone 11.00 bummer. I have kids. Waited 40 minutes just to order. I saw no body with kids because of the stupid line. I'm sorry just make a regular Mac and cheese for like 7-8 guys put the damn thing in a container and put crust on top. Put 10 in every 15 min. Get the line going. Tell everyone it's 3.5 star Mac and cheese if they want 5 starts come back and order in the long line. The owner needs to stop being cheap hire a busser to clean tables and get peoples food out to people. Get drinks for everyone NOT u doing cashier, drinks, and sometimes clean maybe or have your customers clean. Really? Just give another person a job even if it cost u money. Hire them part time call it a day. 

But take my advice please just start a simple Mac and cheese regular yellow orange sauce and elbow noodles and pop them out quick. Have someone come out every 15 minutes let everyone know there's a fast line just for the simple Mac and cheese. Put it all in a bucket and mix it and bake it. Pop it out. This place later on will be a turn off for a long line. No one wants to wait 2 hours for food guys. I'm glad your doing good. 

But accommodating always win long term. Also if you see a line of 10 people open the door before opening. Let everyone know we usually don't open 10 minutes before opening hours but we did it today just for you or something. It's nice that way. Then the 5 stars come even if your food sucks that day.

But your food 100% good. Wait killed it. After waiting in line. After ordering took another 20-30 min. Just get fast Mac out
author: Mommy K.

description: Delicious food! It's a fun idea but the portions are pretty small for what you're paying for. 2 bowls of Mac n cheese was $35. Also the girl at the register could not have used any more energy to be more rude and uninviting. It may have actually killed her to wipe the annoyed look off her face. I hope she can find happiness in her life sometime soon.
author: Karen C.

description:
I'm so happy this place opened. The concept is unique and playful, the ambiance is friendly, and the food is SO GOOD. 

I got-

Goddess (garlic) with elbows, ham, peas, and of course, hot cheetos on top. Exactly what I needed and completely worth the wait. it was about 10 minutes to order and then another 10 to get my food. Pretty reasonable for a place that got so much traffic. 

Honestly, I was impressed about how well they seemed to run their kitchen, especially for a place that's so new. everyone is upbeat and nice, even when they were handling what seemed like a million orders a minute. Props to them - great people, great food, and i can't wait to see them succeed.
author: Annie H.

description: Had Mac'd delivered to my hotel from ubereats and it did not disappoint. Not only was it one of the fastest deliveries I've ever had so the food arrived hot and fresh, but it was delicious!!! I had the custom Mac with chicken and truffle and ate every bite. Definitely check this place out if you love Mac n cheese!!
author: Laura W.

description:
Finally had the chance to try this place last night -- If you love mac n cheese like I do then I definitely recommend checking this place out. What could be better than building your own customized mac n cheese?? You pick the sauce, pasta, mix ins, and toppings. 

I had the goddess cheese sauce which is their garlicky one and it was sooo good. I mixed in bacon & broccoli and went with with shell noodles. I opted out of a topping but tried a bit of my friends with hot Cheetos and it was really good. If you like spicy, the "hellopeno" sauce is really good but has a lot of kick.

They were out of lobster which was a bummer but I guess I'll just have to go back!
author: Angelina E.

description:
To be fair, I've only ordered off the food delivery sites so haven't had it in the store, but was slightly underwhelmed.  Mac n cheese is my fave dish ever and my last meal on earth would be mac n cheese, so of course you can imagine I was super excited to have a dedicated mac n cheese joint open up in the city so I wouldn't have to trek to Homeroom in Oakland (which is Amazing).  

Sadly there wasn't much sauce - I expect my mac n cheese to be very creamy.  The hellapeno sauce I got wasn't very spicy.  I'd probably give them another shot in person but this wouldn't be my first choice for delivery.

I've tried both of their brussel sprouts and like the honey sriracha one.
author: Diane T.

description: I loved that you could choose any of the items to mix into the mac and cheese. I had seen this place online and realised it was across the street from where I was staying in San Francisco. I went and collected a take out and it was fast and super tasty. I got the garlic cheese sauce, all the veggies and some chicken with no topping. Yummy!
author: Giovanna W.

description: I enjoyed the food, but it's a very niche place, and the options for beverages were limited (i.e. they don't have diet soda of any sort). Overall, the experience was enjoyable.
author: Kevin G.

description: A. Mazing. These guys have done an incredible job to cater to local mac and beer lovers. Love the spread of sauces and toppings, and the meat was cooked to perfection!! This place is definitely here to stay
author: Johnny L.

description: This is one of my favorite places I come from the San Jose area just to get it but I had a terrible experience today my order was skipped several times and almost waited an hr for Mac and cheese when I asked how long they were extremely rude and got my order wrong after the long wait and waited even longer won't be coming back
author: Alvaro Q.

description: It's probably great if you're drunk..sober it's sub par mac.. they give you free mixins but my mac had none.. they probably forgot. A bunch of kids working here and not good service. Stale toppings
author: Andrea R.

description: Wonderful! I got crushed cheetos on top. Yummy! I went here when they just opened and there was plenty of space, not too much of a crowd.
author: Frances A.

description: BEST VEGAN MAC EVER!! As a vegan the one vegan copycat i cannot stand is vegan mac n cheese. However, when coming across this cute little shop and stopping for my sister (whose favorite thing ever is mac n cheese) we decided to give it a try and it was HEAVENLY! I got the vegan with shells, broccoli, and panko then I added choluoa hot sauce on top, my extremely NONVEGAN sister tried some and was in awe she cannot stop raving about how delicious it was and she even went as far to say it was better than hers! Which was the garlic cheese sauce with elbow noodles, fried chicken, panko, and truffle oil. We also ordered the honey siracha brussel sprouts which were beautiful! Please do yourself a favor and give this place some love because it will love you right back!
author: Veronica R.

description: I saw a video promoting MAC'D. I was very excited to try it; so this weekend I decided to come up from Irvine. I ordered the Goddess, pasta shells, brocoli, mushrooms, corn, and cheeto crumbs. I must say the cheese was excellent. The Mac was very savory the flavors complemented each other very well. I've had Mac that is bland but there Mac was flavorful. The place looks very trendy. We found parking. The cashier was very amicable and explained everything, highly recommend it.
author: Jonathan V.

description: Not sure how this place is rated so high. They made my order incorrectly twice. The first time they made it with the wrong noodle and added and an extra vegetable I did not order, and the second time they omitted the jalepenos and added BACON which was not what I ordered.  I hate bacon, and it was really chewy to top it off. And they acted bothered they had to make my order again after getting it wrong the first time, just to get it wrong again. Won't be back. I'll go to homeroom instead.
author: Sarah V.

description: So yumm after a long July 4th bike ride in and around the City!  Great options for the "build your own" crowd, or like myself, turn-key goodness options!
author: Jess B.

description: If you can't decide where to eat right now, this is it! Amazing food! Highly recommend! A must eat!   Also great sign to impress those on your Instagram and snap chat
author: Ece T.

description: I want to be writing an amazing review right now, but unfortunately, I'm not. When I found out SF had a make your own Mac and cheese bar, I was ecstatic. However, eating here last night was overwhelmingly disappointing. I have a dairy allergy, so I was really excited to learn they had a vegan cheese option, and when I looked online, they hadn't listed it as extra money when you went to order on the website, but in the restaurant, they left it off the menu, and when I asked about it, they did have it, but they didn't say that it was $3 extra!! $3 is ridiculous when it wasn't listed and I didn't really have another option, so I got it. I ordered with a variety of toppings including chicken, and when I got my meal, first off the bowl was barely filled. I could see the bottom at multiple places. Then as I began to ate, I quickly realized there was no chicken in it. Not one piece. I was frustrated and greatly unsatisfied by the meal :(
author: Sonia S.

description: Comfort food at its best.  The experience is cool because you can build your own bowl of Mac n cheese, or choose from a couple specials that come with pre determined toppings.  The topping choices are high quality too.  At the tables, you can enjoy different types of hot sauce, which pairs well with the cheesy goodness.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.  I'd come visit again, and I also hope they open more locations in the bay.
author: luxe o.

description: they have mushrooms and broccoli in their mac and cheese, instant 4 star
author: Vivian C.

description: Delicious mac and cheese! I got the garlic one with all the mixins - all the meat and was not disappointed. They recently started serving beer and it is a great compliment to the mac and cheese.   Definitely will be coming back here soon.
author: Joshua P.

description:
4/5 
Pro:
Inexpensive satiating/ satisfying meal
Variety of topping options and  base cheesy flavors
The Goddess sauce...Yum

Con:
Service lacking. 
There is way too long of a line/wait for such a straight forward menu (choose sauce, pasta type, add ons, and toppings)

Would go again, if they streamline receiving orders of food to shorten length of waiting in line. Perhaps adding the menus on the hallway explaining sauces  so that customers may think about their orders ahead of time.
author: Gregory O.

description: Ok.. Atmosphere was cool.. Pretty average joe but wait was 2 & a half hours long.. Which was understandable.. New Facebook video went viral, & I get it! Although it's pretty awesome getting to pick your own topping and cheese n such.... The guy in the back cooking kept touching his hair... Very unsanitary!! Definitely gotta make them wear hats, but... Mac & Cheese was good. It's not like L.A. The Attic but MAC'd is an experience if you visit or live in the bay.
author: Alexis L.

description:
I came here with a group of friends excited to try a new Mac n cheese place out. The cashier was really nice and explained the different cheeses in each Mac to us. I got a Tailgate Mac with hot cheetos, mushrooms, bacon, and broccoli as sides. My friend got the garlic Mac with crab, broccoli, and mushrooms as sides. Both our dishes came out within 10 minutes which was a plus. 

However to our surprise while eating our Mac dishes we noticed there didn't seem to be a lot of broccoli. Even worse my friend couldn't find one piece of crab in his dish. So we decided to talk to the servers about the lack of additions in our Mac. 

Turns out there actually were pieces of broccoli mixed into our Mac that we found after searching thorougly but not what you would expect. There were 2-3 pieces of broccoli that were the size of a person's fingertip. My friend received extremely unprofessional service from what appears to be one of the cooks in which she first sniffed his Mac for crab and then she took a fork and rummaged through his Mac looking for crab pieces.

To our amazement she found A crab piece (a small one mind you) and she had the nerve to hold it up in the light with her fork and then proceed to eat it right in front of us. She even smiled at us afterwards to appear even more rude to us. 

Considering that my friend paid $3 for crab as a side and only had ONE piece of crab that the cook ate in front of us, this restaurant deserves a one star. I recommend avoiding this place because not only are the sides misproportioned, the Mac is mediocre, and most importantly, a place that hires staff who eat a customer's food directly in front of them speaks a lot about quality control. 

I hope this place gets better because there aren't that many Mac places in SF. Good luck Mac'd.
author: Alex T.

description:
The health department would shut this place down if they saw how this place operates. Let me start with the unsanitary food preparation.  The cooks handled nearly all the add-ins with their bare hands.  Now that would not be so bad except that they moved between the food prep to the front area where they handle multiple items touched by multiple people then return to the food prep to once again grab crab, onions, bacon bits, etc out of plastic containers with bare hands without washing their hands.  Next they do not wash the saute pans between orders, thus, mixing flavors and creating crusty bits from multiple uses that end up in your meal.  When I sent back my meal to have it prepared in asking that the cooks and sue-cooks (not Chefs by any stretch of the imagination) wear gloves, the sue-cook went to the storage area and came out wearing a pair of yellow cleaning gloves like you would wear to wash your dishes.

I love Mac & Cheese and have been wanting to try this place since I moved to the neighborhood 6 mos ago... Well, looks like I'm going to be sticking to my homemade Mac & Cheese.
author: S H.

description: I went for the first time yesterday. I can tell you the menu is readable but not that many selections. I was expecting a lot more ingredients to put on your mac. It's a little bit pricey as well but it's worth it. Clean area and a unique place to eat. Delicious Mac N Cheese. Would go back again for sure.
author: C G.

description: I first heard of this restaurant from a video that showed up on my Facebook feed -- I knew I had to go right away as an avid mac & cheese lover! Thankfully I got in when there was almost no line. While I was eating, the line got so long it went onto the sidewalk outside of the establishment! If you only have to wait 5-10 minutes (which I did), I would say this place is worth the hype... Longer than that and I would say you should keep looking for another food place. I had their goddess sauce on elbow pasta with bacon, chicken, mushrooms, and corn mixed in and panko and parmesan cheese for toppings. Overall great variety and very tasty food!
author: Ema M.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! It's so cute! The food is really good! U can add as many toppings and it's only $11. It's a perfect place to come to if you want something good to eat but on a budget! They have truffle oil and it's a free topping!!!
author: Sarah B.

description: This review has been on my to-do list for a while, and I'm so glad I finally am writing this post. I've been to MAC'D 3 times within the last month. I usually don't enjoy mac n cheese, but every time I go, I'm so pleasantly surprised by how so many different toppings/flavors/sauces can blend so well together! My favorite is the Goddess with shells, and I usually mix a combination of different meats, veggies, and ALWAYS the panko, hot cheetos, and truffle oil. Whether it's for a Saturday brunch or late-night snack, the mac n cheese feels just right, and even though I'm full, I always end up finishing the entire bowl. I also really like the interior of the place, which is simple, clean and spacious. The staff are also friendly (and always give really good recommendations). All of this for under $11...not bad at all!!
author: Kyeihong K.

description:
MAC'D is perfect for a casual meal in the area!  The service was friendly, and we had our hot cheesy goodness to munch on before we knew it. I had the goddess (garlic) sauce with elbow pasta, and my partner had the vegan sauce with cauliflower, and both were great. She noted that the cauliflower as a base was really filling as well. Unlimited toppings came in clutch - just add chicken and bacon at no extra cost to turn your mac into a protein packed meal.

Great food and vibes! Will definitely return in the future.
author: Brian V.

description: Love the concept and the ambiance. Great place to have great mac and cheese with the option of adding just about anything.
author: Sofia B. C.

description: The service is crappy. The food was barley warm.The guy at the front is creeper status and was not helpful with questions. He charged us $2.00 for a cup of water. The creeper guy as soon as the manager or own walked out started dropping the F bomb left and right and was complaining about the owner/manger guy. I got no chicken except one piece that was super fowl tasting. They were out of stuff we asked for it was super bland and all around horrible experience if my fiancé wasn't here I wouldn't have stayed the guy at the register made me REALLY uncomfortable. I was still craving Mac and cheese so off to Oakland we go.
author: Breann Y.

description: Delicious comfort food. You can add hot Cheetos and portions are large so you know that you will have enough to eat.
author: Dilan Ş.

description: Have been here several times. Mac n cheese is so good! I love the different toppings and now they have sides! I go with the goddess (love me some garlic) and love the unlimited toppings! I do wish the broccoli pieces were a bit bigger. I have noticed that the hot cheetoh topping is more substantial than before where it was just cheetoh dush. great improvement!
author: Carol L.

description: Not sure what the hype was about. I ordered the basic with shells, corn, crab, panko bread crumbs, mushroom, parmersian. Overall the food was bland, the sauce was not sauce-y enough, it was just dry. I added a bunch of salt and pepper just because it was so bland. I would not come back for overpriced mac and cheese.
author: Ngan B.

description: Well let's start by their hours being wrong. Then they have the audacity to tell us all the kitchen problems they were having. When it comes down to being a over priced Macaroni and cheese restaurant running out of food is unacceptable. It's two ingredients...
author: T R.

description: Pretty disappointed  with this place after reading  all the hype. Ordered the Goddess but either got regular cheese  sauce or it was super lacking on garlic flavor. Wasn't impressed with the lackluster amount of toppings I got plus they left off the mushrooms  and tomatoes  which I ordered. Overall, the entire dish also needed more seasoning. All in all I won't go back as I could make better from a box  of Kraft Mac-n-Cheese.
author: Kristopher D.

description: All they have here is mac and cheese sooo if you're looking for anything else than you're outta luck. For a place that specializes in just that, there nothing special or too great about it. I gotten the basic sauce with shells topped with hotdog, broccoli, Parmesan cheese and truffle oil. It's a one and down type of place.
author: Ysabel N.

description:
Amazing place. Amazing food and service. Very good price. 10/10 would recommend. 

The location is prime, and the staff extremely personable. If you're in the area, COME check it out it's seriously amazing.
author: Daniel L.

description:
It's a fun concept, but I don't believe it was executed well. Everything is pretty bland on it's own (unless you smothered it in hot sauce). The Brussels sprouts were weirdly sweet... like sugar was added or something. IMO Roasting them would have yielded better caramelization without having to add sugar. 

I agree with another reviewer about items being left out of our orders and the macs not being hot enough... and that the noodle to cheese sauce ratio was completely off. Nothing was really smothered in cheese as we were expecting.

The space and the idea is fun. The owners seemed nice. But I think they need to consult with someone with a culinary background or pick a theme and do it well instead of trying to do too many things.
author: Laura F.

description: Amazing food, great atmosphere, tons of choices. Plus the management is extremely attractive.
author: Young K.

description: This place in INCREDIBLE!!! I've gone to a couple of their pop-ups at Harmonic Brewery and I'm so glad they now have a beautiful place in the Marina. Their garlic cheese sauce in my favorite!! I'm lactose intolerant and I dream about their mac and cheese - 100% worth the stomach discomfort. They're going to be open until 2am on Fridays and Saturdays AND going to start serving beer and wine soon?!? This is going to be dangerous. Can you guys start a stamp card/ loyal customer program because I'm going to be coming here all the time!!!
author: Tracy L.

description: Umm where has this been all my life. Custom-made mac & cheese is a brilliant idea. It's basically like a tastier cheesier version of Chipotle!
author: Eddie L.

description:
First thing's first--
I read a few reviews that seemed to state a problem with the customer service. I personally did not encounter a single issue. The cashier was extremely nice and welcoming. She answered every single question I had about the menu and really made it easy for me to order (I'm one of those people who totally freeze up when I have to say something to an employee). She even made sure she got my name right! Not only was the ordering smooth, the food came out quite quickly too. It hardly took ten minutes!
About the food--
Simply put, the mac n cheese was delicious. I went HAM. I mixed in panko, chicken, and broccoli. It was heaven in a bowl. I'm also one of those people who hate it when there are people around when I'm pigging out on food, but I didn't feel this way at Mac'd. It was like all the employees were my friends! 
San Francisco has been missing a place like this, but now it's here. I truly do recommend. 10/10 would come again.
author: Sian H.

description:
As much as I would like to give this place a good rating, I unfortunately can not do so. I would like to state that the extra star was for the service, the guy that took in my order was very helpful and welcoming. 
The missing stars was because of the scent of the restaurant and the food. 
When I was done ordering, I was trying to look for a seat and wanted to sit next to the window. The window had a very unpleasant odor of urine. It was quite unbearable and was strong enough to surround the whole front area of the restaurant. My friend and I chose to sit in the back to avoid the smell.
The food was ok, but after a little over an hour I began to feel nauseous and had a very bad stomach ache. Sadly I realized I had food poisoning, and I knew it was from their mac and cheese because I had my breakfast earlier throughout the day with no symptoms until I ate here.
Although they have such great options, I wish this place was clean.
author: Dorena H.

description: The perfect place to get your mac and cheese fix and there open super late. Premo toppings offered. Super friendly staff.
author: Hambik A.

description: Really great concept for fancy mac n cheese. The cheese is great quality and the mix ins are delicious. It is nice to have something in the neighborhood open until 2am other than pizza or Mels. The only ding for a star was the time it takes to make the mac n cheese. We were lucky to beat the crowd before the bars let out and still waited over 15 minutes. They should have a more assembly line style production for the late night take out.  The 20 people who came after us must have waited much longer because there are not enough cooks in the kitchen at that time.  Overall, the food was A+. Recommendation: The Goddess (garlic cheese), with bacon, crab, truffle oil, and panko crumbs on top. And don't forget the flavor bar for a splash of siracha. The workers were friendly and nice even though they were dealing with the drunks stumbling in at 1:30am.
author: Julia L.

description: I was so excited to try this place, and I think I over hyped it for myself. I got the basic with mushrooms, bacon, crab, breadcrumbs, and truffle oil. It was honestly pretty flavorless. There was one small piece of crab in it, which I paid an extra $3 for, and way more bacon then anything else I added. I wish the would balance the add ons in it. While eating it I wish there was for flavor to it, the cheese was pretty lacking too. There was barely any mushrooms, but there were loads of bacon. My friend and I ordered right after one another, within the minuet, and yet she had to wait an extra 10 mins after me to get her food. I was quite disappointed. But great service.
author: Trinity N.

description: Tried it today for lunch. SO. GOOD. I had the tailgate cheese with bacon and truffle oil. Some of the best mac n cheese I've ever had.. I will be back for sure
author: Connor D.

description: TL;DR If you want delicious, hand crafted Mac n' Cheese, without a $15 price tag, come to Mac'd! Mac'd is an awesome new restaurant that bring a Chipotle-style approach to the tried and true favorite Mac and Cheese. I've had two different macs so far; the Goddess (Garlic Cheddar) and the Tailgate (Mushroom and Bacon fat). Both are awesome but the Goddess is definitely my favorite. Aside from the flavor, you can choose all the toppings you want, as many as you want. I personally added bacon, corn, mushrooms and crushed hot cheetos, which was flipping awesome, and the choices mean your flavor experience can be fully customized and changed for every visit. Add to that two friendly owners, staff, and a convenient location, you'll enjoy Mac'd food every time (although you might need to start your treadmills ;) )
author: Ben S.

description: yummy . they just opened but worth the trip! garlic mac w broccoli.. the service is quick , great decor n im a lifetime customer now
author: Eugenia L.

description: went because of the Facebook hype but honestly it wasn't anything too special. Wasn't bad but I've had better Mac at Benders, Mac Daddy and Last Drop Tavern.
author: Chris D.

description: This is seriously the best restaurant in San Francisco. The mac and cheese has a chipolte-type vibe where you pick your ingredients and everything is made in front of you so you can have custom mac and cheese. They have flaming hot cheetos which is groundbreaking. Huge portions too. This is right in the middle of a lot of popular bars in Marina so I would recommend coming here both to pregame (they don't serve alcohol) and after drinking because its seriously that good. Please franchise DM me for investment funds.
author: Emily L.

description: Very tasty. Definitely hits the "craving mac and cheese spot." The price is a flat rate so it doesn't make sense to not order all the toppings you can. Maybe add a menu item that is cheaper and only mac/cheese? The employee recommended the garlic goddess sauce to me and it was average, the basic is definitely more tasty. I highly recommend.
author: Abie W.

description: Can't believe it's finally here. I thought of this concept years ago and finally there are a couple mac n cheese restaurants in the city.  Menu was a little confusing because I didn't know what kind of cheese sauce I would get. A simple sub menu with explanations would be good. Pictures even better! The counter person had to explain it over and over to customers.  I had the lobster mac n cheese and it was very good. Kind of a sticky texture which is how I like it, as opposed to hard and baked. Would like to see a Short Rib Mac n Cheese. Loved the brussel sprouts!  Seems like this restaurant would do well in Sacramento area where they don't care as much about calories.
author: Paul S.

description: I was fairly disappointed after leaving MAC'D. I think it's a great concept, they just need to refine a few things. First off, there is only one portion size and it's biiiiiiig. Would have loved a half size and more options for sides. They just have sriracha Brussels sprouts which is a pretty particular taste, I wanted a few more options of greens to choose from. The decor was also pretty meager. For what I paid for I wanted a little nicer ambiance (there were unfinished cupboards and messy counter space with random stuff spilling out of them). They also forgot my order and the staff weren't wearing hair nets. Also no wine.
author: Maureen L.

description: My friend and I were on our drive home when I spotted the large orange elbow noodle sign that caught my eye. Being the mac n cheese lover that I am, I had to know if this was a restaurant dedicated to mac n cheese and in fact it was! We whipped a "U-ie" and went right in. The cashier was extremely nice and answered all of our enthusiastic mac n cheese questions. They have a wide variety of toppings (for ex. truffle oil *my fav*) and add-ons to choose from. On the counter there was a sign that encouraged customers to share their allergies and food intolerances with them. So comforting to see as someone who is deathly allergic to nuts. The interior of the restaurant is embellished with adorable orange smiling elbow noodles and a "stay cheesin" neon sign (soo SF). We thoroughly enjoyed our mac n cheese and would definitely come back. Such a good location and perfect for SF newcomers. Thank you Mac'd!!
author: Dana D.

description: I was so excited to see them pop up on Fillmore in the marina and I had to try it. It's their soft opening and said they'd have more options on the menu when they actually open. I ordered the classic cheese sauce, shells, bacon, chicken and panko on top and it was delicious! So creamy and satisfying! Already looking forward to going again. Also the staff was super friendly and helpful with walking me through all the options.
author: Mariah C.

description:
Really yummy Mac, and a delicious fried brussel sprouts!! Will be back once a while when we're in the area.

Minus one point for being super, super skimpy on the toppings. (Ie: there were 2 tiny pieces of broccoli and I bit into maybe one piece of chicken, otherwise would be a more frequent customer)
author: Minh D.

description: If you were hoping for homeroom I'd recommend crossing the bay bridge.  While MAC'D is considerably cheaper the taste is no where near as good as homeroom.
author: Stephanie E.

description:
Confused why there are 4.5 stars , maybe because the food looks cute on instagram. 

The pasta is WAY over cooked, to the point it was mushy. Maybe some people like their mac this way or maybe mine was just a fluke. I would prefer something that holds up to the sauce and doesn't seem like I'm eating soup. The chicken seemed low-quality and was completely flavorless. I'd pay more for higher quality toppings like some nice shredded rotisserie chicken or even grilled breast
author: Megan N.

description: I love mac 'n cheese, so I was really excited to try this place out! The portion size is generous, and you can get as many toppings as you want (seafood is extra though)! I got the basic sauce with elbow pasta, chicken, bacon, broccoli, with hot Cheetos on top and it was so good! If I'm ever in the area again I want to try their garlic or vegan sauce!
author: Kaela C.

description: Can't believe this place. Good was not good. It came oht barely hot order it with chicken I think i got 2 pieces of chicken in my whole bowl. I would not waste ky time or money. I used to the Home Room in Oakland and thought this might be as good but its terrible. Boston market Mac and cheese is better then this place.
author: Ant F.

description: Best mac n cheese ever! You should definitely come eat here, I loved it and will definitely be back
author: Amberly M.

description: Sorry won't go back. It was too rich and expensive. My kids loved it but it was $50 for 3 mac n cheese and no alcohol. I would not recommend it.
author: Caroline P.

description: High price point for VERY basic mac 'n cheese. I personally prefer mine baked on top and runny on the inside, but this was just runny. They're not generous with some of their add-ins, either. The tables were also REALLY dirty. I thought about leaving because it was gross. Kinda disappointed.
author: Sarah G.

description: Incredible establishment. Delicious mac n cheese. Friendly staff. An absolute must-visit in the Marina for locals and visitors!
author: Kelly B.

description: Did not live up to expectations. For something as simple as macaroni and cheese, they sure know how to spice it up (pun intended) because it was very spicy even with their basic cheese sauce. If there's nothing else to eat maybe I'll go back. Presentation was impeccable though.
author: John N.

description:
I really wanted to love this place. I am huge fan of mac and cheese. The concept is smart and I like how you can build your own.  However, it is hard to build your own when they run out of of ingredients. For me, they didn't have lobster. 

I ordered shells, cheese, broccoli and truffle oil. The truffle oil was amazing.  Overall, the cheese was bland and there wasn't much broccoli in it. 

The tables were pretty dirty even though the restaurant smelled like cleaning solution.  Imagine going into to a public restroom after it was cleaned. 

This place has been on my list to try but I won't be going back.
author: J N.

description: Great comfort food after yoga class. Love their food. So healing for the hump day. The cashier (i believed is one of the owners) is really nice. He is friendly and helpful to guide me and my gf to order. Love Love Love this place. However, I will only give 4 star since I will hope to have a little more cheese for the pasta and the hot Cheetos is crunchy.
author: V L.

description: This place is so unassuming.  Almost walked past it.  And walking up the ramp you still don't know what to expect.  I waited in line and after ordering a to go order I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and the large portion.  The mac and cheese, we ordered with bacon and broccoli was simply great. Just like what I ate as a kid and I am 69 so I do remember what real mac and cheese tastes like.  I give this place a 5 star.  Is clean, well lit, friendly people and satisfied customers.  I heard the owner tell someone they are opening a 2nd location soon.  Good luck and I hope the owner is very successful.  There simply is almost nothing as good on a cool or cold windy day than some stick-to-your-ribs mac and cheese.  Well done.  I'll be back.
author: S B.

description: Pretty good Mac and cheese with a good amount of topping selections, something I've never really seen before.
author: Fallon B.

description: Love it! $10 for a meal and you choose whatever toppings you like. I think the price is very good for the quality of food they deliver. Portion is large.
author: Karla S.

description: I work near the area and decided to stop by on Monday (earlier this week) and was attracted by their "Stay Chees'in" glowing sign outside their door. How can you not walk into their restaurant and get immediately hooked! There are many different combinations you can have when it comes to your Mac'd and they get make it easy - step by step - no complications. A 10 year old who is really drowsy can understand the menu. And then... I decided to bring my entire work team the next day! hahahaha It's just too good. It's a great place to have a date, or a group meeting - I love the place and I will be going again for sure.
author: Jonathan G.

description: This place is amazing, my favorite combo is Bacon, peas, and Hot Cheetos. First had this as a pop-up, really excited they have a permanent space so I don't have to go to Oakland for my mac and cheese needs.
author: Chris W.

description: Great mac and cheese options, but their basic with shells is still the best. They have tons of toppings and flavor varieties. They also have a cauliflower option, which is pretty decent considering its competing against pasta. Friendly service.
author: Stephanie B.

description: This place is sooooo good! I love the simplicity in the menu, this so many options for tasty mix-ins. Totally impressed! There is something for everyone here.
author: Shel S.

description:
This place is amazing - If you love Mac 'n Cheese, you'll love this place!

I'd recommend trying everything...  my friends and I ordered a few different orders of dishes, and everything we had tasted delicious.  You can choose your pasta, sauce, toppings... you name it!   The fact they had wheat pasta single handedly makes Mac'd one of my new go-to spot.

Great food, location, atmosphere - you have to go to truly understand why everyone loves it!
author: Ariya H.

description: If you're up for mac and cheese, no better place to go. Goddess with shells is a winner. I went extra lobster and truffle oil for a nice treat as well. Will be back here for sure next time I'm in SF!
author: Dom K.

description: I almost liked their vegan sauce over their hellapeno sauce. Loved all their options. Definitely coming back.
author: Tatjana N.

description: It was really good,a little seasoning wouldn't hurt but overall you can get good Mac and cheese with a ton of toppings.
author: Noemi D.

description: Service here is lacking. It took the people in front of us over 5 minutes just to order and the line was out the door. The ladies behind the counter had an extended conversation about the customers' order - which is nonsensical since the menu only has about 10 options total. The male cook in the food area with the tattoos was also gruff and somewhat rude. Very poor service and very long wait times for relatively basic and uncomplicated food. Some suggestions for improvement would be to have menus available at the door so people in line can look at the menu and decide their orders before they reach the counter. Or perhaps even slips of paper for customers to mark what toppings they want. Two cashiers would also be helpful. Good luck!
author: Emily M.

description: Not a fan of food that tastes precooked and just heated up upon serving. You will think the panko and cheetos will be good on your entree, but that's not the case. The bread crumbs were cooked separately and they were just sprinkled on after the mac and cheese is cooked. The cashier was also very rude, he THREW the menu to us. Unbelievable this place has such high reviews.
author: Amy Y.

description: My friends and I were extremely hungry, and we saw the sign outside and were intrigued. We stepped in, and were greeted by the lady at the counter and she was super friendly. She explained to us the process and the different kinda of flavors, and I went with the Goddess (garlic) with elbow pasta, mixed in with corn, mushroom, bacon, jalapeños, topped off with hot cheeto crumbs. I was super excited about the hot cheeto crumbs, but they ended up just tasting like breadcrumbs with just a hint of spice. Also, the flavor of the garlic was so mild I wouldn't have even known it was garlic flavored if someone hadn't told me, which was a bit disappointing.The first few bites were glorious, but the flavor got really repetitive and yes, there is a such thing as "too much cheese". They give generous portions for relatively cheap (mine came out to be $12), but I don't think I can have that much of JUST mac and cheese. Overall, very innovative and trendy but I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to get it again. Honestly, if you're debating between this and Homeroom, i would choose Homeroom
author: Sue Y.

description: So yummy, went here for lunch with my husband on our honeymoon. I got the vegan cheese base and he got the pesto we both loved our Mac n cheese. Such a clever idea to have the option to make your own, so glad with got a chance to eat here
author: Emily O.

description: High expectation but not worth a 2 hour wait. Food was ok garlic fries could have been better they forgot my chicken it's ok they were busy and they were really sweet about it. I know it's in a great location for night night however should be more family friendly. No high chairs very tight space one way in one way out not stroller friendly at all and very very small inside your sitting on top of one another. The whole two hours I waited I never saw not one person wiping the tables off and it's flu season needs to be a better selection for drinks and had one person ringing the orders. This was the deal breaker I asked for crab but didn't want it mixed in with my Mac I wanted it on the side and of course I'm paying for it. I was told by the girl ringing I was not allowed to do that and I asked if she can double check with the manager she refused to do so. It was disrespectful and for me working in the food Industry for many years it was wrong of her to not ask since she said she was unsure since it was her first day. Customer service could have been better. Will we return? Probably not but I do like the idea of MAC'D it could just be done better
author: Serina S.

description: A new spot in the neighborhood! It's such a fun looking place to be in with a menu board that looks like it came out of an elementary school. MAC'D is serving up delicious build-your-own mac n cheese. I love the concept and most importantly, I love their mac n cheese. I chose the goddess sauce with shells, broccoli, crab, mushrooms, and truffle and topped it off with hot cheetos. I was very impressed by the quality. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, the cheese sauce was flavorful and cheesy enough and the hot cheetos gave the dish a perfect amount of spiciness. For now, MAC'D serves only one side dish - brussels sprouts. The brussels sprouts are perfectly fried and are tossed with a sweet sriracha sauce - DELICIOUS. Starting in August, they'll have even more add-ons to your mac n cheese, specifically smoked meats!
author: Cheryl Q.

description: My 11-year old loves Mac n Cheese so we had to stop when we passed by Mac'd at lunch time on Friday. The interior was cheery and the cashier was friendly. My son picked the basic sauce with bacon and spicy cheetos. He wanted to love it, but quickly reported the bacon was off and he couldn't eat the bacon because it was soggy and chewy. Then he said he couldn't eat the whole thing because the bacon ruined it for him. I've never heard of bacon being that bad. If you go, avoid the bacon!
author: Melissa C.

description: Such a fun place to go enjoy Mac your way! Went with my roommate and we loooved it! It's a must!
author: Cynthia J.

description: The food tasted great which was the most important thing, but the atmosphere needs a little work. Some sound dampening materials and getting rid of the strange smell of rancid when you walk in would be first on my list.
author: Matt R.

description:
Went for their soft opening with 2 friends and it was delicious! Got the basic elbow mac and cheese with bacon, broccoli, and panko crumbs. I got my food pretty quickly after I ordered, which was great since I was super hungry. The bacon pieces are wide and the portions are generous. Don't forget you can choose as many mix ins as you want! There's also a flavor bar with a bunch of hot sauces.

Atmosphere is cool and the people who work there are super nice! Would highly recommend
author: Tiffany H.

description: The mac and cheese here is to die for and the concept is absolute genius! Being able to custom toppings?? What's not to love? I didn't even know how much I needed this in my life until I took that first glorious bite of bacon, cheese and carbs. Ya there's a wait, but that's just because they're crazy popular and it's totally worth it! Love this place! It is an absolute must!!
author: Alison L.

description: Perfect comfort/hangover food. Had to wait about 45 min. Not sure if that's normal or they were just understaffed. Lots of extras you can add for free which is nice, but I went there late at night and they were out of some toppings I wanted like bacon and jalapeño.
author: Trevor A.

description: Hands down one of the best places I have got to visit on this trip. We have been eating like crazy these last few days and this one I almost forgot to leave a review until I saw the comfort food and remembered you can't really go wrong with the pasta dishes here!
author: Gordians K.

description: I came here with a group of friends and luckily we beat the line! I got the Goddess sauce with shells, bacon, chicken, broccoli, Panko, hot Cheetos, and Parmesan. The service was great and staff was friendly. But unfortunately, (maybe this is just what I ordered) my Mac n cheese wasn't that flavorful. It honestly could've been my choice of toppings as well, but when I was eating, I felt like it was just salty. I could taste the bacon, not so much the chicken. I would probably come back and just get the ones they recommend instead of building my own. For $11 + tax, I wouldn't say it's a bang for your buck. The portions are kind of small, but you do get to choose however much toppings you'd like.
author: S T.

description: This place was great! I got the basic cheese sauce with shells, and peas and broccoli. The cheese sauce was delicious, and the pasta was cooked perfectly. My friend got the chorizo mix in, and was really excited that chorizo was offered. The macaroni is really reasonably priced also, especially when you consider that most of the mix ins are free (except crab and shrimp, because duh).
author: Rebecca H.

description: This place is so much fun! The macaroni is delicious, especially when you pick the right toppings, and the price is great too. I made the mistake of getting too excited and added literally all the toppings to my dish. It turned out to be kind of a disaster. I admit this is totally my fault(I'd make a horrible chef) and not any wrongdoing by the restaurant. My husband got the elbows with the original macaroni cheese sauce and added truffle oil, peas and hot dogs- and OMG it was so good. I ate his whole dish and we took my hodge podge disaster to go. I'm already planning my next MAC'D creation.  Next time I'll be ready with my carefully planned toppings. I'll never make my rookie mistake again!
author: Julie B.

description: If all you're craving is Mac n' Cheese, then Mac'd is the place to go.  Great offering and good value.
author: Paul D.

description: Definitely not what it seems like in the pictures. My friend and I got sick after it.
author: Alexa M.

description:
