I got the Goddess sauce, cauliflower, bacon, and lobster, with panko, parm & truffle oil topping. I was worried I was going to regret my no-carb choice but it was delicious!!! Actually liked it better than my husband's elbow mac with basic sauce, bacon & lobster- the basic sauce has an odd bready taste to it. The Goddess sauce has great garlic flavor. We got a side of Brussels sprouts which were also very good.
Looking forward to coming back to try out different combinations! Hopefully they get a liquor license soon.
author: Maggie Z.

description:
This spot is prime! Truffle oil, kimchi, hot-cheetos, loginiza are just some of the stand-out topping options (for no add-on cost too,) but they really have it all!  I was worried that, given the buffet of options coupled with the cheese, it would be too much, but the mac'd team have clearly thought the balance necessary to pull off a make-your-own-mix mac & cheese shop.  

also appreciate that they've provided more health-conscious options (like roasted cauliflower, I was pleasantly surprised how well it replaced pasta,) and having spoken with one of the co-founders (he was manning the cashier for parts of today and working in the kitchen too,) they seem very open to feedback on topping options, amongst other things I talked about.

Keen to see what other goodies they add to their menu next!
author: Arthur C.

description: The food and service is amazing. Lots of options to make a fantastic plate of Mac n' Cheese.
author: John T.

description: Heaven for Mac and Cheese lovers like me.  Really excited when I saw a video of this place on Facebook. Lucky me, MAC'D is found in my city of SF.
author: Geoffrey O.

description: MAC'D is a must try!! My favorite fast casual place in the city for a delicious cheesy meal or late night drunchies. All the sauces are amazing (the goddess is my personal favorite) and I love that I can customize the toppings based on my mood. It's got huge portions too and tastes great heated up the next day. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Elaine S.

description: Fun concept, delicious comfort food with great customisation options and just the right amount of fancy. Good food and the staff extremely personable.
author: Maisie F.

description: Love this place. I've been following the Mac'd crew since they were aspiring restaurateurs with pop-up shops all around SF. Watching them grow has been very inspiring. It seems like every time I go back there's something new about the place which makes each new visit worth while. Even then, you can't go wrong with the tried-and-true classics! Lines are always out the door so plan accordingly, but I think it's worth it! At least there's a charming neon "Stay Cheesin'" sign you can snap a selfie with while you wait. Pretty sure I've tried all their sauces and so far my favorite is the pesto. I'd also highly recommend panko or hot cheetos (or both!!) to give your mac some added texture variety. They have an excellent hot sauce selection to spice up you dishes if that's your thing. Oh man, writing this review is making me crave their new fried chicken mac...brb...
author: Raymond K.

description: you're better off making annie's macaroni at home. the sauce on mine was completely separated - pool of oil on the bottom and mound of cheap cheese melted on top. 2 stars for the unlimited toppings though.
author: Penelope W.

description: Too expensive for what it's worth. My food came cold and it wasn't all that good in the first place. I won't be coming back.
author: Gracie C.

description: The longest wait & not worth it. I would consider returning if there wasn't such a wait. There were possibly 20 people ahead of us & it took over an hour for our order to be taken. The seating was only 1/2 full or less so it wasn't a matter of room. They had a sign apologizing for the wait, they didn't want to overwhelm the kitchen, but our food was out in less than 10 mins, if that! They have a simple menu & should be cranking people in & out, but at the rate they are going they will be losing money & customers quickly!
author: Caitlin S.

description: This low rating is because of the poor food safety measures at this establishment.  During my hour inside the establishment the same container of chicken, pack of hot dogs, and trays of pasta and mushrooms, and fried chicken were out at room temperature, and only the hot dogs were covered.  One of the cooks kept running his fingers through his hair and touching his face.  If I get a foodborne illness it will be my own fault for still trying the food anyway.  I got the regular basic with bacon and peas, it tasted good, but portion size was small and I was still hungry.
author: Allison H.

description: Great place friendly people. Not the best mac and cheese ever but definitely worth it. Fair portions on the toppings as well. All around Good place.
author: Joe R.

description: Great Mac N Cheese! They offer different meats and toppings! Making your own combination instead of having the recipe made for you so you are able to be creative with your own style of Mac n cheese. Definitely coming back here when we come back to visit!
author: Clarisse R.

description: This was our first time coming to this place. My wife had seen it on the internet and has been bugging me to come here for about a week, an hour of traffic there and back; thought it would be worth it. We were asked if it was our first time and we said yes, the girl at the front was really nice and helped us out and we were hella excited to try the hot Cheeto topping. Anyway, we ordered and sat down and oh we even ordered fries which were really tasty. I was half way with my Mac n cheese when my wife looked at my plate and pulled out this LONG ASS piece of hair!! It couldn't have been mine because I had my hair up AND it was baked into the Mac n cheese!! We were gonna order another plate to go so we brought it up to the girl that we found a hair and she responded with, "yeah that happens sometimes" and we gave her this like crazy look.. so she offered to take a couple bucks off of our to go order, well didn't I think that was appropriately because I was planning to take my other half to go so she gave us another free plate to go. I feel like it could've been handled better and this place is super hyped it doesn't even meet up to its expectations.. I suggest you lookout. "They wear hair hats" but clearly they're not careful enough to keep their hair out of our food.
author: Shaylia M.

description: I'm a big fan of Mac and cheese so I have very high expectations! I'm pleased to say I was beyond satisfied! I absolutely love the concept. There are so many different combinations to try - I can't wait to try them all!!
author: Varun R.

description: I went for the "vegan mac n cheese" and it was very disappointing! I was charged extra for all of my ingredients and received cauliflower instead of pasta and the vegan cheese was more like a liquid.
author: Adriana M.

description: Yo, so I just ate here and the food here is bomb af, at the end of my meal. I took the tray to the trash and accidentally threw the plates away and it broke.. SORRY y'all but bomb food and fast service!
author: Daniel N.

description:
I had heard about your place a few days ago and have been looking for a Mac an cheese in the city. I'm so glad you've opened and the selections are amazing! MC an cheese is comfort food when prepared right with the right ingredients. The place looks amazing! I'm keeping my fingers crossed MAC'D is around for a long long time!
Good luck guys!
author: n w.

description:
I saw this place on my way to the movies tonight, and looked at the menu - and saw that besides traditional Mac'n Cheese which my 6 year old loves, that they also had a low-carb option (Cauliflower) that works perfectly with my diet.

We finish the movie and come back here.  After I order hers, I am told that they don't have cauliflower mac'n cheese (which directly opposes their menu).  So, instead of eating there, I get takeout for my daughter and nothing for me (I don't like restaurants that place things on their menu, but don't really have them).

My daughter loved what she had, and gave it a 5.  She had the plain Mac 'n Cheese (they seem to have many options - of which many appear very tasty with the different additions you can add, I would have loved to have tried it).  So, her part of the rating is "5" and my disappointment for not having something advertised on the menu gets this place a "1".

We may come back as we live in the neighborhood, but with a low carb diet, I don't know if the menu fits my lifestyle without the cauliflower offering.
author: Paul D.

description: Service was pretty good (they were willing to change away from the game that was on TV and switch to the Warriors when we asked). I have no idea why it was so empty, this was some of the best mac and cheese I've had in years, and everyone in my party had a good experience. One of us has some pretty specific food allergies, and finding a new place for them to eat can be challenging, so the fact that they are able to make things dairy free/gluten free/garlic free/pepper free was huge. He ended up getting the roasted cauliflower with just olive oil instead of cheese, and there were actually several proteins and toppings he could have. We don't end up in San Francisco all that often, but there have been several discussions since visiting about when we get to go back!
author: Ben F.

description: Long wait but that's expected with a new, very hyped up place. Once we ordered, food was ready fast and was a good serving size. Filled us up even though we thought it might not. Unlimited mix-ins and toppings. And they serve beer!
author: Kendra S.

description: MAC'D was a pleasant surprise. Was walking down the street and stumbled upon this quaint little fast casual restaurant. As the name says, they sell Mac and Cheese! I ordered their best seller, the "Goddess". It was truly delicious, the truffle oil was a great addition. When I eat mac and cheese the two things I look for are texture of the mac and strength of the cheese and this place has it. It also helps that the staff was really engaging and welcoming. This will for sure be a place I want to try again.
author: Eric P.

description: Went in yesterday for lunch, and it was amazing! Tried the frenchie sauce based on their recommendation and I was not disappointed. Love the food and the space, definitely worth a visit!
author: Shaireen M.

description: It's a customizable mac n cheese bar. The food was tasty but not for the price (starts at $11). You can pick from 4 sauces, 3 types of pasta, and add as many toppings as you want (proteins cost extra). However, I think the protein toppings are a rip off. I got crab, which is an extra $3, and I didn't see or taste it in my dish. The server said it was shredded in but I literally didn't see any crab at all. Total for 4 people was over $66, pretty pricey but we had some leftovers so it was a decent portion...but in the end, it is just mac n cheese...
author: Courtney D.

description: This places rocks!  The best Mac'n'Cheese you will find anywhere. Great choices including a non-pasta option of Mac'd Cauliflower.  Oh and the Brussels!  Friendly and fun staff.  Go!
author: David W.

description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon with my bf and we had drove all the way out to Marina just to try out the mac n' cheese here. Despite many good reviews, I really don't think this place is all that worth it. The tables were filthy and there were flies flying around. You can tell the place was not clean. If you looked closely, there was even dust floating in the air and settling into the food. I had somewhat high expectations for the mac n' cheese but it turned out to be quite disappointing. The quality isn't worth the money you pay for. It wasn't anything special and I could have easily made it at home. I think I would have at least left with a better impression if the place was kept clean. I could tell it was a lazy day for the workers. The cashier was nice but I think she should have made the effort to keep the place tidy and not just stand there. The bathroom had also ran out of paper towels.. This place gets one star but I'll give two stars since the cashier was nice.
author: Tiramisu W.

description:
new joint in a tough location for restaurant(I have seen at least a dozen come and go) - rent must be crazy there. however,  the food is very good and just as important, the people that work there are so helpful and very friendly.  

the entries are made fresh, the toppings are tasty and the room is large so I am not sitting on top of the next table. 

give it a try. you will be pleased.
author: Allan B.

description: Cheese was not creamy and our order took along time. Lacking the cheesy flavor and all of the extras that you order are pretty much two pieces of each. Overpriced for just plain Mac n cheese.
author: Billy V.

description: Jalapeño cheese sauce, chicken, bacon and panko crumbs.... best Mac & cheese ever! It was delicious we got ours to go and was fast
author: Lucy P.

description: If you're a mac & cheese lover, definitely recommend! I love the concept of being able to customize your own mac & cheese - and the amount of toppings you can choose from is amazing. I ordered the Goddess mac with bacon, mushrooms, banana peppers (def recommend this for an extra kick), roasted garlic and topped it off with hot cheetos and Parmesan crisps. They also have an option to do a cauliflower base instead of pasta, and I'll definitely be trying that out on my next visit!
author: Melissa F.

description: What a deal for $10, especially in the Marina! Very tasty, customizable, unlimited toppings, very friendly owners/staff. Beautiful atmosphere. Love the Cauliflower version for less carb. Would highly recommend it.
author: Steve L.

description: Came here around midnight. Most places to eat were closed.  Mac n cheese was delicious. Had the goddess sauce, added mushrooms. Topped off with parmesan, Awsone! A large bowl at best; portion wise. Decent portion comparing mac n cheese to mac n cheese average portions.  I had to order another.... It was that, Great. Will eat here every time I visit SF. Delicious macaroni & cheese.... must try open till 2am on Saturday nights. Yum yum
author: Moby Q.

description: Being a Mac n Cheese fanatic, I was totally excited to try this place near my hotel. My excitement was met with a garlic sauce that was simply lacking garlic!  The amount of cheese was great except that we all independently commented that it was somehow gritty in texture which was overall only slightly unappealing considering just how cheesy the dish was. I discovered how amazing chorizo goes in Mac n Cheese so that was a definite plus. My biggest concern was simply the presentation. For $40+ dollars for three Mac n Cheese's without the extras, serving it in something more than tinfoil to-go dishes with a focus on presentation would have yielded a better response. I would say though, I'd go back again but I'd probably try another competitor.
author: Steven C.

description: I didn't think that a place that serves just Mac and cheese would be good, but I was wrong. There are many different combinations of toppings and they blend well together. I know they'll continue to add to their menu and I'm looking forward to coming back again!
author: Jeffrey L.

description: I love Mac and cheese and my experience here did not lessen it any bit. It's a fantastic place to try and they make their mac and cheese on the spot for you. Their variety and poke esque order system was fun. If anything, I would say it's a bit pricey for mac and cheese. Definitely worth a try or a few though.
author: Derek C.

description: This place just opened & it's so good ! They don't have alot on the menu but you can create your own Mac & Cheese !! They have alot of toppings to choose from , I will be back .
author: Jenny D.

description: What a fun and delicious experience we had while dining here. Something for everyone, staff was friendly, polite and attentive. I can't wait to go back!
author: Rachel P.

description: if you like mac and cheese, you'll like the offerings Mac'd offers. Coupla more visits and I'll be bumping it!
author: Cody F.

description: Possibly one of the top three places for creamy Mac and cheese.  The menu is super small but tasty. Expect to pay for parking, for those who are from out of town. There's no free parking. I would have given it a five star rating but the cashier was rude/ condensing. Only thing she cared was for me to order fast and be done with it.
author: Nicolas C.

description: This place is premium dankness. Best late night meal I've ever had. Employees were super nice and chill. The cashier explained it all really nice and made recommendations and one of the cooks let me make a last minute adjustment with no issue. Great people. 10/10 would recommend to everyone.
author: Andrew W.

description: Awesome food, good prices, fantastic staff. Doesn't get better than that! Solid addition to the options in the area, and overall love the concept. Definitely recommend this spot!!
author: Tyler C.

description: Amazing mac n cheese with amazing unlimited toppings! I loved the kimchi and gochujang toppings and it really made the mac n cheese something i've never tasted before. There also opening a bar up soon so it'll be a fun place at night for sure. Also the people who work there are super nice, my phone died and I needed to call an uber home and they lent me their charger for their ipad so I could order one!
author: Bill K.

description: The vegan option with half elbow and half cauliflower is the way to go! Specially if you add some mushrooms and truffle oil.
author: Somya M.
